description:
Haven't found a roll I love here yet but I have to say their raw oysters with ponzu sauce, green onions, and tobiko are one of my top favorites in terms of oysters.

The place has plenty of seating and I usually don't have to wait too long for a table. I think they charge you extra if you ask for a side of spicy mayo (which is more mayo-y than I thought it'd be) or any other sauce but appreciate that they're transparent about it.
author: Emily C.

description:
If you are not with a large party, don't expect to get your food or being served!! You order a dish and the kitchen staff makes you wait 1/2 hour.  You flag someone down, then the waiter admits the kitchen staff forgot to make the food.  

The quality of service has gone down.
author: Wayne W.

description:
My family Sunday GO-TO!
Today's my father's birthday and what better SF sushi house to go to! NORIEGA TERIYAKI HOUSE! 

Great rolls! 
Eclipse! Crunchy! Dancing Lion! Titanic! Fire & Ice Roll!
 Great tempura platters for big family gatherings and great chicken plates! 

This sushi house is my weakness! Great parking, and then we grab dessert down the street! COME & TRY
author: Ruth Awit S.

description: The teriyaki dinner for 2 is so worth it! Omg they give you so much AND you get miso soup, rice, and an ice cream. Not many places give you all of that stuff anymore. A decent Japanese food restaurant in the sunset area that definitely makes every dollar worth it.
author: Allyson L.

description: We come here all the time because the family really like this place. Some of the dishes are at least consistent but their sushi are not my favorite. The fried dishes in my opinion are, what they do best here, especially the chicken kaarage and tempura. But I have found the tempura green beans at, of all places, Habit burger, to taste the best.
author: Ry T.

description:
Ordered takeout from here tonight and sadly was disappointed.  Although service was friendly, it wasn't enough to suffice.  

The following items were ordered:

Chicken Teriyaki - included with the meal is miso soup, salad, & ice cream (even for takeout).  The portion was good.  Too bad the chicken wasn't cooked.  I had to nuke it in the microwave in order for it to be edible.  

Plain Udon - not sure what noodles they used, but it sure wasn't Udon.  

Shiitake Roll - Roll was good, but it's pretty impossible to mess up.  

Popeye Roll - spinach & shiitake. I would pass on this as it tasted off.  

Spicy Tuna Roll - Fish was way too pink.  It looked like it was dipped in food coloring.  

Spider Roll - Tasted like mud.

Aside from potentially getting food poisoning, the food was just mediocre.  It's a bummer since I finally found a place that has shiitake rolls on their menu.
author: Candice H.

description:
This place isn't too bad if you're craving a bento or some sushi.  The interior is nicely decorated with Japanese decor and is well lit with plenty of seating.  I don't think this place is that great but I don't think it's that bad either.  I had order a salmon roll on top of a salmon maki (because I just love salmon),  the salmon roll was good but I feel like they could have added a little something more.  It was salmon and avocado topped with more salmon.  The salmon maki however came as a roll with a wasabi mayo on top which added a nice touch to it.

Their bentos also look pretty good.  I got a chance to try their chicken and tempura. It's good, but nothing really stood out for me there.
author: Sherry L.

description:
DO NOT GO IF YOU HAVE ANY SHELLFISH ALLERGIES!!!!! 

I'm allergic to shellfish and asked to make sure they didn't cross contaminated with my eel. Well they did 

My $10 meal turned into a $120 meal. I ended up in the hospital with a life-threatening allergic reaction.
author: Michelle V.

description:
I came here for lunch with my boyfriend and should've went somewhere else for sushi because this place was empty. We ordered beef teriyaki, double sake roll, blizzard roll, and tiger and caterpillar roll for to go. The best thing was the beef teriyaki and that itself was mediocre. The beef was chewy and the sauce was rather salty than sweet. 

The double sake and blizzard roll comes out and it does not look appetizing at all!! The salmon on top of the double sake roll looked so sad. I decided to try that one first and I already knew it was no fresh by the first bite. It was so fishy tasting and fresh salmon will NEVER taste fishy if it's fresh. It was disgusting. The blizzard roll had salmon inside with scallops on the top. That one was okay due the the fact that there was a sauce masking the fishy taste. I still didn't like it and only had one piece. 
My dad had the tiger and caterpillar roll also said that was the worse sushi he's had in his life. So how was this lunch even worth $65?!?! That was a total rip off. I came home and two hours later I'm on the toilet with a big ol' stomachache from the old rotten salmon. I will not return or recommend this establishment.
author: Tiffany K.

description: They especialize in terryaki here. Their terryaki is really good. The sauce is great. I love the egg rolls with veggies and shrimp. The sushi rolls are really good too with big pieces of fish. Service is good and fast. It's our Sunday night place.
author: Candy Girl S.

description: This used to be my go-to sushi place. However, the last time I was there, I started to question my loyalty to this place. My bbq shrimp came out COLD and even after reheating, it lacked it's usual smoky flavor. Everything else was just mediocre. I'm not sure if this place has always been mediocre or if there was a serious decline in quality. Or perhaps, I've been exposed to tastier sushi since then and now, this no longer measures up. Whatever the case may be, I was pretty disappointed in this place.
author: Mallory L.

description:
The worst quality unagi I have ever had the horror of eating. It's so rubbery and I hope I don't get food poisoning from this.

I ordered the tiger roll, golden ox, and baked mussels. Everything is drenched in sauce which is fine because I ordered knowing that. 

Don't get anything unagi. Other fish is questionable. But their cooked entrees like teriyaki is fine. 

They are also quite pricey for this subpar quality. I feel bad for people who come here and think it's "good". I'm making the trip out to Ariake on Geary street the next time I want sushi.
author: Becca W.

description:
The service here is always cheerful, friendly and prompt. The food here is reliably good, though not terrific; they put their own spin on the cuisine. The restaurant draws a good crowd. I often order the grilled fish and sushi rolls here.

I usually come here with friends for special occasions because the place is larger, seating is comfortable and cleaner than the more humble, dive places I frequent (though the food at the dive venues may be quite good).
author: Everso T.

description:
Reason why doe the two star it's over priced for the quality of Japanese food. I haven't had a bad spider roll in a long time but this one kinda takes the cake... who puts lettuce in this roll?! A cheap filler I guess.  

What saved my experience was the gyoza. I enjoyed it but like I said it wasn't something amazing. Considering the pricing.... 
Since this place is named a "teriyaki house" the teriyaki was actually sad it didn't have that "wow this is amazing" factor

Service was fast and responsive but the decor seems to be dated/ cheesy. 

It got me full but i won't be coming back too soon. 
Hey at least your waitress is pretty and polite
author: John A.

description: I've been eating at this restaurant for 15 years today June 29, 2018 was my last day. I found hair in my sushi I took back and the manger said it's not hair it's seaweed. The cashier gave me my money back. The manager told me not come back here. I said it's fine I don't want to eat anywhere people are rude and lying saying it's seaweed.
author: Nicole G.

description:
This place is delicious! For sushi, it is not too pricey and the decor in the restaurant is beautiful. It gives off an excellent vibe and Japanese feel to the restaurant. 

I ordered the cherry blossom roll and tornado roll. The tornado roll is delicious and definitely something I would recommend everyone to try. The portion is standard for a Japanese restaurant. The food is very fresh.

Granted the service may be a bit slow (since it was very busy), the waitresses and waiters are very kind. The food comes with free ice cream (green tea is my favorite) and for the holidays, they gave me a calendar for the new year. This tipped my rating to a 5 --- the fact that you get a small gift at the end of the meal was a definite bonus! It also helps that the restaurant is truly beautiful.
author: Melinda L.

description:
After my relatives and I tried Noriega Teriyaki years and years ago, we never had a reason to go back.  The food may not have been awful, but it certainly wasn't very remarkable, let alone good.  So, imagine my surprise with how Noriega Teriyaki has suddenly become one of the go-to spots for my relatives whenever we have our impromptu get-togethers.  I mean, the only thing more surprising is how the food seems (slightly) better than I remember!

For the most part, nothing about Noriega Teriyaki stands out very much, save for the mildly random water fountain that's right in front of you when you walk in.  Both the decor and the menu are pretty typical of other teriyaki/bento box types of Japanese restaurants out there (and Chinese owned at that), but the latter does offer a wealth of choices to choose from, even if the ingredients aren't entirely authentic.

-- SPICY GRILLED SQUID...$7.95
(https://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/noriega-teriyaki-house-san-francisco?select=XmcR1haqkn-nBTwnc3tYvA)
Not quite what I had expected, but not bad.  The squid itself was pretty sizable and I thought it was cooked nicely (just the right chew to it).  That said, I thought it was a little heavy on the (unagi?) sauce, which was pretty sweet.  At least they put the sriracha on the side though (which is the only thing that made this dish "spicy").

-- CHICKEN KARAAGE LUNCH PLATE - Boneless Chicken Deep Fried and Topped with House Special Teriyaki Sauce...$8.95
(https://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/noriega-teriyaki-house-san-francisco?select=YHpaPXQ_3MHQHR7-vqeIfQ)
It's different from most other chicken karaage dishes, but I liked it!  It's akin to chicken katsu, but with much better breading, a much juicier texture, and much more flavorful (compared to my friend's chicken katsu that I tried).  What's more, the portion was fairly generous.

-- TERIYAKI DINNER SPECIAL - Tempura, Beef Teriyaki, Salmon Isobe-age, Chicken Karaage with Soup, Harukami (Imperial Rolls), Rice, and Ice Cream...$14.95 Per Person (Min. two orders)
(https://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/noriega-teriyaki-house-san-francisco?select=dBqiHkGDH2AqbVE_dgZa_g)
The menu says it's "for two", but this was more than enough for our entire table to share.  I didn't try the Salmon Isobe-age, nor the "Harukami" (seriously...imperial rolls?), but everything else was pretty decent.  The chicken karaage was tasty, the beef teriyaki was surprisingly tender, and I liked the variety and crispiness of the tempura.  Solid value for the money.

-- THE BOAT - 3 Slices each of Salmon, Tuna, and Yellowtail Sashimi, Tekka Maki, and Unagi,  Maguro, Hamachi, Ebi, Sake, Tako, Tai, and Saba Nigiri (23 Pieces Total)...$25.95
(https://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/noriega-teriyaki-house-san-francisco?select=TTnDm0Y0oQG2_bnwUtWnIA)
Overall, this was pretty mixed.  On the one hand, you get a good amount for what you pay and most of the fish was relatively fresh.  However, while the fish themselves looked fine (though the salmon sashimi wasn't the prettiest cut), a few weren't very tasty.  In particular, I wasn't high on the Tai Nigiri, Saba Nigiri, and Tuna Sashimi.

-- BLIZZARD ROLL - Fresh Salmon, Avocado, and Tamago topped with Scallop, Ikura, Wasabi Tobiko, and Mayo...$12.95
(https://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/noriega-teriyaki-house-san-francisco?select=Yi4lSzIyx8Fnnk_COyP5zw)
Ehh...this was okay.  It was cool how big the pieces of tamago were, but they overpowered the salmon inside the roll.  The scallops were nice though and I liked how the wasabi sauce added some potency too, which might have been a bit bland/delicate otherwise.

-- SPIDER RAINBOW ROLL - Soft Shelled Crab topped with Tuna, Red Snapper, Mackerel, and Masago...$9.45
(https://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/noriega-teriyaki-house-san-francisco?select=edzmm-SCSqYhcCjX_teTOQ)
Given how it combines two classic rolls, I can see why this is one of their more popular rolls.  Still, I thought it was just okay.  The crab was decently meaty and was fried up to a nice crispness, but I didn't care much for their choice of fish to top the fish.  

Although the food many not have impressed, the service here is great, as it's been both fast and friendly every time I've been here.  That said, it's still all about the food.  While there are definitely better places out there to satisfy your bento box/teriyaki urges, you could definitely do worse (like with Balboa Teriyaki...).  Just stick with the hot/cooked foods, as the sushi/sashimi feels a little hit or miss to me.
author: Mike L.

description:
Came here for lunch to celebrate friends' birthdays since it seemed to be one of the few places that was opened around 2pm. The wait for four sushi rolls was quite long and although the taste was alright, I'm not sure if the meal was entirely worth the price. 

Irrelevant to the ranting: Although we knew it was a long shot, we asked about birthday perks (there are none for those who are wondering haha).
author: Joanne H.

description:
This is a good place to satisfy your casual sushi cravings. 

Good service, lots of seating, and you get a good amount for what you pay for. 

I tried the sashimi platter last week, gyoza for appetizer, and had some sake. I'd come back.
author: Corinna T.

description: Decent quality, great quantity. Eating it tastes like very well made Japanese food with Chinese style. California roll in dinner combo wasn't good. Tempura and chicken teriyaki were good. Tonkatsu and beef teriyaki were also good.
author: Wesley K.

description: First time here and arrived on Saturday at 6:00 pm. The place was packed . Ordered the dragon roll, ikura and hamachi . Their rolls are huge.  The fish is not the freshest . You can taste the slim in the ikura and maguro. Servce was very good . Food came out fast . This place won't my first choice. I would give it another try in the future.
author: Joe L.

description:
Ugh.. food is really nasty, udon noodle quality is from cheap Chinese wanna be Japanese food nothing like traditional. 
I'm so sad to give them a low star but they have to work on their food quality. 
Even sushi rice isn't cooked properly sometimes.
author: Stella K.

description:
I've been here a couple times and everything is still consistent from the service to the food. 

We usually order dinners, and not the sushi. The only sushi that I can vouch for is the California roll, which is pretty decent. 

I got veggie tempura before, but it is usually greasy and oily so I get kind of tired of it. This time I got the Ramen, I have to say it was pretty good. The only problem is that it comes out too hot, so to like eat the broth you have to wait a while for it to cool down.

The other dishes that we ordered were fine, everything had flavor and were served at a good temperature. Miso soup is OK, and I enjoy their green tea and coffee ice cream.
author: Spencer H.

description: My favorite sushi place of all time! Everything here is so good! My favorite dish is the beef teriyaki bento box (the meat is so tender) some of my favorite rolls is the symphony roll, eclipse, dragon, and titanic. I definitely recommend this place. The service is great as well and the atmosphere is tranquil.
author: Jessica T.

description: I only ever ordered sushi here with my family and the sushi tastes pretty good for its price. This is my family's go to spot for decent sushi at a decent price. I also love sashimi and the price is pretty good for the amount that you get! Also, the waiters and waitresses I have encountered so far eating here have been nice. I can't speak about their other food but I would recommend this place if you don't want to drop a lot of money on sushi but still want decent sushi!
author: Erica L.

description: I am new to San Francisco and I have tried several Japanese restaurants but have not found anything decent. However, my friend recommended that I try Noriega Teriyaki House and I was very satisfied with the sushi. The sushi has a great rice to fish balance which has been difficult to find. This place is a great small mom and pop shop and I would definitely come by again!
author: Kat H.

description: My neighbor likes this spot and knows the owners. I decided to try Noriega Teriyaki with my mother. We ate a lot of Chinese food in Sunset. I wanted to have Japanese this time. We shared the teriyaki and tempura combo. We shared the spider rainbow roll. This place is pretty good. Prices are decent. I wonder what could make it stand out more..oh but they do serve wonton noodle soup.
author: Denise C.

description:
One of two sushi spots that I go to. I usually go in the morning, right when they open because there's no wait but if you're coming here for dinner, there may or may not be a wait depending on how many people you have. The customer service is always great. They make sure your tea always have water and they always make sure to ask how you like your food. 
My go to roll is the fire n ice roll. It is the BOMB!!! If you haven't tried it, you have to! It is a cooked roll because Im not a fan of eating raw fish. 
Overall, I always have an excellent experience when I eat here.
author: Theresa K.

description: Food is consistent. Price is fair. Opens at 11. Service could be sped up but whatever
author: Eddie C.

description: This place is fun, friendly and great for families. The decor is wonderfully retro and prices are SF-low. You can find better sushi, but there aren't too many Japanese restaurants in SF that deliver a laid back dining experience at a reasonable price that's also good for kids.
author: Matt V.

description: This place is good for simply bento boxes and sushi. Nothi ng special or to write no one about, but they are friendly and have good prices. The parkijng in the are a can be difficult so plan to drive around.
author: Andrew M.

description:
I was at a clinic nearby and a few of us decided to get Japanese for lunch. We stumbled upon this place and chose to give it a try - it's a rather spacious restaurant with Japanese decor. The staff was pretty welcoming and we were quickly seated as the restaurant was not even half full.

The food:
Salmon teriyaki: I prefer my salmon cooked to more of a broil - with a slightly crispy outside and tender inside. The salmon here was rather overcooked, and rather uniform in texture, lacking the crispy exterior.
Teriyaki lunch special: Three of us in the group ordered this ginormous lunch special including vegetable and shrimp tempura, chicken karaage, and beef teriyaki. The tempura batter was on a bit too thick, so it took away from my enjoyment of the tempura. However, the portions were quite generous. The chicken karaage was overly battered as well, and was less like chicken karaage and rather more like a katsu. The beef teriyaki had overcooked beef that was thinly sliced. Overall, portions were great, but the food was mediocre. Display was entertaining and it was fun to snapchat to your friends the ginormous stack of fried food.

Overall, the food was average, perhaps a bit below average, but service and decor was nice. The restaurant was comfortable to enjoy lunch at and not too noisy or overcrowded. I will probably be back if I am working at the nearby clinic again, but likely to try something other than the fried food as the group of us got a bit sick from all the grease of tempura + "karaage" at the end of our meal.
author: Michael L.

description:
food was pretty good! the ice cream was very cold that my spoon can just stab it in there and pull it out becomes a Popsicle.
it is not cheap. 
i wanted chicken teriyaki but they gave me teriyaki chicken.
author: Victor C.

description: Visiting sf and had a dinner here on the day arrived. Luckily they accept credit card! I had sashimi combo meal. First time had oysters with sashimi. That's interesting! They also had lettuces on top of shredded big root.  The fish taste fresh, the green tea is strong but house Sake taste much better when drink it cold which was hot when brought to the table. So, if you want to have Sake with your meal ask for not to heat it unless they changed brand of their house Sake.
author: Jun T.

description: The chicken teriyaki was very good. I like how it comes as a meal that even includes ice cream. Price is a little high but you are getting quite a lot of food. Service was not as friendly as normal tonight but I still enjoy this restaurant.
author: James K.

description: This place is an amazing Japanese spot here in SF. Unlike other Japanese restaurants this place is larger, and so are their portions! You're served hot tea when you're seated and we didn't have to wait to be seated for long either, it seems there's always someone to watch the door to greet guests. The service was prompt and friendly, Aaron was our server and (one of the managers?) Alvin was very personable as well. Their dessert was delicious and there was a lot of options to choose from. Try their tiramisu! And their titanic roll. New favorite sushi place when we go out to the city.
author: Chloe R.

description:
The food here is really good, so if you don't care about the service too much ...I would recommend coming here. 

Some of my favorite dishes here are the sashimi combinations, seared tuna, poke tuna, and various sushi rolls, such as the double sake roll,  rainbow roll, dragon roll, double tuna roll, spicy tuna roll, and many more rolls. Their appetizers are also delicious such as, Hamachi kama, baked mussels, baked scallops, and tuna tartar.

The service is either a hit or miss depending on who is serving you. There are times when the service here is great, yet other times where it is cold, and the staff seems nonchalant.
author: Emily G.

description: Came here because it's close to our house and we had nothing to eat!  Ordered a large sake, a chicken karage salad and a sashimi deluxe combo. First of all even when  the sake arrived in a wooden container of hot water - the sake wasn't hot enough. I like it really hot!  The salad is my favorite. Just right and plenty of chicken. They used to serve it with strawberries. Now they serve it with cucumbers. The sashimi was 3 pieces of maguro, 3 salmon, 3 hamachi and 3 oysters. Just right. Could have ate more but was just the right amount.
author: Donna L.

description: I love how inviting and welcoming the servers are!! They make you feel like you are welcomed and they are extremely friendly! The food is also extremely delicious! I personally love the dragon roll, salmon teriyaki, and beef teriyaki! Everything is cooked perfectly nothing is overcooked and dry! I also enjoy the dessert very much! The green tea ice cream has such a strong matcha flavor and reminds me of authentic Japanese ice cream. Overall I would definitely come back!
author: Carissa C.

description: I've been here a lot last year, i love the food and it was so close to my house. However, the service is getting worse... and price is higher everyday. Guess what.. $5 for an extra bowl of rice (small size of course)... If your service is good, you can charge whatever you want, but you're not there yet.
author: Minh H.

description: I am really sad over how downhill this restaurant has become. I've been coming here since the 80's. For awhile, I thought it was just hit or miss because maybe the chef had the day off. But I've been coming here almost every Saturday for dinner with my mom. She likes one thing: the beef teriyaki dinner. She likes the pickled cucumber. She likes the salad even though the lettuce is always water-logged and or scantily dressed. And loves the ice cream that comes with it even if it is freezer burned or coated in ice. I have tried every category of food on the menu: entrees with meat that is overcooked and taste old and dry, sushi rolls with weird textured and flavorless rice with little filling, sashimi that smells and tastes old, and bland udon/ramen noodles. Even my old favorite chicken Kara age is not the same. Chicken seems boiled, then battered and fried. Super dry and they are getting skimpy with the teriyaki sauce which helps to flavor and moisten the meat. Tempura has really gotten nasty too. It used to be light, airy batter with good crunch. Now, batter thick, dry and chewy. What happened?! You used to be high quality and good value. Now you're overpriced with lousy food.
author: Carrie W.

description:
The place is a little bit busy.
I was wondering when my dad asked me to eat here, is the place has good food?
YEA! Of course!
The place is clean.
Quick service while there was a lot of people too!
Friendly server.
Reasonable price.
GOOD FOOD.
I ordered the agedashi tofu, salmon plate, and sushi.
ALL GREAT!
The fried banana dessert is fantastic too!
Definitely come back for more!
author: Candice L.

description:
Normally excellent service from them. We usually get take out.
However, this time, my Alaska Roll was missing the ikura and mayo on top.
author: Ryann L.

description:
Good for lunch & dinner. A great neighborhood spot on Noriega, which has plenty of restaurants to choose from. With that said, there is a better restaurant in terms of taste and quality of food/drink overall, closer to 19th ave (forget the name, sorry) However, Noriega Teriyaki House is great for takeout, and for large parties. The restaurant itself is very spacious, can accommodate a lot of diners, and has fairly quick service. 

Now, the food itself isn't terrible. Their tempura is delicious, and I usually get their salmon teriyaki dinner which is great too. This place to me has always been more quantity than quality, and the food is average with huge portions for really reasonable prices. 

If you're in the area and want some Japanese food, this place is a great option. A neighborhood spot that I will continue to order takeout from because it's quick, reliable, and friendly.
author: Taylor M.

description:
SERVICE:
Good service 5/5.  The female servers were very nice and attentive.  They would ask several times if everything was ok.  

I'm giving 2 stars for this review for the food.  

FOOD:

Teriyaki Special lunch $26.50

 - The tempura was just ok.  Some of the pieces were not fried enough so they were soggy.  The Teriyaki beef was thicker pieces which was nice but it was not grilled long enough so it didn't have a nice grill taste.  The Chicken karage was temperature hot and crispy on some pieces and soggy for other pieces.  

The Tiger Roll $10.95 was ok.
author: J W.

description:
Came here with a group of friends for a going away dinner. She made a reservation for a 6:30 dinner for about 15 people. The venue was spacious and was able to seat probably 20+ groups of people. 

I ordered the Emperor's New Roll and the Golden Ox Roll. The Emperor's New Roll had really great fresh fish and I found the sauces used to be quite flavorful! The Golden Ox Roll is my absolute favorite here, the deliciously grilled beef they topped this roll of was seasoned well and also had amazing flavors incorporated together! 

The customer service was good and attentive but when it came to paying the bill I think there was an error with ours because I think the amount of cash we put in was counted wrong and they overcharged the two credit cards that were suppose to split the rest of the bill. I guess 2 out of 3 things that I look into when trying out new places aren't too bad.
author: Michele W.

description: Normally, both thumbs up. We are regulars and it's a convenient go-to place.  But today took us off guard with customer service.  We ate about $60 worth of food and asked for a small to-go box, the size that holds one single roll.  They said if we ordered a new roll, we could have the box. I totally get "those are rules". We were just surprised that after $60, the 10c box was impossible.  This is totally a first-world-problems vent. I acknowledge that.  We were just surprised.
author: Sara O.

description: I've been going to Noriega Teriyaki for over 20 years. On 1/5/18, I placed an order for pick up and spent over $50. When I got home, I realized that my sashimi was awful! 16 pieces of salmon, uncleaned with the skin still on. It was so unappetizing. I called the restaurant and was hung up on when they said they were getting the manager. When I called back and spoke to the manager she went back and forth telling me that the next time I had to ask to have the skin removed, which is ridiculous. Who does that? Sashimi is supposed to be clean! Then she tells me to come back (an hour trip) to get a replacement. Absolutely not..it's 8:00pm and I should not have to do this! I keep telling her that I will send her the photos of the sashimi and I'm simply asking for a refund for the sashimi.  She said there's no way for her to get the photos and she would not be able to issue a refund. Well, I made it easy for her. Here are the photos and although I'm clearly not getting a refund, hopefully this will deter them from ever serving fish like this again!!!
author: Tami A.

description: This is probably my favorite sushi place. Any time I come there I enjoy food. Everything is fresh and delicious. Service could be better, but it is not 5 star restaurant. Prices are reasonable . Go and try!!!
author: Viktor K.

description: My sister use to love this place and when she came home for the holidays she really wanted to eat here. Sadly she asked if it's always been mediocre or did they have a serious decline in quality. Her BBQ shrimp was one of her favorite dishes but this time around they were cold and I had to ask the waiter to reheat it and even when it was warmed up she said it lacked flavor. I had the shitake maki and it was good but then again it's nothing special. I also had the fish cake udon and it's actually just fish cake and udon noodles. They don't even have green onions or any kind of extra garnish. Kinda lame since I've never had any udon or Ramen that just came so bare minimum. Anyways my sister was disappointed at the teriyaki house and she said it didn't meet her expectations and I've never been a huge fan so it's no biggie to me.
author: Yvonne L.

description: This place used to be decent , I've been coming here for years and now it seems like the quality has depleted .. I don't think I will be coming here anymore ...
author: Jimmy D.

description:
Large portions of fresh sushi/sashimi and delicious teriyaki for reasonable prices! Some favorites include the beef teriyaki, emperors new roll, fire & ice roll, and hamachi/albacore sashimi. 

We love the home-y atmosphere and friendly staff. What we love even more is that they're open 364 days a year (only closed on Thanksgiving), so when most restaurants are closed for Christmas, you can count on NTH for a great late-night meal.
author: Adam Y.

description:
This place is great when you come at the right time. I've been here several times since last year and there are times when the rolls are perfectly made and other times when they are incredibly sloppy. I think it has something to do with the new kid working as a sushi chef, if he doesn't learn soon I may stop coming to this spot. The place is decently priced and the fish always tastes fresh regardless of how the roll is prepared. 

Lots of the rolls are drizzled in mayo, which I'm not a fan of. So if you don't like mayo make sure to ask for it without. 

I always sit at the bar and the service is great. Haven't tried the tables so I can't comment on it.
author: Heidi H.

description: Didn't have to wait tonight and usually don't have to. Super friendly service, which is always a plus. Today, I ordered the chicken karaage salad because my friend recommended it and why not be sort of healthy hahahhaa. The sauce on it was bomb though and my friend got the chicken karaage dinner, which is similar but the sauce is different and of course the portion is bigger I think. I couldn't finish the entire salad, but it was close enough. Ended the night with green tea ice cream because it came with the dinner and it's bomb as always. I've never had a bad experience here yet, so it'll remain four stars. I usually come here and get a good amount of rolls and some of them satisfy my cravings
author: Maggie W.

description: Cute decor inside, very welcoming and homey! Ordered veggie tempura and Cali roll. Food was good... nothing mind blowing, although I do recommend if you're looking for this type of cuisine in the area. Restaurant seemed clean, and service is nice!
author: Hoku L.

description:
I really enjoy this place. I always seem to end up arriving to late to be seated so I opt for take out. It is clean and the staff are so friendly and helpful. 

The sushi is really quite good, especially their spicy rolls. The only subpar roll was the tempura spicy tuna roll - too much batter, but why did I order that in the first place? The raw fish rolls are really nice combinations. I love that they offer a full-size salad. Edamame for the kids is fresh. 

My only other qualm is that sometimes the tempura veggie plate is soggy. I have to remember to order extra crispy or else the kids won't touch it. California Maki for kids is great as long as they pack separate away from the extra spicy rolls. 

I've been here twice in two weeks so obviously it's a new treat!
author: Monique P.

description: I've been coming here for years and decided to write this review. I always order the Salmon Isobe-Age Dinner $11.45  (Salmon rolled w/ seaweed, deep fried, and topped w/ special sauce). Haven't found another Japanese restaurant that has this. The salmon portions are generous. It comes w/ shitake mushrooms, carrots, and corn. You get miso soup, salad, rice and ICE CREAM! When you enter you see this cute mini pond. The staff are super friendly and my food was cooked on time, even on a busy Saturday evening. This is a nice family-friendly restaurant!
author: Lyric A.

description:
I ate here last night and I already want to come back!  

Usually I order dinner combinations/ bento boxes when dining at Japanese restaurants, but decided to try out the rolls here instead! We got the double sake and the eclipse roll. BOTH WERE DELICIOUS! For those salmon lovers out there, definitely get the double sake. It comes with 8 pieces and is seriously sake heaven! Generous portions of salmon on the inside and the outside! We decided to try something that we had never heard of before, and got the eclipse roll too. IT WAS DELICIOUS. I was so happy ahahah. Also really pretty! Make sure you eat  each piece in one bite, though. That way you can really taste all the flavors and textures together. 

Can't wait to try other rolls here!
author: Sandy Y.

description:
Came here on a Friday night at like 8:30pm.. I was surprised to see that it was still pretty busyyy :o

First time here.. shared two rolls! One was a baked salmon roll and the other one had smoked salmon on top. I forgot the names but both rolls were good. 

I've never tried a roll with smoked salmon before and I was definitely surprised with how the roll tasted.  It was really tasty! The sauce on top gave it a nice kick and a little sweet flavor. And the sauce for the baked salmon was not overly sweet, which I liked. The salmon was moist. 

Left with a happy tummy :)

I would come again to try different rolls and their bento boxes.
author: Kimberly H.

description: Tried the chicken yakitori. You get 3 skewers of small chicken breast pieces, onion and red bell pepper with some teriyaki sauce on the bottom. It's served with salad, steamed rice and miso soup which was a bit watery. Just ok. Attentive service.
author: Review L.

description:
It's really more like 3.5, but I like to be generous. 

I like they have large pots of tea. I love tea. 

Really good: the size of their rolls.  Really really big. 

I didn't love the Giants roll. Just didn't quite seem fresh. The tuxedo roll - The one with scallops on top - was really good. And then the hamachi tempura roll was just crazy. It was deep fried. Really filling but the fish flavor wasn't as good as others. 

I very much enjoyed my red tuna sashimi. But I always do.

It's sushi. So it costs more than one wants it to. I'll be honest. It's gonna be very hard for me to find the 5 star sushi place just cause of price....
author: Sarah C.

description:
I usually come here with my parents and brother, and we share a salad and a few rolls, family style! The chicken karage salad is really good here. The lettuce is fresh, the dressing is awesome and they actually give you a good amount of it, and the chicken is always perfectly crispy and hot! They also give you a pretty large portion of chicken (check the picture!) and I think this salad is pretty cheap, around $8. Anyway, the rolls here are pretty good and they have a wide selection. My parents and I really like the blizzard roll, which is a special one they have with salmon, avocado, tamago, and topped with scallop and tobiko. Definitely get this one! We've also tried the emperor's new roll which is great as well! I've also tried the nabeyaki udon that comes with seafood which is perfect on a cold day.

Good japanese food and close to my house, so will definitely be back here again.
author: Tara A.

description: I love coming here because the service is fast, the food is great due to big portion size.
author: Jenny O.

description:
I am going to help you.  Yes, you.  Get the following:

- Tuna Tartar...maybe get two orders, a little spicy..but life needs some spice at times.
- Hamachi Kama...fish oils to help the internal ticker..will take time to eat as you look for meaty morsels hidden behind bone, cartilage, and skin.   Brings out the maggot in you.
- Quails Nest....spoon of raw shrimp and other tasty sea type stuff.
- Double Sake Roll....salmon lover's delight.  A Sake Sake Roll.

 Good service, clean restaurant, and plenty of street parking.
author: Scott L.

description: Haven't had Japanese food in a while.  So having tempura and beef teriyaki that tasted like food I've had before was fine.  It seems like all Miso soups are the same.  What I'm getting at is this restaurant is perfectly fine and I noticed that other peoples sushi platters looked good as well.  No complaints from anyone and this is a good neighborhood restaurant.  My wife had lunch at the Palace Hotel (you can see the negative reviews on Yelp) and she preferred her lunch here.  Someone commented the beef was fatty but I thought it was just right.
author: Mike C.

description: Everything got worst lately, finger in the slice cucumber bowl while serving, most rolls we order taste the same, beef teriyaki were tough, soup taste more Chinese than Japanese, we were rush to make room for the next turnover, worst of all I got sick afterward.
author: Joseph E.

description: I have been here two times in my life. One time 5 years ago, one time last week. When I walked in I instantly remembered this place like I was walking in 5 years ago. Nothing has changed and not in a bad way. We ordered the special plate that the whole table must order. It was amazing. Just like I remembered. I will come back for it again. So much food for a great price.
author: T G.

description:
On Christmas Eve, my friends and I decided to go to Noriega Teriyaki House for dinner. It's one of our favorite places because the food is good and not expensive. When you walk in, one of the first thing you notice is a little fountain with water. I love this restaurant because it really gives you a Japanese feel. There are bamboos lining some of the walls and used as decoration.

Normally, we'd each order an entree like chicken teriyaki, chicken katsu, or chirashi bowl and then order a roll or two to share. But this time, since I wasn't feeling too hungry, I opted just for rolls. I ordered the spicy scallop roll and the Pacific Roll. The spicy scallop roll wasn't too impressive. It's a basic roll with scallop wrapped inside and topped with a sriracha and mayo drizzle and green onions. What I did love was the Pacific Roll. Inside are lightly deep fried scallops. The rolls are topped with shrimp, avocado, and teriyaki sauce with tobiko. It's really worth the try.

We also ordered a Tropical Roll to share. It's filled with eel and crab topped with avocado and mango. However, since it's winter and mango is out of season, the mango didn't look as amazing as it normally does. It still tastes good though.

My friends ordered a chirashi bowl and a chicken katsu entree. These orders come with a miso soup at the beginning and a free scoop of ice cream at the end. Definitely worth it to try. I don't eat raw fish so I don't know how those taste, but I've had chicken katsu and chicken teriyaki before and I know those are good. It's very filling because they give you a lot of meat. Most of the time, I don't even touch the rice because the meat, salad, and soup are enough to make me full. 

The service was pretty good. They came by to check up on us often. The restaurant was busy so I thought it was nice that they came by often 

I definitely recommend the Pacific Roll if you go here. I haven't been disappointed!
author: Andrea G.

description:
If there's one thing that this cat enjoys, it's having the family together, and what better way to celebrate the occasion than to try a new restaurant! 

Noriega teriyaki house is a larger size restaurant and we were lucky to come in when it was not too busy. We were seated and sever tea and menus promptly. The menu here is pretty diverse in comparison to some other Japanese restaurants, but there wasn't too much that I would consider very different or unique. 

I suddenly spotted a roll that was basically named after me? "Fighting cheetah roll!" This sounded very interesting and obviously was a roll after my heart. I decided on getting that as well as the Unaju dinner. 

I would note that it did take a while for a server to come by and take our order, which was surprising as it was not very busy, but it was a small issue. 

Food arrived quite quickly and the rolls came about after. All in all everything was pretty good. The Eel was well cooked although I wish there had been not so much rice. The fighting cheetah roll was very good! Although it was a bit heavy on the sauce. All in all, the food was quite decent and serving sizes were good. Also, presentation was quite nice as well. 

I would say that this place made this cat happy, although it was a bit pricy in the end. I'll likely stop by again in the future for a visit. ^ ^

*chirp!*
author: Jei C.

description: This is our favorite local haunt. We go at least a couple of times a month. They offer AWESOME original rolls, Bumblebee and Silver Fox to name a couple. And the ambiance is charming.
author: Katherine P.

description:
Noriega Teriyaki used to get really crowded by 7pm whether it was a weeknight or weekend. This place isn't the first on my list when it comes to having sushi, but they do have some bomb ass chicken karaage. If you're craving for some chicken karaage and don't feel like waiting in line, here's your spot.

Let's talk about the chicken karaage. It's a piece of thigh meat deep fried with the perfect batter. Its flavorful, it's crispy, and doesn't feel greasy. The batter is light and still tastes great even the next day. A sweet and salty sauce is drizzled over the pieces of chicken and is served with a salad and rice. This dish has tasted the same ever since I started coming to this establishment years ago. 

The reason why I can't give Noriega Teriyaki 5 stars is because their sushi isn't always the best. Some days tastes better than others. I will say that their rolls are pretty large.

Service is hit or miss. The waiters and waitresses are always friendly, but that's if they ever come by your table.
author: Cheryl Q.

description: Food was ok. Like any Japanese restaurant their food presentation is excellent. I probably would have rated it a little better hadn't it been for my experience last night. Picture this, you're wearing a suit, your favorite might I add, having a nice dinner, ordered a sushi boat while the other person you're dining with orders a dinner special... don't mind that mine was a good $28 that came by itself, while my friends dinner came with an appetizer, soup 2 entrees, rice and ice cream all for $16, I'm like, what the heck.. but fine. Here comes a waitress, not even my server who grabs my empty sushi boat and the mini appetizer saucer that had a FISH SAUCE dipping sauce, grabs it hastily and of course showered over me and my suit. The server apologizes and grabs a wet napkin, at that point I was already annoyed, she asked if I would want a towel with soap?!? Who asks that to clean a suit? Just total annoyance.
author: Jan R.

description:
In a nutshell, I come here for the rolls!  Some of the raw fish is a bit hit or miss, so I wouldn't necessarily go for the sashimi, but they work well in the rolls. All their sushi rolls are large, and usually comes topped with sauce.  I've tried the eclipse, golden gate, dragon, Milky Way, double sake, and quails nest. My favorites are the Milky Way, double sake, and quails nest! 

Milky Way has tobiko, sake, crab meat, squid, and unagi. It's wrapped in soy paper instead of nori, and doesn't have rice. One of the most unique rolls I've ever tried. 

Double sake has salmon on the inside and outside, and comes with a lot of good quality salmon! 

Quails nest isn't a roll, but comes served on two spoons. It comes with amaebi, a quail egg, ponzu sauce, green onions, tobiko, and spicy sauce. You eat the entire spoonful, and it all blends perfectly in your mouth together! 

Service here was pretty good. They usually seat me right away, and check up on us every so often.  

I have yet to try many other things in their menu other than the sushi rolls, but I've been so happy with the rolls that I don't really want to try much else. :)
author: Kay A.

description:
Noreiga Terikayi House is definitely chinese owned so i skipped the chirashi (16.95). went for cooked japanese food. 
large seating location. large menu with rolls, ramen, udon, appetizers, nigiri, combs et. al. 

eats: tempera and chicken karaage lunch combo(10.95)
-cucumber salad, 3 refrigerated pieces, bland dressing
-miso soup, obviously made from packaged mix, couldn't finished, strange taste
-tempera, ok, too much breading
-"chicken karaage" actually chicken katsu, sliced like it , dry, bland meat
asked waitress if the chicken katsu was chicken karaage
only dipping sauce for tempera, none for katsu, i.e. katsu served as karaage.
2.5 stars

temaki:
-good value BUT
-wait staff doesn't know they are serving
kitchen also, or maybe it's deliberate
-took pics but no time to figure how to upload/download...
-music in background, not sure if it was japanese or not.
author: Victor G.

description: Noriega Teriyaki House has never let us down. Whether it is just the 3 of us or 18 to 20 in the party, the staff and food is right on. They're always very friendly and the food is delicious. We've been here so many times that we lost count. Last night we celebrated our daughters 10th Birthday with the extended family and everyone enjoyed their meals and there were nothing but praises. Thank you Noriega Teriyaki House and staff for making last so memorable.
author: Cheryl W.

description:
Seriously, don't bother.

It's always painful to see this kind of business taking a very proud and respectful culture's cuisine and doing such disrespect to it.

Let's begin with the old gray cucumber served with some glowing viscous yellow slurp. I was scared, I lifted up the top slice and had to taste just one slice. And as I thought, it was horrible.

Then I tried the gyoza, a traditional Japanese appetizer. Isn't it interesting how pot stickers and gyoza can be confused?? Exactly, they're pot stickers, not gyoza.

Two strikes..

Then I was possessed to try the Chasu Ramen. As expected, dish water broth, pork boiled in something water based. Overcooked tasteless egg. Black woodear mushrooms.

Ok, I'm offended that you've made a mockery of Japanese food. If you're going to have a Japanese restaurant, then do the honor of making the very best possible. San Francisco has some of the very best food in the US. Did you really feel like you were offering food worthy of peoples hard earned money?

Do your very best and be proud, or go work for someone else.
author: Perry V.

description: A nice neighborhood Japanese restaurant. The menu is comprehensive. Quality is average. Price is reasonable.
author: Lily L.

description: I had the tonkatsu dinner and shrimp tempera roll but got really bad food poisoning. It is the last time I eat at this restaurant.
author: Paul P.

description: In the middle of our eating we found a fruit fly in our meal. All the waiter did was say sorry and said if we want to box the Rest of it. I still had to pay whole amount for the fruit fly food.
author: Linda L.

description: Hit or miss.  But mostly miss.  Eaten here too many times to count, but after my last take out order I will never go back.  Inedible, more fat than meat, more breading than meat.  Sushi is always falling apart before I get it home...
author: Ems G.

description:
Placed an order for the Fancy Roll Tray and other food for take out.  The total for my order appeared higher than what I anticipated.  

I went back online and looked at the prices that is on their website and did the math.  I was over charged $20.00.  I called them back and it turns out their Fancy Roll Tray is now $110.00.  The catering/party menu they have online shows $88.00.  To make matters worse, their old take out menu shows $88.00 for 72 pieces, now it's reduced to 62 pieces.  

I said they have an outdated menu online and they should honor what's posted.  They did not and instead of making some money, I canceled my entire order.

Very deceiving!!
author: Ernest Y.

description: Sorry, it pains me, but it is the truth. I've been going to this place for soooo long. When it first revamped their menu a long time ago, it was great. If you order teri-beef, it was like rib eye, and they asked you how you'd like it cooked. Now the beef quality is sub par and not very tasty. Other bbq items don't seem to have the original char and just bland. One of my favorite rolls, the Solar Flare Roll, they no longer carry either. The other rolls were just kinda so-so.  The tempura is no light int texture, but hard. Place is kinda getting runned down.
author: Ming W.

description:
2.5 stars.

I finally got to try this place after hella years.
ordered:
-tonkatsu dinner-- I figured, I order this all the time with my ramen.. yeah.. not the same. The portion was HUGE. BUT the meat.. was meh. I'd pass. It came with ice cream though. yum, I love ice cream.
-nabeyaki udon-- I don't know if this should count as udon. The udon I've had in the past were of a thicker size, but this was was thinner.. but then again, maybe it's handmade... probably not. Soup was good, though. It came in a cute little cauldron pot.
-salmon sashimi-- super fresh, really yummy and buttery
-hamachi sashimi-- was also really fresh and good
-quail's nest-- this was hella good. best thing. too bad there were only two spoons and my BF loves all the same food that I love.. sigh.
author: Leslie C.

description:
FINALLY a place that has ginormous sushi pieces!
--------
Christmas Evening; 5:30 pm; party of 20.

Came with the bf and his relatives for a holiday get together.

80% capacity; we got the only separated party room

Low music; AC kept the room cool; plenty of waiters

Service: great, our server was young, quick, funny and when he needed backup he didn't hesitate to grab another person to help him grab food to us. Being able to take the orders of 20 people and remember where the orders go once they arrive is quite a feat!

Ordered: chicken udon, Gyoza, panda roll, fire and ice roll, dragon roll, fortune roll

Chicken udon was delicious, came with a lot of meat and the broth wasn't some run down, reused soup. Gyoza is like any other place's.

Rolls of recommendation:
Panda Roll: if you like sashimi, unagi, and SPICYY rolls. 
Fire and Ice Roll: if you like squid. It's chewy.
Fortune Roll: another one for the sashimi-lovers.

Also, it helps that they have very nice menus. Pictures always help with the ordering process! This place isn't in my neighborhood but I definitely would come again. Great place for a big party.
author: Rose L.

description: We've been regulars at this spot for a long time and have recommended it to many friends. Today we ordered delivery and the woman on the phone was very friendly, helpful and efficient.
author: Ellie S.

description: This place gives you a huge portion, which is not necessarily a positive statement. Unfortunately, the food lacks quality and a it would be disgrace to call this Japanese food.
author: p h.

description:
Good tasting sushi. The portions are big so don't order too much or u might explode. A good variety to choose from.

Service is great. It reminds me of tag team wrestling when waiters help each other out with customers; fun to watch.

Glad this is in the neighborhood
author: Billy C.

description: I've never been to the restaurant in person but have gotten takeout a bunch of times. The rolls here are pretty solid and cheaper compared to other places that do delivery. Delivery minimum is only $15 and is very reliable. I like the hamachi roll here a lot.
author: Sherry L.

description: I've been here a few times before but finally got around to doing a review. Anyways, I came here with my boyfriend for lunch today. He ordered the beef teriyaki luncheon and I had the chicken katsu luncheon. We also ordered the caterpillar roll and the dancing lion roll (not pictured). All of it was so yummy and the rolls were a decent size! The waitresses were also really nice. Definitely one of my go-to places if I'm ever craving Japanese food. :)
author: Coco L.

description:
This has been by far one of the best sushi restaurant experiences I have had so far in San Francisco. The wait time isn't very long, the sushi is always good, the service is on point but most of all, the cost to eat there is very affordable. 

I have had experience both sitting down in the restaurant and ordering take out. The sit in experience is a very good one with the restaurant being very large and holding a very sizable amount of people. It's definitely bigger than most of the other sushi restaurants I've been to in the city. The menu is also very diverse, offering everything from nigiri sushi rolls, special rolls, ramen, teriyaki chicken and even curry! It's all delicious. My take out experience was also very positive with the order taking only 20 minutes to make. 

Overall, I highly recommend this place if you're looking for an affordable sushi experience.
author: Jeremy S.

description:
Finally took the plunge and walked one block to this place. 

Was in the mood for some sushi with a friend, and I always drive and walk past here. 
The greater/host was a very friendly kid who was quick to do all things, clean, bring tea, and was very respectful. 

The place itself is kind of cool inside with a large sushi bar. We kept it simple with  seaweed salad to start off with(which I loved) and just 2 rolls. A spicy tuna roll, and the Alaska roll. My friend isn't big on sushi so she had the tuna roll. The Alaska roll was heavy and delicious. It was huge and I couldn't finish it!! Maybe not the best sushi spot, but very good, and very reasonable prices. 

All washed down with a beer, wish they had draft though :(
author: Benjamin B.

description:
I must have walked by here and never noticed it.  We came here for a school dinner.  They put us in this narrow rectangular room in the back.  A lot of us had our backs against the wall because it was that narrow in the room.

We had a variety of sushi, tempura, teriyaki and tonkatsu. Food was done right.  plentiful and good.

Service was good.  They didn't forget us even though we were tucked inside a room.

Parking is bad in the area..
author: Wendy H.

description: I like the place. I like amount of food you get for your money. Been here many times, and will be back again. Good service, waiter check on you pretty often. Big pot of green tea on the house. Not to loud. Plenty of free parking outside of the restaurant. Convenient location. When you pick up food to go - don't forget to ask for extra soy souse.
author: Clovis L.

description: Here's the deal: Make an appointment across the street to have your oil changed at the Sunset 76  ( best deal and a true blue quality Station in SF) and go to Teriyaki House for a great lunch. Wonderful lunch specials, under $10 - fresh, yummy sushi, and great service. See the other 450 reviews for menu suggestions.
author: Kae D.

description:
*Atmosphere: you walk in and you immediately see a mini Japanese like fountain in front of you. On the right is the sushi bar but you are seated on the left side of the room. It has a simple feel.

*Food: we ordered a chicken don (chicken rice with egg on top). I find this dish to be a bit odd. There was not enough meat and not enough flavor sinked into the rice. The chicken was a bit rough for me. There was not enough sauce so after a mini bowl....it started to taste dry :(
We also ordered a bunch of nigiri (2 pieces). The fish was not as fresh compared to other sushi restaurants that I have been to. The fish were a bit too thick and not long enough. Fish on sushi traditionally are suppose to over extend beyond the rice itself. These one just right covered it. The fish did not taste fresh either. Though we did come a bit late, slightly before their sushi bar closing time but it is still no excuse. 

*Service: good. The waiter was polite enough to come to us, letting us know that the sushi bar is about to close but still take your time to order. He did not rush us in the sense that made it seem rude. He constantly checked up on us to make sure that we have ordered enough as well.
author: Katie P.

description:
Every time I venture to the west side of SF to visit one of my friends, two things happen: 1) I get taken on some cool new hike or walk (Grand View Park and Golden Gate Park within a mile!) 2) order delivery from Noriega Teriyaki and have some beers. This is a good routine. 

Anyways, we've tried mostly rolls. I see a few reviews for Noriega written by my SF yelp friends, and as usual their recommendations are spot on. I'd add that the Titanic Roll, Dragon Roll, and Dancing Lion are solid bets. 

We mostly get delivery so I can't say much about the decor or service. But the deliveries have been fast and convenient. This is saying a lot actually since my friend's apartment is pretty inconvenient and hard to find, we've literally had less dedicated delivery folks give up. The young guy that comes by is really friendly and funny. 
Some reviews felt iffy about the service inside the restaurant, all I can say is that my interactions with whoever is on the phone for call-in orders and the delivery guy are great. 

All in all, a convenient and tasty choice.
author: Erik L.

description:
If you in the neighborhood and craving Japanese food, this place is nice.

A pit pricey but it is Japanese food and it's never cheap.

Parking is tough and you might need to call ahead to check up on tables.

Really nice people

Service is great
author: Michael C.

description:
I came here because the other restaurant I wanted to eat at had a very long wait time. However, after walking in here and standing at the front for a long time (at least 5 minutes), nobody greeted me or put my name down. There were plenty of workers walking around, so I was baffled. I was just about to leave when somebody finally helped me. 

I ordered the chasu wonton ramen, and it was delicious! The portion was huge, too!! For dessert, I had the New York cheesecake, and it was ok. It was too dense for me, but the price was pretty good. 

I liked the food here, but the service was a turn-off. My waitress didn't listen very well, either.
author: Rachel H.

description: I just love salmon isobe-age takeaway ^u^  They're always friendly and the food is good.  They also make my favorite roll for me, even though it's not on the menu anymore.
author: Re Y.

description:
For what it is, a neighborhood japanese spot with friendly staff & reasonable prices, Noriega Teriyaki is great.

Whether its dine in or take out I always enjoy my experience. Been coming here for years with my family & on weekend nights there's usually a good chance you'll see some familiar faces from that part of the Sunset. 

If you're a sushi snob, this probably wouldn't be a top choice. The fish is fresh but I don't notice anything superior that sets it apart. But then again thats why its called Noriega Teriyaki and not Noriega Sushi ;)

Great restaurant for a family or group dinner. They have plenty of seating & work quickly so if there is a wait it won't be too long. This is my go-to sushi spot on Noriega! Family owned & friendly :)
author: Siobhan T.

description:
Worst service ever!! Went here to celebrate my friend's birthday on Wednesday night. There were four of us. First, one of the server seated us at this booth, meanwhile another server were yelling to her to seat us somewhere else since there'll be a big party. But the first server seated us there anyway. Then, the second server brought us tea cups and I think she almost smashed them. Ok lady, I know you were upset with your coworker but I don't think smashing your boss' teacups would be appropriate.
Second, when we want to order, the server always disappear. We told her that we want to order sushi roll A, she said ok then leave. Well...excuse me, but we also wanted to order sushi B and C. Don't just walked away, we were not done ordering yet. 
Long story short, we had our dinner, and we found a piece of plastic in one of our sushi rolls. I wish I had a picture taken. We showed it to one of the server, she took it and said oh ok. And left. Not saying sorry whatsoever. Lastly, we ordered cheesecake for dessert, and it took forever. When we asked, the server said they have to defrost the cake first, it was still frozen. Really???
Don't think I want to come back there anymore.
author: Nelly T.

description: We were weekly customers for well over 10 years. There were good days and there were bad days. But today was absolutely the WORST.  We ordered take out and received the most DISGUSTING and INEDIBLE salmon in our sushi rolls!  The fish was chewy and clearly not sashimi grade. We came back to show the restaurant what they served us and we're told that there's "unfortunately nothing they can do". What's really unfortunate is that they just lost loyal customers that have been going here weekly for over 10 years.  The days of poor service and poor quality fish, were ignored. But today, their unwillingness to remake a roll with edible fish turned us away for good.
author: Diana L.

description:
Local neighborhood spot if your craving sushi. Don't get the super white tuna roll very plain.
There was just tuna rolled up with tuna outside nothing to else in the roll. Spider roll was decent and the usual California maki for the kids. Place was busy but the bad a lot of wait staff. Service is good as I was greeted multiple times to pickup my Togo order.
author: Larry L.

description: Lovely service & great portions. My partner & I just felt the vegetable tempura lacked a little seasoning & the plates we had could've used some sweetness for balance. We enjoyed what sushi we had & would visit again to explore the menu a little further.
author: Fi M.

description: Food was phenomenal, would absolutely recommend eating here. Delivery was fast and friendly, phone in order was easy and quick.
author: Mike S.

description: Convenient location and good value.  My kids love this place, so that keeps bringing us back.  Service is usually pretty good and attentive.
author: Terence L.

description:
I usually come here on Fridays as a family dinner night.  There is always a wait around dinner time (6-8pm), but it's a pretty big place so they can seat big parties.  you can also call ahead to make reservations if you have a big party!

I've been coming here for a while and I'm never disappointed in their service. always friendly waitresses and waiters! super nice!!! and are constantly checking up on our table.

the sushi here is pretty decent for the price. I think I keep coming here because of their teriyaki dinner special.  each set is $15 per person and you have to order a minimum of 2 sets. the 2 sets are HUGE!! and you really get the bang for your buck. each set comes with 3 eggrolls as an appetizer, miso soup, rice, beef teriyaki, mixed tempura, chicken karage AND fried salmon wrapped in seaweed. this is my favorite deal and with the minimum two sets, I feel I can feed 3-4 people. and think about it, one dinner entree is already $12, why not have a diverse selection?!!! 

beef teriyaki - probably my favorite thing here, it is always cooked to a medium rare and the beef is very tender! they know how to do beef right!!!  highly recommend to order :)

chicken karage - huge portion and is very delicious! sometimes they go overboard with the bre-ding on the outside, but it really depends on the busy nights. overall, very tasty and good! second favorite!

salmon wrapped in nori - deep fried salmon wrapped in nori. they put a mixed onions and carrot sauce on top so I recommend to eat it first out of the set so it doesn't get too soggy. it's pretty good, but I'm not that big of a fan of fried salmon.

mixed tempura - lots of selections on veggies and shrimp.  for me, there's always too much tempura mix and the breading is too thick. however, I do enjoy fried stuff.... so I eat it... and sometimes just peel off some batter :P

sushi rolls - awesome portions and pretty fresh fish. just a little heavy on sauce sometimes depending on the roll, but overall, pretty wide selection and yummy!
author: Josie L.

description:
My aunt and uncle invited me out to join them for lunch with some of my other relatives. Since they all ordered cooked food, I thought maybe I should be different and order something with raw fish so I got the chirashi. 

For the price, the chirashi had a pretty good portion size and variety of seafood. The regular fishes like salmon and tuna were fine. The tuna looked a little washed out, but it still tasted ok. The best part was a plump, shimmering piece of hotate, which was sweet and succulent. Some things could use some improvement though. I think there was a piece of tai that was oddly spongy. Maybe it spent too much time in the freezer. The saba was also pretty rough and chalky, and the rice was too sweet and was covered with some weird pickled vegetables. It was far from perfect, but you can't really expect a place like this to be super stellar.

The hot food seemed to be better than the raw fish. I tried the beef teriyaki, and it wasn't bad. I guess it's hard to go wrong with grilled meat. It had a good sear and was tender enough. They used too much of the generic, sweet teriyaki sauce, but it still tasted ok. Other people seemed to like the tempura and salmon teriyaki entrees as well. This stuff isn't exactly super authentic or special, but they seem to make it better than the other items on the menu. 

Noriega Teriyaki is fine as a local place, but I don't think anyone would go out of their way to come here.
author: Nei N.

description:
Mehhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhh

I ordered the vegetable soba, expecting a cold soba with some veggies.  It arrived piping hot to my surprise, and normally I wouldn't mind but it was like 90 degrees today and I just wanted to COOL DOWN but this dish was definitely opening all the pores on mah face giving me a steaming facial it was so hot not what I was anticipating.  Also, not sure if soba noodles are traditionally ever served hot, they were quite soggy in the hot broth. Usually I always see them served as zaru soba....on a bamboo mat over ice with a cold sweet dipping sauce. Or as ten zaru with some type of tempura, but this was wayyyy weird having hot soba lol NEVER AGAIN. 

It was also strange how my friend ordered sukiyaki and they completely forgot to add the clear noodles that come with the sukiyaki.  They promptly brought over a side of clear noodles when we notified them of the missing noodles, and all was well.  

Also, what kid of Japanese restaurant serves deep fried salmon wrapped in seaweed as an entree??? So. Weird.  My friend ordered it and said it was decent but w.t.f. I guess the chef is trying to be innovative but the Japanese half of me was slightly offended. 

I was with 7 other people and for some reason my dinner didn't come with soup, rice, or ice cream like everyone else....so weird, but they pittied my lack of sides and gave me ice cream at the end because they felt sorry for me hahahah so nice.

Overall, I have to say the service was great, my low rating is because the food is not good.  Everyone complained how it was too fatty, or lacked flavor, or didn't taste right.  Not impressed by the food, but I do have to say props to awesome wait staff!
author: Christina L.

description:
My sister, friend (Heather), and I had just driven about 5 hours up from LA and were starving.  Noriega Teriyaki House was less than a block away from where we were staying, so we decided to head that way.

We were greeted by this taller Asian waitress, we'll call her Grumps McGrumperson.  She seated us in the booth right next to the entrance.  It took a bit to flag her down to place our order.  When she came over, my sister asked a question about one of the specials.  Grumps responded with a laugh and "Oh, I don't know."  She walked towards the sushi chef like she was going to ask him and then headed straight into the kitchen.

My sister let her know that we didn't need to know what the specials were and wanted to order anyway, but she just kept walking away.  After trying to get her attention a second, third, and fourth time to order, it was becoming obvious that she was ignoring us.  She'd see us, make eye contact, and then look away.  We then ended up getting the attention of the only other waitress in there, we'll call her Happy.  I'd call them by their names but neither was wearing a name tag.

Happy was SO friendly and took our orders down quickly.  Shortly after, she brought us some chopsticks, placemats, and napkins.  The food came out relatively quickly after ordering.  Happy would make it a point to come to the front of the table, explain what the dish was in her hand, and gently place it on the table.  If Grumps had to bring us anything, she'd slip it over the couch and just drop the plate onto the table without a word.

If Happy was occupied with another customer and we needed something, we'd try to get Grumps' attention.  Again, she'd look at us then look away.  Or, she'd tell Happy to come even though Grumps was literally doing nothing.

Honestly, I have no idea what we did to Grumps other than ask a simple question.  Perhaps it was shark week for her, who knows.  If this review was solely based on service, Noriega would get 1 star.  Here's the thing, I've been to plenty of Asian restaurants and I know that you don't go for the service.  But her behavior was beyond anything I've ever experienced at any restaurant in my entire life.

About the food?  I can't even remember if anything was good because Grumps made our experience so terrible.  

I'll give another star for Happy because she was great.  We even gave her the cash tip personally so Grumps couldn't take any of that money.
author: Stephanie L.

description:
Friend suggested going here for sushi. It's located further down Noriega where street parking is slightly easier to find. If you want to sit at the sushi bar, it's located on the right but there's lots of seating available.

Our Order
Sushi for Two: ($28) 28pcs that include 2 Ikura, 2 Hamachi, 2 Maguro, 2 Ebi, 2 Sake, 2 Tai, 2 Tako, 2 Unagi, Kappa Maki, Tekka Maki, Hamachi Maki, California Roll and a scoop of ice cream for dessert
Quail's Nest: Raw Quail Egg, Amaebi (Sweet Shrimp), Ikura (Salmon Roe), Wasabi Tobiko

Before our food came out we had miso soup brought out and a "cucumber salad." Fairly fresh sushi. The Quail's Nest was interesting. Wasn't super amazing that I'd have to order again though. Service provided by our server, Aaron, was fantastic. Super friendly and was available when needed. Would come back to try all their other specials (they have a lot).
author: Kitty K.

description:
Whoa whoa whoa! 

I was pleasantly surprised by the quality of the food and service at Noriega Teriyaki House. My large party of 30 or so obnoxiously came in just 30 minutes before closing, and the staff was still very pleasant and attentive. No signs of spite or frustration at all! 

The dinner special is fairly priced, and you get cucumber salad, standard salad, soup, rice, the entree, a potato crocquet, and ice cream. I ordered the chicken katsu and it was done perfectly: not overly breaded or fried, perfectly crunchy without any trace of sogginess, and it was piping hot. 

Everyone got their food and alcohol within 20 minutes and was very happy. I'll definitely be back here sometime soon!
author: Stephen D.

description:
Service here is RIDICULOUSLY FAST. Our orders generally come out in less than 7 minutes. And best of all, the food is decently GOOD. I didn't know such speed was even possible.

One of my favorite things here is the Yosenabe, a mixture of fresh seafood, tofu, and glass noodles in a mild broth. Tastes very healthy and comes with a good portion of seafood. Also comes with rice and ice cream (at dinner).

I would honestly stick with the hot items. The sashimi and sushi rolls are mediocre at best. The pricing for the sashimi is fair, but not the highest quality. The rolls were also kinda disappointing. The Spider Roll had waayyy too much rice - and not even sushi rice! Just plain old white rice. The crunchy tempura was also not very crunchy. Not worth $8. 

That being said, you get what you paid for. If you don't come here expecting a gourmet Japanese meal, you'll leave with a full stomach and pretty full wallet :)
author: Samantha C.

description:
"To Go order consisting of two Double Hamachi, two dragon, one spider rainbow, one spicy scallop, one spicy tuna and one tekka" - Quality of the fish was fresh with my favorites being the double Hamachi, spicy tuna, dragon and spider rainbow.

I normally order my To Go from Yum Yum Fish but wanted to pay extra $$ since this order was for a special occasion. If you are looking to pay less for a party platter size then you may want to consider Yum Yum but they do not have formal dining like NTH.

Having dined at Noriega Teriyaki many times for dinner my food has always been consistent. If you are a combo meal you get the soup, salad and a small scoop of ice cream. Finally, if you do not want to wait for a table that you arrive with the first hour of so or after 8 pm.
author: Richard H.

description: The neighborhood old time fav restaurant, love the katsu dinner plate with extra tempora so many choices to eat!
author: Jose B.

description:
Do they got my dragon roll here? Check.
Coke on the drinks list? Check
Fresh Sashimi? Check
Adequately clean bathroom? Good enough.
Desserts? could be better...
Parking? Come at night...
author: Eric C.

description: Food is ok. About as good as Safeway sushi. Overpriced for the quality. I found the "kids" that make up the wait staff a bit obnoxious and in need of training. A bit disorganized.
author: Wolf H.

description:
Funky tasting water and weak green tea. 
Sushi was pedestrian but at least the fish was fresh. The inside smells musty too, however the service was pretty fast. Even of Iived in the neighborhood it wouldn't be worthwhile to return.  Just meh.
author: Erin B.

description: Noriega Teriyaki is one of my parents favorite places, so we come here for dinner just about every time we visit.  They are VERY kid friendly, the service is great -- our tea is always filled, cucumber sunumono and miso soups arrive right away (they really don't care if the kids don't order a meal, they get cucumbers and soup too!).  Our go to dishes are the Chicken Karage, Tonkatsu, or Grilled Salmon combos.  My kids LOVE the udon, and the kids menu has lots of choices between won ton soup (it's a dominantly Chinese neighborhood, just accept it) udon, chicken teriyaki, plain rice, and tempura (OK, it's the BEST kids menu I've ever seen, in my opinion).  We all get ice cream or sherbet at the end, and everyone is happy.  Love this place!
author: Kimberly J.

description:
My son and I came in and we ordered the tempura for an appetizer, a chirashi bowl for me and a salmon teriyaki dinner for my son.

When the tempura came I was surprised it was a nicely portioned but it came with rice? Did not think about it but we realized later when the waiter told us it was actually the tempura dinner. I asked why we would order 3 dinners for 2 people and that we only wanted the tempura appetizer, he was nice enough to correct it but it seemed as if the restaurant would not fix it as he said he would cover it and pay the difference since it was his mistake. It was only a few dollars and I did not want this young man to pay out of his pocket and said it was ok and I would pay but he kept insisting. It was very nice of him but I do not think they should have to pay out of pocket for that honest mistake.

Ok I really wasn't expecting tooooo much from this place but when I got the chirashi bowl and my tuna was NOT red it was like a dark reddish BROWN. I was told that was normal but I have never seen tuna that was NOT red. I decided to not eat it anyway and the waitress noticed and offered to take it back and give me a different fish so I traded it for salmon. 

Because of the color of the tuna I do not feel comfortable eating here again. There are better places that are decently priced in the sunset I would rather go to. Tazaki on Judah is better.
author: Linda L.

description: This place has been a family favorite go-to since the 90's.  Always delicious food, in such a family friendly restaurant.  Such great value for what you pay.  I never leave here unsatisfied.  A note for vegans:  The dressing that comes on the salads and the sides are made with dairy and egg yolks.  My server was able to make sure we had vegan friendly dressing.
author: Rocky B.

description:
3.5

Mediocre, fast-food type of place.  The food isn't bad but it wasn't great either.

Salmon Sashimi- large pieces.  kind of on the lukewarm side
Sukiyaki & tempura- big portions.  loved all the cabbage and bean sprouts.  the meat was a little over cooked.  good soup base
Salmon Poki- right amount of spice
Caterpillar Roll- HUGE.  if you can put this all in your mouth in one move, kudos to you! size doesn't really matter, it's all about the taste
Dragon Roll- good size

This is a great option for a Japanese restaurant in the neighborhood.  Like the kind when you can't think of anything to eat and settle for something mediocre kind of place.
