Staff is very attentive.
author: Linda N.

description: I keep coming back to this place solely because its close to my house. Decent food for the price but you get a solid amount of food per order. I usually get the tempura, chicken teriyaki, or beef teriyaki (always lunch special). The sushi is not bad and the food in general is always pretty consistent. The style of japanese food this place serves is definitely chinese chef made but nowadays, what japanese place isnt.
author: Dylan L.

description: One thing I have to say about this place is that their sushi rolls are huge. Ordered the emperor roll and cherry blossom roll. I don't eat raw fish but boyfriend said it was good, that the fish was fresh and plentiful. I got the chicken katsu and they use white meat chicken. Lightly crispy and a large salad. Yum! Maybe not the best in taste but certainly nothing lacking. Price is normal for San Francisco. I've definitely seen cheaper and more expensive. Overall pretty decent food.
author: Lisa M.

description:
Decent spot to get your sushi on, during a business lunch.  My colleague got a bento box, which looked terrific.  

Considering how many crappy eateries there are on Noriega, I'd say this place is a jewel.
author: Anthony D.

description: Magnificent! These guys got it right. We were properly greeted, and the food was made pretty quickly. I had the chicken teriyaki and tempura lunch combo for 10.95. Great taste! The chicken is fantastic and the tempura was perfectly cooked. I think the service for this place is amazing, and so is the food. I would definitely come again!
author: Christopher X.

description:
Pros: Cheap sushi, fast service

Cons:  get what you pay for, lots o' screaming babies.

I was there yesterday with a couple friends, where the food was somewhat tasty, but had that not-so-fresh feeling.  

If rock-hard wasabi is any indication of the quality of the place... well, you get the drift.
author: Alex p.

description: It's an attractive place.  The staff are usually quite friendly and accommodating.  I'd say the food is average at best.  I'll go if my family wants to go, but it's not a place that I enjoy.  The vegetarian sushi dishes that I order are pretty tasteless.  And they don't even have plum wine.  SF is full of Japanese restaurants and a lot of them are considerably better than this one.
author: Bob S.

description: I am very unhappy with the service.  We ordered 4 entrees and the 2 people sashimi didn't come until everyone finished their meals.  When I questioning them, the waitress didn't even apologize but simply said we have too many take out orders.  I will never come here again.
author: Real E.

description: I first time try this Teriyaki house ,I am order golden ox sushi , unagi rice and womton soup , taste good, yummy, yummy...
author: Samantha C.

description:
They have a pond and a tree inside their restaurant.
Again.
They have a pond and a tree inside their restaurant.

When you sit down, the server brings a bowl of cucumber with a perky sauce on it. 
This Japanese restaurant serves excellent udon and a large selection of sushi rolls. Everything tastes like it's made fresh. The tempura shrimp in the tempura rolls is crunchy and delicious. The eel is high quality. The sauces are delicious. 

The prices are reasonable, and there are daily sushi bar specials with prices like $6.50 for a large roll with filling and toppings. The quantity and quality for the price is pretty unbelievable.

The service is friendly, but not as attentive as would be optimal. It's a bigger restaurant and there are some corners that get a little ignored.
Of course, any time you see "dancing lion roll" that's so big that you can't eat it in one bit, it's not strictly authentic, nor when you see "burrito roll," but the quality is good.

I go back here frequently whenever I'm looking for some solidly good, yet reasonably priced sushi with lots of options.
author: Allxie C.

description: Food was just ok I didn't like the service ,so I'm not really crazy about this place !
author: Kathy N.

description:
Food was alright, service was crap. Only one of the three waitresses that interacted with us was deserving of kind remarks. The hostess sucked. 

Menu ranges in the $-$$ area depending on what you get. There are some lunch specials that come with rice and miso soup. I got the Unaju. Don't get it. I felt that though there was a somewhat good amount of eel on my plate, it failed to compare to my sister's chicken teriyaki portion let alone my parents' lunch combo amount. My parents chose the combo special where you have to at least order two to get the combo special. It is basically a plate of tempura and beef teriyaki. My other sister chose to just eat sushi rolls. She got the super burrito, the San Francisco roll, and the spicy tuna roll? I actually can't remember the last. I would say that the sushi was pretty good, given that they are all $8+.

On to the service.....out of the three ladies working the dining room, the hostess was the least friendly in my opinion. She had the sourest attitude compared to the to other ladies. Then there's waitress number 2, the one in the red shirt. We did not interact much with her, as she always managed to look the other way since she was sooo busy. And then there's waitress number 3. The best one out of the bunch. She had the blue shirt with the big flowers on it. So friendly and so courteous. I'd only want her to be my server next time if I could help it.

I might come back, but might is the keyword. The food wasn't something I'd rave about, and the service definitely isn't something that I'd reward them on doing an excellent job.

C+/B-
author: Alex T.

description:
The waiters here were very friendly.

The food was pretty good but my boyfriend and I both got upset stomachs later on in the day. Not sure if it was from this place or the ice cream place we went to after, but I wouldn't risk coming here again.
author: Phi B.

description: I would give this place 0 stars if possible. This was probably one of the worst dining experiences I've ever had. The service was just awful in every respect. Our table ordered the sushi boat, two rolls, an appetizer and a combination plate. The sushi boat, appetizer, and combination plate came out fine without issue. After everyone at the table finished, we were still waiting on the two rolls. We watched as several other tables were served their meals as we patiently waited for twenty five minutes for our two rolls. I finally got up from the table and spoke with the male server for an update since he was ignoring our table the entire time. The male server admitted he made a mistake and had brought our table's rolls to another table but didn't even remotely seem apologetic. I understand mistakes happen, but it would have been nice to address your mistake and inform your patrons. After another 10-20 minutes, our rolls finally came to the table. The tuna and salmon were not fresh, and the rolls were subpar. We had to ask multiple times to have our table cleared, for more tea/napkins, and one too many times for the check. This restaurant is a sad attempt at Japanese food, and the service is plain disgraceful. I will not frequent this restaurant ever again.
author: Elaine Y.

description:
I craved sushi for the past 3 weeks and I couldn't hold it any longer! We were in SF and I did not know any decently tasting sushi in the city and we did not make reservations for Amami in San Bruno so we came here thinking if this place had a long wait, we'd just grab some Chinese food. 

Not much of a wait at all and got seats at the bar. The California roll wasn't bad at all though nothing special. The fish didn't look too great, so I didn't order any other sushi. I also ordered the Saba shio over rice (salted mackerel). Saba shio is usually one of my favorite dish because it's simple yet flavorful...that is, if the fish is well made.

The Saba was extremely bony! I spent a great deal just trying to remove bones as I ate. I gave up towards the end because it wasn't worth it anymore. The fish was also over-grilled. 

After this, I think I'll stick with East Bay sushi places and Amami when my cravings tell me it's sushi time!
author: Henry P.

description:
Haven't been here for at least 10 years. After eating here again now I remember why I stopped coming.

Ordered the chicken karage and tempera combo. The taste and texture of the chicken wasn't exemplary so was the tempura.  Nothing about the food really enticed my taste buds. Portions were considerably small as well. 

I can't completely knock this place because the staff were extremely polite. Too bad the food doesn't match their level of hospitality.
author: Jude N.

description:
Gross, gross, gross! First and last time I'll set foot in this place. Came in on a Sunday at 6pm for a table of 7 and was asked if we had reservations. It was pretty empty so I didn't understand why he had asked. I was asked to wait 5 minutes and they would seat us . . . they sat us in the little back closet where nobody knows you exist. We had to get up and find a waitress to take our order.

The tea came out and it tasted like bleach, YES BLEACH. I wanted to throw up in the cup. The waiter was inexperienced. If there are 7 people at a table it most likely means there will be 7 meals. After the 4th person he kept asking "is that all." No, there are 3 other people at need to order. Our food didn't even come out all at once. It just came spilling out the kitchen at all different times. My tempura udon, which didn't even look or taste like udon, came out half at a time. I sat there waiting for my tempura as my udon was getting cold. One person got their food 15 minutes after everyone else got their food. 

I don't understand why this place filled up by the time we left. Service was awful and the food was nothing to write home about. I live close by but I'll drive to my normal spot in San Mateo. I'd much rather drive further for good food and service.
author: Adelina W.

description: This is currently my favorite restaurant in SF. I almost always get the Chicken Kara-age Salad but i've also had the chicken teriyaki combo dinner for 2 and was thoroughly satisfied!
author: Anna M.

description: Got the chicken katsu which was tender and crispy.  Also got tuna maguru which was large pieces and fresh.  Good find, will come back.
author: josh d.

description:
I live 5 short blocks from Noriega Teriyaki House so you can imagine how many times I have been here. I have been going to this restaurant for years. And maybe, I did have lunch there yesterday...They are probably and most likely familiar with my friends, family, and I. 

I have given this place 4 stars for two reasons:

1. The service is incredibly on point. They are all super friendly and always attentive. Greeting when you come in, workers thank you for coming in (including the sushi chef at the counter), even cleaning the unintentional and uncontrolled tea spills, and much more. 

2. The sushi is really delicious and I only order the sushi. I've had the other foods and they were okay, but the sushi is yum. My family and I's go-to rolls are golden ox roll, san francisco roll, double hamachi roll, crazy roll, and spicy salmon/tuna rolls. We have tried other rolls but not as comparable to these ones. We have also came across other good rolls, but our usual ones are just too filling to order more. Which leads to my next point, their rolls are BIG. You get your money's worth of these darn good, not as expensive as other japanese restaurants sushi rolls. 

In all, good sushi, not over priced, big portions, and friendly service equals 4 stars and coming back for more and more.
author: Tenneal H.

description: This used to be a good restaurant, but now if there were negative stars, I would give it. The soup spoon was so disgusting, that I would not even feed the dog with it. When the food came, the presentation was nice, but dried out sushi rice, and moldy sushi is unacceptable, when I brought this up, I did not even get an apology. Never going back, and if you value your health, stay away!
author: Yev G.

description: Neighborhood place that I come to often. The sushi is good, but nothing special. My favorite roll would be the fire and ice roll. As for service, they are friendly but inattentive. There was only one other table beside ours and I still had to get up and walk to the waitress whenever I needed something. When I was paying the check, I called her over and she did not come over. Again, I had to walk my ass over to her and hand her the bill. -_-
author: Michelle H.

description: Food was ok. Restaurant seemed dirty. The table where I sat smelled like they used a week old rag to wipe it down. I probably wouldn't come back here. Only reason why I came here was because another Japanese restaurant I usually go to up Noriega near 19th Ave had a line out the door. This place was half empty...now I know why.
author: Your M.

description:
Nice place. We had a reservation for around 6 but came in at 5 and they seated us after a few minutes. Looks like you'd expect a Japanese restaurant to look, but not too fancy. I would've taken a long time and a lot of dough perhaps to get in a full look at the sushi menu, so I settled on the salmon sashimi and beef teriyaki "chef's special" for $13.95. I also wanted to try the ivory tuna nigiri posted on the board, but I was quite disappointed to find out that they ran out.

First thing that came out was this little thing of sliced cucumbers and some sort of yellow sauce. It was surprisingly good, kinda sweet. Miso soup was next, and it was also pretty good. Then the main platter came out... well, to our other table at first because the server didn't know where it was supposed to go. But let me tell you, that first bite of salmon sashimi was heavenly. I'm sad that there were only four pieces, but they were pretty generously cut.

As for the rest of it, the beef teriyaki was good, but I wish it had been a little bit more tender. Salad was okay, but I wish there was more dressing. Daikon strings didn't seem good for anything, so I left it alone. I also had my first tastes of futomaki, which was pretty good for vegetarian, and albacore tatari, which was somewhat perplexing (for me) with its cool interior and warm exterior. It was delicious though, no doubt. And when we got to dessert, I had coffee ice cream and tried somebody else's green tea. Both were pretty good, although the green tea had more sweet and less green tea flavor than I'm used to.

Overall, I wouldn't mind coming back here. It's definitely something that satisfied my Vegas sushi-spoiled palate.
author: Chris V.

description:
It was good. Good portions,very filling, and very courteous. My family likes it and goes there a lot, and I will go back. 

Honest review! 
-Poison Ivy
author: Poison I.

description: I recommend getting the dancing lion and Q roll here , very fresh& good . The food never turns me down, but the service here is just horrible. It's not that this place lacks service , but they just act like they don't want to be here. For instance, today when  the waitress set my food on my table, she didn't even put it fully ON THE TABLE. It was on the edge, and if I wasn't paying as much attention, it would've probably fallen off. Out of common courtesy, I thank her for dropping off the food but instead of saying you're welcome she rolls her eyes and walks away..  I mean I'm sorry if you're having a bad day, but you don't have to ruin mines too. Horrible. Probably not going to come back around this time again, the younger waitresses/ waiters who work at night are much more kind. Or I might just get to go.
author: Cassondra G.

description:
Hands down, the best sushi place ever! Why?!?
BIG PORTIONS. 
The food is delicious. The sushi rolls are big enough to fill you. Love the udon , love the sashimi, and love the atmosphere!
The place gets crowded but every single time I've gone there, I never had to wait. Staff is friendly and the place is clean. 

I like this place better than some sushi places in Japan town.
author: Annette F.

description:
This is me and my boyfriend's go to Japanese place if we are craving either some teriyaki or sushi. It is family owned and the service is always so friendly. It is conveniently located and parking has never really been an issue for me. 

Their beef teriyaki is some of the best that I have had, very tender and super yummy. Their tempura is pretty good as well (unfortunately allergic to prawns so can only speak to their veggie tempura.) When we feel like being fatties we have ordered the big sushi and sashimi special... definitely a lot for two people but all enjoyable :). Some of my favorite rolls from this place include the double sake and emperors new roll, love that salmon. 

It isn't the fanciest but a great place for groups :)
author: Tracy Joy K.

description:
I've been here for dinner only.

Food has never been a let-down. I admit, the first time I didn't come with high expectations, but was very pleasantly surprised.

The quality of food (delish), portions (whoa, didn't expect so much), the presentation, general amount of time it takes to be seated (usually no line, but goes quick if there is), and overall experience has been good every time I've gone.

I've had the tonkatsu dinner, the chef special for 2 and brought home the leftovers,
Let's just say, I don't come here for sushi, but I've also had their sushi, and it's not bad. :)

I was really impressed with how quickly they can bust a table, seriously not every place has that together! I was here Mother's Day, and while I did here kids complaining, "can we just go somewhere else?" The wait was quite decent. I waited 30-40 mins, there were at least 7 parties ahead, but I'm used to waiting for things and thought they did really well. Ninja-stealth!
author: Carol L.

description: Spicy tuna roll and Beef/Chicken teriyaki excellent. all white meat chicken! very clean and tasty! Friendly service!
author: S. V.

description: This place suck. They charge overpriced. The food is just OK. The service sucks. I don't why a lot of people gave it five star. This place is not worth.
author: Mo Z.

description:
Came to this restaurant craving sushi. Ended up not getting sushi because their luncheon deal was very good price! Only ~$9 for a whole rice platter: miso soup, salad, and a lot of meat and rice! My friend ordered the spicy tuna sushi which was very good and was pretty spicy. Overall it was very good and the service was okay. They did check up on us quite a few times and they were very friendly with their service. 

Overall the food was okay and the service was okay. Would definitely come back here again if I was craving a luncheon platter. 

The decorations and the whole ambiance was very japanese, which I liked. They had a cool decoration right where you walk-in and I think it's a fake tree. Not too sure but they had a cage with a fake bird in there and I thought it was real. Maybe it was real and it just wasn't moving (or dead).. just kidding pretty sure it was fake! Nevertheless, the whole experience was very traditional japanese and the food was good too! Would recommend.
author: Joe E.

description:
Hands down my favorite sushi restaurant. I love the specialty rolls, especially the crunchy roll and the dragon roll. The tea is delicious and compliments the sushi perfectly. The prices are fair and the service is good. The atmosphere is lovely as well. I love walking in and immediately seeing the water fountain and the gorgeous cherry blossoms. 

The only con is parking, but it's just what you can expect in this area.
author: Michelle S.

description: I guess this place is awesome for birthdays because I got a free fried mochi. However, I couldn't eat it because I was stuffed with their chirashi bowl. The bowls sashimi was, for the most part, very fresh. The octopus maybe not so much, but everything else seemed really fresh. The katsu was also pretty darn good and the salmon roe sushi even better.
author: Ian W.

description:
We went there for dinner last night and everything was really good. It looks like they have a new menu and the prices are reasonable as well.
The wife had the chicken teriyaki/tempura dinner combination which comes with rice, miso soup, egg rolls and shrimp/veg tempura.- $14.95
I had the chief's special of chicken teriyaki, tempura which comes with rice, miso soup, salad and sushi rolls. -$15.95  You get your choice of ice cream, either sherbet, green tea or coffee flavor. Of course the dinner comes with Japanese green tea,
For the two of us plus a small Asahi beer, the tab came out to about $37.00 which ain't bad for good Japanese food and good service.
author: jack d.

description:
I only come here cause it's conveniently near my place and a better alternative to the sushi places around here. Also, prices here are fairly decent. 
Sushi rolls here are not bad. However, sometimes they are doused with too much sauce. Salmon teriyaki is pretty good, it's something I always order all the time. 
I had a craving for ramen last night and ordered the chasu ramen. After experiencing very good ramen elsewhere before, ramen here is definitely not comparable. 
Complimentary dessert is a plus!
author: Karen L.

description:
Not a particularly good "Chinese run Japanese" place. Prices a bit high and the food is mostly mediocre. 

A few of the dishes are somewhat passable, but I stopped going a while ago after giving them several chances so up to you to find them if you want...
author: T J.

description:
Update the review because there is more to review!

Good service. Good food. They have pretty interesting sushi rolls and the quality of the fish is pretty decent. They have combo specials and the dinners all come with ice cream at the end. Hehehe. 

The restaurant is fairly big and the wait usually isn't too long either. There is also a small sushi bar if you're keen to that. 

Parking in this area is pretty easy to find as well. 

I've been coming here for a while and it's nice to have a decent Japanese restaurant in the area that hasn't gone downhill in the Sunset. (:
author: Susan Y.

description: New favorite sushi spot!! Thank god! Incredible fresh fist, big servings, amazing service. Just BRAVO. My bf and I were very happy. Two miso soups, tea, cucumber, 8 of hamachi with toppings I requested and two big rolls all for only $39.00 (w/o tip) YOU BETTER TIP THESE PEOPLE AT LEAST 20% because they all work hard and give great service :) I am more than satisfied right now :)
author: Kayla C.

description:
My wife and I drove from across the bay for Dinner in the City,, and came across a parking spot in front of Noriga Teriyaki House.  

The restaurant was bright and busy,,  so we tuned our taste buds to Japanese. 


We were greeted by several people as we were escorted to a nice table.  Our server was a young guy, very personable, who appeared to enjoy his work.  

We ordered, grilled Squid appetizer, Chicken katsu curry, Sea bass w/beef teri and tuna handroll/   

Flavors were wonderful, and reminded me of my father's home cooking.  

We enjoyed a great "traditional" dinning experience,,    a menu  slightly different from the Japanese eating spots closer to home,,     Would we drive 50 miles to come here again...  DEFINITELY  yes,,     we have several favorite spots in the SUNSET.
author: Uncle Ernie ..

description:
This place is awesome. Their fish is consistently on point, and the prices are better than average. We just had 2 premium rolls, 2 nigiri and a large hot sake for 45 bucks. 

There is a lot of seating space, so the wait is usually pretty short. 

They have a great lunch and dinner combo special for 10-15 bucks. I used to live around the corner, and I could always count on that for takeout to satisfy my taste and hunger.
author: Joey M.

description:
The food is always fresh and cooked perfectly. The sushi just might be some of the best sushi I've had in the city. Oh and the stuffed mushrooms are a MUST.
The restaurant itself has a very calm atmosphere to it, no matter how busy it is. The service is also fast and friendly
author: Jamie P.

description: I am loyal customer of this place and come here very often. Some days are good here and some days are horrible. The quality of the fishes varies a lot. They intend to use a very low grade fish for their sushi and one time I was surprised with a layer of salmon fat on both of the rolls that I ordered to go. I came back to talk to a manager and explain the situation and instead was told that they can not do anything about it. What a customer service!!! They see the extreme chunks of fat but after calling a manger they would not apologize nor would they make a new roll. Totally shocked of the attitude of the management of this place and the fact that I come here all the time and for once pointed out an issue. The customer service is one of the worst I have experienced. Horrible management, they really don't know how to deal with customers. Had issues once before and same exact reaction from management. They lost another customer and I guess it is all part of their business strategy. After the nice experience from the management left all the sushi at the restaurant so that they can enjoy the garbage themselves.
author: Vadim L.

description:
I have only been here two times and the first time, I really enjoyed the food. It was a while back, so I can't remember what my family ordered, but I do remember that their sushi was delicious.

The second time, I ordered their beef udon. I wasn't very satisfied with their udon. Compared to the beef udon I had at Kippu in Japantown, this one was lacking. The broth was good, but something about the meal was not fulfilling. The one at Kippu was much more hearty.

Overall, I would come back here for their sushi and maybe try other noodle type dishes they have.
author: Krystal C.

description:
This place is way underrated.  My wife (who is gluten-free) and I continue to be impressed with the quality of the food at the affordable prices.

What to order?  Ask the waiters for recommendations.  You can't go wrong.
author: George K.

description:
Went here for dinner on a Tuesday evening. Was craving some Asian food, with noodles and soup. Happened to be in the area doing some laundry, so I found this place out of convenience down Noriega. 

The decor is very nice, definitely reflects a typical Japanese restaurant. Was seated quickly and given some lovely tea to start. 
Went with the sukiyaki and tempura combo. Definitely underestimated the amount of food I would receive!! Got some egg rolls, miso soup, side of rice, side of cucumbers, the actual bowl of sukiyaki and the tempura. And ice cream. I'm small and I constantly order with my eyes instead of my stomach. This is a perfect example of that. 

My favorites were the tempura, miso soup, and eggrolls. All of it was crisp and freshly cooked. Burned my tongue. I get excited to eat sometimes.

Sadly the sukiyaki wasn't my complete favorite. Really salty, and the texture of the meat was really off. Typically I enjoy this dish. Also served in a hot pot, which was nice but may have overcooked the food.

Despite that, the service was very attentive, the rest of the food was good and what I got was reasonably priced. I'm down to try this place again!
author: Kristine T.

description:
My bf and I love this place. It's definitely one of our top go to places for sushi. One of the things we love most is that they deliver, and they're usually really fast. They're always super friendly when we dine in or order delivery. He loves the salmon roll and I love the spider rainbow roll. Those are usually our go to rolls. I don't like raw stuff, so he usually picks off the raw fish off my roll. We also get the steak teriyaki bento which comes with soup, salad, tempura, mini egg rolls, and ice cream when delivered. It's pretty good, nothing special but nothing bad. 

For someone who likes cooked stuff, I would definitely recommend this place. I can't say anything about the raw sushi, but I would imagine it would be pretty good!
author: Linda L.

description:
I went here today for a relatives birthday dinner and it was not a bad experience.

We were seated very shortly after coming in with a party of 6 in a booth. The waitress did not come back to check on us for beverages and what we would like to order for at least another 10 minutes.

The miso soup came about 10 minutes after ordering and it was definitely good. Hot with a nice flavor.
My main dish came 10 minutes after that: California Roll, Chicken Teriyaki, and Tempura Chef Special. ($14)

It was quite filling and the food quality is nice. They were generous with the amount of tempura, a good amount of 6 California rolls made with care and the chicken teriyaki which could have had a bit more quantity.

The waitress/waiter did not come back to check on us at all with drinks or how we were doing until we asked for the check and they gave us the choice of ice cream. 
(I chose green tea which was about the scoop size of a slightly larger ping pong ball)

Overall, a nice dinner with a satisfying amount of food, but there could have been more service and perhaps a slightly overpriced menu with specific items.
author: Jeffy Y.

description:
Food: The sushi here is one of the better ones in the Sunset.  You get more fish than rice which is a good thing.  My friend had the Beef Teriyaki plate that came with a salad, an orange slice, some cucumber and a cup of Miso soup.  He said it was pretty good.

Service: Stellar.  The servers here are really nice and very accommodating.  Normally, I try to avoid Chinese ran sushi restaurants because of my previous experiences where the quality of the food feels like a step up from the frozen market aisle.  This one might be the exception.

Parking:  This one sucks.  There's only a limited of spots in the area.  The Walgreens patrons and the bus stop in front of Walgreens doesn't help the situation.  If you live by the 71 line, I'd suggest taking that since both directional stops are right across from each other.
author: Wilson K.

description: Mom and pop business. Utensils are pretty out dated along with the decore. Good pricing but IMO it's lacking taste. I did notice the plates and cups weren't washed well with leftover debris. With a few minor changes their place can be a kick ass local business and restaurant.
author: Cee B.

description:
I came here around 2pm with my boyfriend, and the entire experience was a drag.

First, they brought us an overfilled teapot (the spout was even full to the top), so when we picked it up to pour, half-brewed tea went all over the table. The server tried to explain that we were pouring wrong - homebody please, I bleed tea - and not-so-discreetly swapped our pot out for one with a working spout (turns out the other one was broken and we weren't just incompetent tea novices). 

Then, we waited like half an hour for our food. Seriously, why do they list gyoza as an appetizer if it always takes the longest to come out? We had to keep flagging people down to ask about our food, and they'd explain that they were really backed up. The restaurant is like a quarter full and it's 2:30pm. What's going on here? I also didn't appreciate that they didn't tell us sooner that there would be a longer-than-normal wait. 

When our food finally came, it was just OK. I think I was so miffed from the tea insult and the waiting, I'd lost my appetite. Although I usually have better experiences here, I think I'm going to take some time to cool off and try other places.
author: Rachel A.

description:
I recently just moved to the Bay Area from Orange County and I only live a few blocks away from Noriega Teriyaki House. I decided to stop by and give it a try. 

I thought the food there was delicious!! And there were lots of choices to choose from. In addition, it was decently priced and they gave you generous sides. I ordered take out so I called beforehand, and my food was good to go by the time I came in. 

Good customer service as well. Recommend everyone to stop by!!
author: Jennifer H.

description:
Noriega Teriyaki is my to-go place for some consistent hearty Japanese cuisine.

When I feel sick or cold, I go for their nabeyaki udon. Hot steamy pot of heartwarming goodness. Slurping those yummy noodles always make me feel better.

When I'm starving, I go for their chicken teriyaki dinner. Generous slices of grilled meat and a simple green salad. Miso soup and ice cream too? Who can say no?

When I'm in healthy mode, I go for their sushi/rolls. Fresh good quality fish. Their sushi & sashimi tray is worth mentioning. $47.95 for 43 pieces of sushi sashimi nigiri madness!! Wowzer!
author: Marti L.

description:
Relatively inexpensive sushi, across the street from my apartment, a good selection that can appeal to sushi lovers and those who would rather not indulge in the raw fish, and good beer. 

Only concern - don't sit at the booths next to the entrance. You'll be neglected or forgotten.
author: Victor V.

description:
I've eaten here 2 or 3 times and have never left disappointed. Each time we were seated immediately and received prompt and friendly service. I don't remember what we ordered but I remember the portions were always generous and presented well. Enough for leftovers :) 
I really enjoyed the sushi. It's tasty and fresh enough to have never upset my digestive system. 

I also like the general ambiance of this place. The decor is lovely and the dining area is spacious and well-lit. 

Will be back!
author: Wanda M.

description: the rice is too sticky, i guess they put too much water when they cook the rice.  the tempura sauce is good LOL.  I like to order tonkatsu when I go to JP restaurant but the tonkatsu here is way too fat, I wish they could use better pork to make the katsu.  Been here on Christmas eve, and the restaurant gave us a present ( in fact, each table received one ).  I recommend the Dancing lion roll
author: Kukumalu M.

description: Gone downhill. Why? Because the management refuses to deal with bad behavior from some of its customers. If you like dining in a place where someone will take a call in the restaurant and speak LOUDLY, so loudly that we couldn't hear ourselves speak, then that's a problem. This was at 5:30pm on a weekday afternoon with only two other tables occupied. When we called attention to it by telling a server, she did little to attend to the issue. More training needed here. When customers are unhappy with the behavior of the patrons, the business should intercede. Why dine in a place where people act badly? Bad manners hurts business. I have been eating here for fifteen years. No more.
author: Dennis R.

description:
I was going to give only 3 stars but I bumped them up to another star for their attentive service.

I adore this place back in the days, their prices were affordable and I had so many favorites rolls.. Super Burrito Roll, Baked Salmon Roll, Cherry Blossom Roll, Salmon Sashimi and so forth but after trying out sushi in the East Bay, I had a change in heart but I couldn't stay away from this sushi spot reagrdless of their prices being bumped up and noticing how little cuts the sashimi has gotten.
 
Through it all, the great customer service was what caught me and it keeps me coming back.
author: Anonymous P.

description:
I came here with my boyfriend yesterday for an early dinner at 5:00. They were not crowded, just a few parties scattered around the restaurant, and they had plenty of waiters and waitresses to help us out. Our waitress was very nice and helpful in suggesting which sushi rolls were the spiciest (per our request). She even polled her other co-workers to ask their opinions on the spicy rolls. We ended up ordering 3 rolls, the Tuxedo, the Bumble Bee, and the Eclipse. The Tuxedo was mildly spicy, the Eclipse was moderately spicy, and the Bumble Bee was the spiciest. I would recommend all of these rolls. The fish tasted fresh and the flavors of each roll worked well together. The only downside is that the Bumble Bee and Eclipse rolls took significantly longer to make than the Tuxedo roll, which was surprising because the restaurant was not that busy at the time.

Overall, I would definitely come here again!

Tip: they have a much larger sushi menu when you eat in the restaurant versus their online menu.
author: Stacie W.

description: mmm it's okay!  Not bad, but not the best.  Chicken karaage or tonkatsu when we eat here!  Rolls aren't bad either, but not the freshest sashimi.
author: Michelle K.

description:
I felt adventurous with teammate yesterday so we went here for a late lunch.

I don't usually enjoy eating sushi, but I went out on a limb to try SPECIAL sushi. I detest the feeling of slimy textures in my mouth (okay, sexual innuendos aside).

Teammate ordered the Alaskan roll and the San Francisco roll, while I ordered the caterpillar roll and the pink salmon roll. They tasted pretty good with the soy sauce and wasabi. Sushi is definitely an acquired taste. I'll have to try more before I enjoy eating raw, slimy fish. HAHA

Service was pretty good in the beginning, then it became nearly non-existent. It wasn't busy inside and I felt invisible to the waitress. :(
author: Mabel Y.

description: Me and my boyfriend always come here because it is pretty close to his house. Their sushi's are very generous portions and taste pretty good. We love hamachi so we always order the double hamachi roll and it always fails disappoint us because it's so good. Dinner time sometimes gets pretty packed so you should come early before the crowd especially on weekends.
author: Michele M.

description: one of my favorite spots to get sushi in the Sunset. i primarily stick to ordering their rolls, and they offer a really good variety to chose from. their service can be slow at times, but if you need a sushi fix, this is the place to go.
author: Mike C.

description:
It seems like the first time you go to a restaurant it`s always AMAZING! That`s what I thought of at first but the 2nd time I came here it did not beat the first time.

Reason why I say that is because whoever made my sushi for my first visit was unforgivable. The rolls were decently shaped, they were generous on the fish meat, and it was very delicious. But on my 2nd visit here.. whoever made my sushi was the opposite! They loaded on the rice and the slices of fish meat were thin and tearing apart.. Not cool at all.

What made me fall in love with this place was the fact that they have sukiyaki for cheap! Only $8! Oh mah gawddddd! Sukiyaki is hard to find in Japanese restaurants and even so if you order one they`re verrrrry expensive!

Please... on my 3rd visit I hope you improve the sushi like my first visit then maybe I`ll edit this review and make it better!
author: Johanah I.

description: Since I was young I would always come to this Japanese spot. I would come when it barely opened. I still come now that I'm older. I came here today and it was soooo bomb. I got something new the yakitori. Which was absolutely delicious. I got some old fashion coffee ice scream like I did when I was young. This place brings back so much memories. From birthdays to family gathering to graduations. This place is part of my childhood. I love this Japanese Restaraunt.
author: Yasuko R.

description: My cousin turned me on to this place.  The first thing I tried here was the favorite sushi tray.  I love that they deliver!  Food is very fresh and delicious.  I've even ordered Bento boxes with tempura for delivery, and everything was hot, fresh, and the tempura was still crispy.  I ordered delivery more than once.  We also got the pan fried shrimp appetizer, and tonkatsu, all very good.  Quality is consistent, and portions are very generous.  I wish they included a paper menu with the delivery for my future orders.  My favoirite delivery restaurant in Outer Sunset!
author: Marvella W.

description: I come here every time I am in San Francisco. The portions are huge for the cost. The sushi is very good and big. They have an extensive menu, and the price is very fair. One of my favorite places.
author: Greg L.

description:
Whenever I need a sushi fix, I either want 1) super good quality 2) something cheap or fast 3) homey, Noriega Teriyaki House satisfies that third need for me.  It's my favorite "down the block" sushi house, as it's family owned, which I love.  

Sushi is pretty good, especially for the price.  I really love that Emperor's New Roll.  The dinners are great there too, my favorite probably being either chicken kara-age (pan fried) or chicken teriyaki.  I love the tempura too!  This is the sushi place my family and I have been visiting for years, at least since the 1990s, when the restaurant used to be located on Noriega & 22nd Avenue.  I always come at least once a week!
author: Jocelyn L.

description:
3.5 stars

Reasonably priced, but I wasn't too impressed with the food. Maybe I ordered the wrong thing, but I got the teriyaki chicken lunch combo. Afterall, it's called a Teriyaki House, so I figured I should go for their specialty. I must say, though, the teriyaki was pretty good! Not too sweet, but still flavorful. However, the one thing I did not like about it was that my chicken was really dry =/ Meh. I also got the salmon sashimi (sake) and it was fresh and creamy. Yum!

I also recommend the tuna poke... it's really spicy good! The kara-age chicken is okay, it reminded me of a better quality popcorn chicken... I'm also a huge fan of the salad! It's so refreshing, especially with the salad dressing and the small appetizer.

Overall pretty good dining experience. Definitely comes in huge proportions, which is a huge plus.
author: Janet H.

description:
This place is really close to where I live and my friend and I come here on occasion. 
The food may be a bit overpriced I think, but the quality is there. 

One of the rolls I've ordered there was the golden Ox roll and I really enjoyed it. 

I had a dinner social for my student org from SFSU there in the back room and they really took care of us. They even gave everyone a free ice cream at the end.
author: Eric M.

description:
This restaurant is literally my 4th home. 

I have been coming to this place since before I was born, in my Mama's belly, at its previous location. While enjoying dinner last night, my sister and dad estimated that we have frequented this establishment over 400 times since we were born. No joke. That is how devoted we are to Noriega TH. And for good reason. 

I could drink a barrel of their green tea. Their miso soup is ridiculously good. Harumaki to die for. Teriyaki sauce is finger-licking. Everything tempura is fried well, not oily or hardened. Fresh food, served with aesthetics in mind, by people who know you and care whether you have a happy meal. 

This is a great place for family, dates, friends, or a quiet night in a sleepy neighborhood. 

Come check it out! I'll probably be around :)
author: Elizabeth J.

description: Very mediocre non-authentic Japanese food.  If you're hungry, then please do come in and eat your heart out.  If you're looking for something much better, go up the street to Fujiyama Ya which provides much better quality and authentic Japanese food.
author: Joel M.

description:
I tried this place once and the sushi was definitely not fresh. The staff here was so nice that I decided to give it another try. The second time was actually worse! I was so disappointed that I actually didn't even finish my rolls, which never happens.

I eat pretty much all sushi and don't think of myself as that picky, but there is something about the sushi here that just doesn't taste fresh at all! 

I wanted to like this place because I live one block away, but I just can't do it. Sad!
author: Laura M.

description: I ordered the dragon balls, titanic roll, and more. The portions were large but the taste was too much. They covered all their rolls with too much sauce which covered the taste of the fish.
author: Justin H.

description:
So we live a few blocks from this place and it's convenient so we order there about once a month.  It's not run by Japanese, so it's not 100% authentic, but the food is ok. 

I recently placed an order and it was repeated back to me.  We go and pick up the food, take it home and realize that they gave us the wrong sushi.  When we called to explain that the order was wrong, the lady who always answers the phone insisted that it was our mistake and not hers. We asked if they could deliver us the correct sushi and she insisted that we bring it back to exchange. (Don't advertise delivery services if you're not willing to take it a few blocks!)  She did not apologize for the inconvenience and still insisted that we were wrong.  

I guess they just lost some repeat customers.  It doesn't seem like they would care, except that they probably should because we often have huge family dinners there, so they just lost themselves a lot of business.  

What kind of customer service is that!  It's total BS!  We ended up taking all the food back and asking for a refund.  The lady refunded our food and that was that, no apology or anything.  

If you're looking for mediocre food and rude customer service, this is the place for you.  They will never go out of their way to accommodate you.  If you're ok with that, then this is your go to place. 

Enjoy!
author: S L.

description:
By no means is it the BEST sushi in all the land, but the massive amount of food for the low prices is certainly the winning factor of Noriega Teriyaki. It's another instance of quantity over quality, but at the same time, their quality is pretty damn decent for what you're paying. The rolls are GINORMOUS, which is alright with me because I looooove rice. Service is pretty awesome too, tho I'm a little biased since my friend use to work here :). 

Parking sucks.
author: Jen L.

description: I love this place and all its different combinations and choices. I usually get the dinner special for two with my brother and it always fills us both up. For lunch I always get something different here at times just udon, but sometimes the lunch specials. This place makes great sushi rolls and udon. It also has special kinds of food like quail eggs. Overall I would still come back to this restaurant.
author: Lawrence Y.

description: good sushi, good chicken teriyaki extremely poor beef teriyaki.  i had it (beef teriyaki) delivered and if i had eaten it there i would have sent it back, large portion of fat.  so after over 40 deliver and takeout orders i'm done with this place.
author: Robert S.

description: Anywhere my mom brings me when I come back home means a lot for this NY transplant. The sashimi and hamachi are fresh and banging- easily my favorite items on the menu. The staff is always pleasant and helpful. Overall,I'm a huge fan of this place.
author: Jilleen l.

description:
Jolene L. and I decided to come here on the recommendations of a mutual friend. The decor is very clean and homey. I liked that they had plenty of seats and space for big and small groups.

We got seated right away and I ordered the tropical roll cause I love mango and avocado...the execution however was a little on the meh side. It had way too much mayonnaise...I had hoped for more unagi but the mango didn't really add to the overall flavor. Jolene got herself the tempera platter, and she was okay with it.

Service was brisk and they were very helpful with my niece's food, chair needs. You know this is a family run neighborhood when I bumped into a co-worker and her friend and then someone from my China trip all at the same time, eating at the same place!

Overall, an OK place to hang with friends and family. Parking around is metered or if you're lucky along the side streets for free.
author: Pauline L.

description:
First time here we ordered the teriyaki roll, caterpillar, crazy roll, dancing lion roll. Super BIG rolls definitely get your money's worth. Service was good, the inside is nice. It's in a convenient neighborhood. The rolls themselves where pretty tasty. I'd definitely come back :) 
The minus one star is for sitting us in the back corner of the restaurant! The place is empty we wanted a window seat.
author: Denishia L.

description:
Sushi Double Sake was delicious.
Won Ton Soup was awful, no taste from broth and won ton had strange taste. 
Service was slow but the servers are sweet but overworked. 
Don't come here if you only have an hour lunch.
author: Mario A.

description:
Gordon Ramsay would have a field day - he could put this place on kitchen nightmares. The place is big and the staff well meaning, but the place is terribly dated and the food is suffering. 
First, upon entering you see (and smell) this ugly 1970's looking waterfall / fake tree thing. Management - this thing has to go. It smells like an old fish tank and has no place in a restaurant. I can't imagine it's sanitary in the sushi bar. It's ugly, smelly and wastes space. 
The next thing you notice are the huge unused "board room" tables which look straight out of 1963 (along with the dated but cool light fixtures). Honestly - if you have so much space that you can leave these huge empty tables... Better to get rid of them, improve the food and fill up a lot of small tables.
Then we sat and I can't complain except the furniture, floor and decor is dated and worn out. The look of the place got me preparing for an out of date and less than satisfying meal. Pretty hard to do with Japanese food but they did not fail to disappoint. 
Look - I support small business and love it that these guys have a big restaurant for decades. But you have to update and keep up with the times. They have a big corner space - update it and make it a success again. 
Ok so then comes the free cucumber appetizers which are covered in a yellow sugar sauce from 1977 which I can only describe as disgusting. Borderline old cucumber in nasty yellow goo. Not a good start. 
The hot sake comes with the bottle floating in a bamboo thing filled with disgusting dirty water. We figured out this was an attempt to serve the sake in hot water. The funny part was that the sake was not the correct body temperature, but still tepid. So the bamboo tube doesn't work. Inside the bamboo is a lot of muck and black stuff - I don't even know what, but it's dirty. All I could think is "great - now we have to be careful not to drip this nasty water on our food." Get rid of the bamboo, people. It's gross. 
Then the sushi comes. Covered in mayonnaise. Good quality fish, way too much avocado, way terrible sauce. Honestly mayo has no place on sushi - it's all we could taste. Nasty. 
Then the cooked food arrived. Since it's the teriyaki house, we got some teriyaki dishes. Beef teriyaki - the meat was completely untrimmed and about 1/3 inedible fat. Gristle on both ends. Undercooked and chewy, but good flavor from a bottle of teriyaki sauce. Salmon was quite good. However, the bulk of the plate was covered in salad - bad salad. Brown lettuce and 1 skinny tomato slice. Pathetic greens, left uneaten. 
All in all, the service was excellent, the food was presented nicely, but the decor is terrible and the food needs a major update. Can't recommend this place at all when there are so many great Japanese restaurants right down the street. On the plus side, my dining partner has been there a few times and says the sushi is good. The rolls on the menu look interesting, but the one I tried was not impressive. The fish quality seemed good, but hard to tell covered in mayo.
author: Bill W.

description:
It's alright here, definitely not one of my favorite Japanese or sushi places, but then again, I didn't buy the special rolls. Not great, but not bad either.

When we arrived, we were instantly seated and they brought us waters and a pot of tea, which is really nice. It happened to be one of my favorites- Barley Tea. :) The service overall was good, they didn't leave us waiting and were good about checking up on us. The setting of the place was pretty nice! There's a fake garden-like area when you first walk in. They seated us at a rather large table, so it was a bit awkward trying to figure out how to sit. But they were relatively busy. There was no line, but they were filled up.

My friend and I shared some dishes, so we went for the basic rolls and Soba Noodles. The basic rolls I got was Sushi Combo #3 (Hamachi Maki, Maguro, Unagi, Tako, Ebi). My favorite from that selection was the Maguro. I didn't particularly like the Hamachi Maki but everything else was okay.Then, we also got the Chicken Soba which I didn't think was very good, actually. It was plain and didn't have that much flavor.

To be fair, I did enjoy my friend's roll. I think it was the Cherry Blossom Roll, but whatever it was, it was delicious!

This place just wasn't outstanding enough with all of the Japanese restaurants around, but the prices are pretty decent and maybe I just need to give it another try with the Special Rolls!
author: Ivy L.

description:
Don't try the mussel appetizers. After eating them I felt like I drank a cup of vegetable oil. 

The service was alright. The gentleman that served as our waiter looked like he'd rather be anywhere else. He went missing for quite some time as our food was sitting ready to be served on the chefs counter. The lady from the back had to come and serve it to us because the waiter was no where to be found.

Although the mussels were horrible, I thoroughly enjoyed the sushi. I ordered a spicy tuna roll and it was delish. My boyfriend had some seafood soup which was amazing as well. I'd give them 4 stars for their sushi but the service and the appetizer demoded them to 3 stars. I wouldn't go back to this place.
author: Kirita S.

description:
I cant believe this place has 3.5 stars. I guess to each their own, and not everyone can always be pleased. 

We came yesterday for Mothers Day and everything was unbelievable from start to finish. The service was great (even though they were SUPER PACKED) and everything that we ordered was delicious. My husband had the steak/tempura dinner and the steak was beyond tender and super tasty. Hes picky with steak and he LOVED every bite of it. 

We have also had great sushi at other places, this place by far is one of the best. Even though I always prefer sushi, i would love to come back and try their Ramen soup next time. Such a great variety of delicious food!

Thank you so much for making my mom and grandma so full and happy, and the rest of us!
author: Boops D.

description:
I think I've been here once, long long time ago. I honestly don't remember why I didn't come here again after that one time but after today I KNOW why...'cuz it sucks!!  

I ordered the combo udon. I honestly have never seen small Shanghai-typed noodles used in a bowl of udon before.  I was expecting the big fat noodles.  They also put into the bowl chunks of salmon that were so fatty that I had to throw half of them out...and this is coming from someone who loves salmon.  They also had a chunk of cooked tuna that was so fishy it was pure disgusting.  I hated my dish.  So disappointed.

Also ordered the sushi combo B that had salmon,  hamachi,  tuna,  egg nigiris and 3 "California rolls."  The California rolls came out with the seaweed outside.  Am I wrong to assume that California rolls usually have the rice outside?  When asked, they said, oh it's their style and if we wanted the rice outside we would need to ask. Really?

Would not come back again.

=================
Review #138
author: Jannie Q.

description: Only 3 stars?!  I happen to think this is one of the better sushi places in the Sunset.  Good rolls and large bento boxes are the main reason I come.  They also have a good sized kids meal that comes with a toy.  I thought SF outlawed that.  They uses a good cut of steak for their teriyaki.  It's also not over marinated like Okazu ya.  It's grilled steak (ribeye) with teriyaki sauce over it.
author: Robert G.

description: A star taken off because of a new waitress.  It was a terribly busy Saturday evening and there were no tables available, so we decided to eat at the bar.  My daughter had ordered from the children's menu.  We got our food, but the waitress drops one of the pocky sticks from the plate onto the floor and said she would get my daughter another one.  Well, we never got the pocky stick and the waitress conveniently forgets the whole incident.  We asked and she just said she doesn't even remember that happening.  If it had been sushi or something bigger, I would have asked the manager on duty to talk to us about this.  The waitress didn't apologize or anything.  She said they don't give out extras?!  I'm sorry, but we wouldn't have asked for more if it wasn't dropped by her.  I almost vowed never to come back again.  However we did come back because of other family members wanting sushi.  Fortunately, she wasn't there that night.  Everything turned out fine that evening.  We have been customers at this restaurant for about 4 yrs and have never had this waitress or this kind of service.  Still pretty disappointed in how she handled this situation.  I'm hoping she quits because she's not fit to be a waitress.
author: A. C.

description: Very noisy atmosphere. Not good for romantic or any sort of date occasion. It's more for families. Food is descent.
author: Cindy C.

description:
It's not the best sushi in town, but for a neighborhood joint, I'm definitely a fan. I normally come here with the boyfriend when we are craving some sake sashimi, and at 8pcs for $10, it's definitely one of the more reasonable places around. (if anyone knows better, please let me know. I LIVE on sake sashimi!)

Can't say much for service. Since it's just the two of us, we usually sit at the bar (no wait) and order directly with the sushi chefs. Servers are very prompt at bringing tea though.

Some of the things I've had:
- Pot of clams: I think you can pass on this. Nothing special. Taste like clams steamed in ocean water, but not overly fishy.
+ Sake Sashimi: fresh, big pieces. 'nuff said.
+ Double Sake Roll: Fresh salmon inside, and baked salmon outside? Yum,

I'll be back.
author: Jenna H.

description:
I've been here multiple times and the food doesn't disappoint. I usually always order the salmon teriyaki with tempura. I love how their dinner combinations come with a scoop of ice cream too (not many come with dessert). The salmon was grilled perfectly as tasted delicious. 

Sure the service could be slow sometimes, but other times, they're on top of it.

I know this is an Asian restaurant, but I think the girls that work here should still follow the rule of having their hair tied up, especially if they're serving food. I don't think anyone wants a little surprise ending up in their food.
author: Sabrina S.

description: Love Noriega Teriyaki.Whenever I come for lunch or dinner, the service is good and portions are great. I never leave hungry or disappointed. Recently they catered our Veterans Graduation for 225 people.  Our guests enjoyed the food selection and preparation. Very good neighborhood Japanese restaurant!
author: Rogelio M.

description:
Went here for a dinner with about 5 or 6 friends a couple of weeks ago and it had it's ups and downs while I was there. We had a reservation at 6 and was seated promptly.

I ordered Chicken Teriyaki and Beef Teriyaki over rice which was definitely a nice portion size. It came with a salad and miso soup as well. The price ended being like $15 so it's okay not bad but maybe a little bit high too. Overall the food tasted pretty good as well.

Biggest turn off was when we were eating dessert, the waiter asked us to move because there was a party waiting for our table. I've never heard someone ask another person to move when they aren't finished eating. Rushed us out afterwards. VERY VERY RUDE! Probably wouldn't come back
author: M. L.

description:
Finally I've found a good sushi place in San Francisco! Totally stumbled on this place while heading to Safeway (didn't wanna shop on a empty stomache). The big plates are real good. And if you don't eat it all it holds up well for lunch the next day. Miso soup is good, rolls are good value for money, fried salad was awesome and the green tea ice cream is delicious!

Bad - I wish there was pickled ginger on the table.
author: Ciarán M.

description: BAD BAD Service with uncomfortable seat...it's Friday. I'm here again just myself so a waitress took me to a very very small table. But I like more room and it's around 5:10pm still early, the restaurant quite empty too. so I asked another waitress to let me change table. She wouldn't let, she said that is their POLICY. I ordered $30 food+tips and I can't get a comfortable table to sit? What POLICY is that? Shouldn't customer feel comfortable is ur policy? The food ok not special outstanding. The whole time I was eating I didn't feel comfortable at all with this kind of service, eventho I want to add more food but I didn't.
author: M Y.

description: This place there waiters have bad attitude! I came in the noon, just two people in there! A lot of table, they let me sit down in a very small table and also nearby door also nearby the cleaning table!!! I ask to change my please, and they let me change, but they feel so impatiently!
author: Yifan Q.

description:
Noriega Teriyaki House is a Sunset neighborhood favorite and has been a local friend's staple for many years.  One of the only places open relatively late on Memorial Day, we decided to indulge in some Japanese food.

I ordered the chirashi bowl, an assortment of sashimi over rice, and sort of resembled a deconstructed sushi roll.  The meal started with some miso soup, which I thought was under seasoned and sort of bland.  I enjoy the variety of fish offered in the bowl and usually really enjoy the sushi rice.  However, the rice wasn't very well vinegared in this case and was barely warm.  The fish quality was reasonable, though not nearly as fresh as Shimo's, and the pieces were impressively large.  The tuna and red snapper were definitely my two favorite pieces of fish in this particular selection.

We also ordered the San Francisco roll (spicy tuna roll topped with eel and avocado) and the double hamachi roll (hamachi roll topped with hamachi and avocado).  I found neither very special and both felt unimaginative.

The meal was finished with a small scoop of green tea ice cream, which had a neon green, almost unappetizing, glow to it.  It tasted decent enough, but like the rest of the meal, was only mediocre.  This was no Mitchell Brothers ice cream.

Overall, Noriega Teriyaki House gets a passing grade from me, but I don't think that I would go too far out I my way for it.  It was fairly expensive for what you got and, for the money, I would definitely expect the quality bar to be raised.  If you're in the area, check it out, by don't expect to be blown away.

Food: 6/10

Service: 6/10

Price: $$

Atmosphere: 6/10
author: Joe M.

description:
Came here for New Years Dinner.  While not many places are open on NYD, Norega is bangin'.  Asians could care less if it's a holiday.  They Open!!

But...Why are there so many good reviews?  Why were there so many people eating at this establishment?  We went here after we realized that we were tired of our other eating hole.  Lots of people means good food, right?

Not.

The wait was bearable, the service sufficed, but the food was just.not.that.great.

I ordered the San Francisco Roll, and my mom ordered the beef teriyaki and tempura combo platter.  

The San Francisco roll was supposed to have spicy tuna in it, topped with eel and avocado.  The spicy tuna looked like expired old uni.  I'm pretty good with textural foods, but this was out of the park.  Effing disgusting as I chewed and swallowed it down.  

The Beef Teri and tempura combo platter came with an appetizer, soup, and a small scoop of ice cream or sorbet for desert.  (That's where the two stars came from).  The beef teriyaki looked almost boiled with fake char marks on it, with a measly splash of teriyaki sauce.  Broccoli tempura is my favorite, so I grabbed that out of the tempura.  it was raw in side!  Ew... uncooked tempura batter.  Damn it, this dinner is getting worse!!

Saving grace was the sorbet ice cream at the end.  And if that's your saving grace, your restaurant needs help.  Sorry.  No bueno in my book.  Never again.
author: Cat A.

description:
[M]ona: 3 Stars
[W]ayne: 4 Stars
Average: 3.5 Stars

+ Clean
+ Good service
+ Reasonable Prices

-  Not fresh

[M] Not my go-to place for Japanese cuisine but Wayne and I wanted sushi for lunch without traveling a far distance and putting a hole in our wallets. First place that came to mind was Noriega Teriyaki House which is just a few blocks away from my place. I've been here a few times, and the food was quite decent.

We were seated right away and served green tea in a huge tea pot by this nice Chinese lady. I'm a huge tea drinker so I hate going to restaurants where I have to keep asking for refills. Here they give you a gigantic pot, so you can refill yourself. 

We decided on the following sushis: 

PANDA ROLL (7 pieces): This is supposed to be one of their specialty rolls. I didn't find it special at all... It was white tuna, unagi, avocado and topiko on top of what might have been a California roll? I forgot... The tuna wasn't fresh, and the ingredients don't go well together in my opinion. We won't be ordering this next time.

FUTOMAKI (8 pieces): Yummy, but nothing special.

PINK SALMON ROLL (8 pieces): My favorite out of the 4 rolls. The salmon was hot and steamy. The fish was very tender. I've had Pink Salmon Rolls at other restaurants where the salmon is cooked all the way so it becomes dry. Here they make it perfectly.

SPICY SCALLOP ROLL (6 pieces): I really wouldn't this a Spicy Scallop Roll... It's more like a Scallop Roll with hot sauce drizzled on top? The scallops were tasteless and the hot sauce wasn't even hot at all! Wayne liked it though.

TAMAGO NIGIRI (2 pieces): The tamago (eggs) was sweet. I like my eggs that way but it was cold and tasted refrigerated. 

This place is really a 2.5 to 3 stars for me, but I'll give it a 3 since the waitress was very attentive and the service was good. Our tab was $40.03 plus tip. Not bad for 2 people.
author: Mona C.

description: it is definately my favorite! the price and the taste are just awesome!! i always get a sashimi assorted thing (a big bowl of sashimi) and one steam rice
author: Qianjun P.

description:
1. Emperor's new roll: B- : nice and filling

2. Chicken udon: C : did not expect these "udon" noodles. These are thin and round, not the thick ones I expected. The chicken was good, hence the C
author: Gary W.

description: Coming here on New Year's Day was packed, but we didn't wait long to get seated. They had great customer service because the waiters would come to the table to ask if everything is alright. They were very happy too! I love coming here to get there combination dinners which are good! I would love coming back here again.
author: Brittany L.

description:
HORRBILE BUSINESS.  We used to like coming here since we live close by.  Each time we went to the restaurant in the 6 months, they serve everyone at the table except one person.  So one person gets to sit there and watch everyone else eat.  They either forget to cook, give a dinner away to another table, who know what but they usually leave one person with no dinner to eat until maybe half way through the dinner, then they finally come by with the last dinner.  Also, last time I went, the shrimp tempura was so awful, the shrimp tasted rotten and shriveled up.  I took the thick heavy tempura batter off and there was only a shrivel of a shrimp under there.  I think they cut the shrimp into three long little slices to save money.

The waiters/waitresses don't pay any attention to any of us in the table.  Last night, I was the one who didn't get my dinner.  I was left there sitting, watching everyone else at my table eat, and I had nothing to eat.  The waitress didn't come by, had no idea that my dinner didn't arrive.  Finally after about 10 minutes, I asked where my dinner was.  She said they gave it away to another table.  So i had to wait another 10 minutes to get my dinner.  By this time, most of my family had already eaten half their dinner.  My family couldn't offer me any of their dinner because I don't eat meat and they order meat.

I called back this morning to complain and to get my tip back since I was stupid enough to leave a tip.  The workers there were useless and told me to call back later, which means I have to waste more time talking with these horrible people.

WAITRESS DIDN'T OFFER ANYTHING TO MAKE UP FOR THE BAD SERVICE.  

DON'T COME TO THIS RIDICULOUSLY BAD SERVICED RESTAURANT!!!!!!!
author: Esther K.

description:
I went here today after work for my dinner ( To Go ). I ordered Sea Bass with Tempura and Harumaki ( Japanese Egg Rolls ). My total was "$23.90" When I got home I noticed they didn't give me a Salad or Soup. I called the restaurant and asked the Lady, "Am I supposed to get a Soup and Salad with my Dinner?, I think You guys FORGOT." Then she said," You're not supposed to get a Salad but definitely I'm Supposed to get a Soup with my Dinner" . Then , that's it!  NO SORRY! About that and then  there's a few seconds of silence, and I said, "OH OK, Thank-You!" 

When I opened the Box not much Sea Bass on top of  LOT AND LOTS OF RICE ( The Sea Bass is so tiny and definitely NOT FRESH  - The part that's DISGUSTING and WEIRD is that it Taste BITTER! ) The Tempura consist of 1 small carrot the size of my pinkie, one zucchini ( and again the size of my pinkie ), One Broccoli and Two Pieces of Shrimp. All of This was Fried to Death That I can't even Tell if it's really a Shrimp that I am Eating or is it one of the Vegetables. 

The Harumaki was so greasy that when i bit into it some of the Grease or Oil, however you want to call it, pour out all over my lips and mouth.Not much Stuffing in the Harumaki. I can't tell if there's vegetables, glass noodles, shrimp or beef inside. Again the Egg Rolls was DOWNSIZED to a MIDGET size PINKIE!

Sadly,Today I got ROBBED!!! Even though I got Robbed TODAY!  I will NEVER! NEVER! , EVER COMING BACK!! So Basically, You guys just ROBBED me ONCE! It Won't Happen Again! Noriega Teriyaki House Lost a Customer For Life!! 

P.S. ****  Kindly Train Your employees on the Proper Etiquette of Customer Service and Apologizing when you guys made a MISTAKE and not be so  MIGHTY HIGH and PROUD!!  A simple " I'm Sorry we FORGOT to give you Soup with your Dinner Will Do". Just Act like you guys Give a Damned! about your Job or the Customer ( Even if you don't - just PRETEND!  ROLE PLAY ! ). Because I am a Paying Customer Right???? This is NOT  FREE FOOD RIGHT????

In the end of a Quick Phone Conversation, I am the One who Said 
"Thank-You!" I should have said how I was feeling that Time which is "THANK-YOU! FOR ROBBING ME TODAY!! and THANK-YOU for YOUR  GREAT CUSTOMER SERVICE! cause it REALLY SHOWS YOU GIVE A DAMNED ABOUT YOUR WORK OR THE PAYING CUSTOMER!" Girl! You're very Sympathetic or is it "PATHETIC" !!! Hehe
author: myra a.

description: Solid, reasonably priced, good variety, quality sushi and fresh sea food. Good for groups or small parties. We went for a birthday and the bday boy got a fried ice cream mochi! We ordered a combo plate for two and that was plentiful enough for four, supplemented with some sushi. Service is friendly and eager to please.
author: E. W.

description:
I went to Noriega Teriyaki House with my boyfriend on a co-worker's recommendation. Love that they have an expansive menu - lots of options for both sushi, grilled items, and even noodles. We arrived at 5:45 and were seated immediately. However, a few minutes after us, the place quickly got packed. Be sure to get here early or expect a wait. 

Here's what we ordered:
- Chasu Ramen ($7.95): The broth wasn't as thick as I prefer, but it was still yummy. Flavors reminded me of "saimin" back home. Lots of vegetables, which was a plus; but only two pieces of pork. Otherwise, the bowl is HUGE, so expect leftovers. 
- Dancing Lion Roll ($9.75): Awesome! Unagi over a shrimp tempura roll (can't remember what else was in it). It had a perfect crunch and was especially tasty. Hands down, my favorite part of the meal. Hella pieces to boot!
- Tekka Maki ($3.45)
- California Roll ($3.95)

Overall, we had a positive experience here and are likely to come back for more! FYI - street and meter parking only, and it's right across a Walgreens, therefore the area's pretty busy. Budget extra time to find a spot especially during peak times ;)
author: Nicole I.

description:
I've been here on more than one occasion, but after eating here for lunch yesterday, I decided to Yelp about this place...

...since I don't quite remember all my other eating experiences here.

So, my friends and I arrived here close to 4pm and was immediately seated by the waitress - owner's wife(?) - whom handed us the menus. I don't remember her greeting us with a hello or a nice, gentle "please take your time" but shrugs, whatever. When I first saw her facial expression and body langauge, I felt like we were a burden to her already - as if she thought we were some obnoxious tween girls getting ready to create chaos in the restaurant. Psh.

Anyhow, I ordered the lunch combo of chicken kara-age and tempura ($9.95). It came with a bowl of miso soup, sunomono (cucumbers with special yellow sauce), a potato croquette, and a bowl of steamed rice. I loved the fried tempura the most. The fried broccoli and shrimp... YUM. The potato croquette was pretty good too. Soft and had an almost buttery-like texture. The chicken kara-age was alright, but I still prefer chicken teriyaki or chicken katsu. The breading was different - not as crunchy as a katsu's breading.

I wish they added free green tea ice cream to the lunch combos cause I always crave for something sweet after every meal. Sad face. And I wanted a sushi roll but it's crazy expensive here.

***OK experience but I was kinda baffled when I asked the waitress if I could switch my $20 bill for smaller bills. She didn't even go to the cashier... instead, she had to ask the workers for $1 and $5 bills. I was so confused with what was going on because she disappeared into the back of the kitchen for a minute or two, while I stood in front of the counter like an idiot, not knowing what she was doing with my money.

Eh. I think my first few eating experiences here were better. But perhaps it was just one of those "off days" for the workers so I'll cut them some slack and give them 3.5 Yelp stars in my book. (Sadly, it's rounded down to 3 stars instead of 4...)
author: Annie S.

description:
Noriega Teriyaki House is like the reliably competitive practice squad center on your basketball team.  He will never be your first, second, or third choice to play in a big game, but if everyone other big man comes down with the stomach flu, you know he will be available.  In the same way, NTH is a serviceable option for a large party, but never the destination of choice to satisfy a craving.

Although the $15 Special For At Least Two is fulfilling in quantity, the heaps of tempura fried vegetables, tempura fried shrimp, tempura fried seaweed-wrapped salmon, and saucy but tough teriyaki beef provided scant flavor variety.  Towards the end of the meal, the vegetables, shrimp, and salmon can barely be distinguished from one another due to its textural and taste similarities.  

The complementary green tea ice cream is the unquestioned star of the meal, which speaks more to the quality of the meal than the ice cream's exceptionality.
author: Andrew M.

description: Do not order the dinner specials. I paid $15 for a teriyaki and tempura dinner plate that looked like they heated up a frozen dinner and put it on a plate. For $15, they gave me one measly strip of cold teriyaki chicken. Service was decent, but not worth the money I ended up spending there.
author: Alice W.

description:
This was my second visit and it was definitely another hit for me and the family. They're usually packed every time we're there, even on a weeknight so be sure to call ahead.

Pros:
-Reasonably priced standard Japanese fare/options and delicious fresh sushi! Our favorites include: the combo meals, beef teriyaki, ramen and the 43 piece sushi/sasimi tray.
-Awesome kids meal options! Kids can choose from a variety of dishes like chicken katsu or teriyaki, with rice, fruit and a free toy!
-Dessert included! Free green tea or coffee ice cream is always a plus. 

Cons:
-Service can lag a bit if they're busy, but they make up for it in friendliness and definitely the food.
author: Sarah L.

description:
I've eaten here several times with family and friends but today I decided to try out their delivery service. The gentleman on the phone told me 45 minutes to an hour but the food was at my door in less then half an hour... and we ordered a lot of food!

I love their combination menu, especially their teriyakis and tempuras, just yummy!! Their sushi, including the California roll is loved by my siblings. You have to appreciate the portions as well as all the side dishes included in many of the dinner menu items, including the so delicious miso soup and that scope of sorbet to end this flavorful experience.
author: Ms. Hala A.

description: I really like their rolls but the sashimi isn't the greatest. Really big for a Japanese restaurant which is nice. Service is just Ok.
author: Anastasia P.

description:
So this family owned restaurant is probably one of the best Japanese food restaurants in San Francisco. As you walk in, you immediately notice that the restaurant is large and roomy and the staff is super friendly. I've ordered their dinner combination/entrees and I have to say that their food is DELICIOUS! 

Their tonkatsu, chicken kara-age, tempura and teriyaki are cooked perfectly every time I've eaten here. Also note, the portions when compared to other Japanese food restaurants in San Francisco are HUGE!!! (Think Costco proportions of your entree in comparison to your common small-shop Japanese food restaurant.) 

Don't forget that ice-cream dessert is included with dinner too!!! 

Definitely would recommend to anyone looking for great food, huge portions, and super friendly staff!!!
author: Nick C.

description: It was not bad. Our server was nice and the menu had many options. So much so that it was a little overwhelming. I ordered the unaju (eel over rice) while bf ordered chicken karaage. Our orders came out suspiciously quick.. Our meal came with pickled cucumbers and miso soup. The unaju was filling with a huge piece of eel but I probably should have opted for something else b/c I learned that I can't handle too much eel. Bf's chicken karaage looked ok but he liked it. Next time I'll probably try their sushi rolls. They looked pretty good.
author: Emily M.

description:
This is one of my favorite places to go for sushi. I love the tea they serve!
Great sushi, clean, and nice servers. Get the green tea icecream.
author: Christina G.

description: The food here was not good at all. It didnt look appetizing and overall just didnt look good. I ordered the lunch specials with soup and rice, the soup was pretty good but the food itself was not. I ordered the unagi roll and it did not look or taste fresh. There was also a piece of hair in my cucumber appetizer in which the waitress took back and laughed... Not the correct way to address food with hair in it???
