If you are in this area looking for japanese food there is a place much better down the street between 19th and 20th.
author: Katie C.

description:
I haven't been here in years, okay, maybe a year.

Came here around 2:50PM for lunch today. We ordered the Lunch Special...$10.95 per person, with 2 or more people. You get miso soup, rice, su...I'm not even going to attempt it (it was cucumbers), beef teriyaki, chicken karage, and tempura (shrimp, string beans, squash, broccoli, potato...). My friend wanted to order sushi along with this. I told her not to, because the lunch combination special included A LOT OF FOOD.

It was so good, because we were starving. Surprisingly, we actually finished it. I felt so full after eating only half of my portion. I don't know if it's me or what, but the beef teriyaki and chicken karage were really salty. You HAD to eat it with rice.

Oh yeah, it was pretty empty when we came in. It wasn't lunch time...it's usually a bit more crowded.
author: Kylie L.

description: This place is alright. I just really didn't know where to grab Japanese food around the hood, so I settled with Noriega teriyaki house. Came here on New Years day to find that they were open.. and very surprised since some other places were closed for the "holiday". We got seated right away, even though the place was packed.. guess we got lucky with the table. Any who, the menu is pretty big, lots of selections and we decided on two lunch plates and a roll. I couldn't decide on which roll I wanted and the 49er roll sounded good (especially since they won that day).. lol.. but sadly I didn't know the scallops were raw.. so it was super fishy and hard to go down after a crazy night of NYE drinking.. overall though, the roll was good and the sashimi tasted fresh. I got the chicken karage lunch plate and it was huge! It came with a big ol salad, a fried potato and rice. Definitely worth it and I barely touched my plate since I was already full from the miso soup and sushi.. so I had lots of left overs to take home.
author: Tiff C.

description: Its pretty gross. It use to be better when they were up the street. Got a spicy tuna roll, tempura and another roll. The rice fell apart from the roll very easily so it was very messy. The spicy tuna wasn't spicy and my friends beef teriyaki was over cooked and hard
author: Rater 1.

description: My family and I have eaten at this place since it was two blocks away in a much smaller space. For some time we were left unhappy. Their rolls were all rice with little substance. We just ordered from them last night b/c my dad is obsessed withe their Tiger Roll. Wellll, we were very pleasantly surprised to find that the sushi has returned to its former greatness. The fish was fresh, the rolls were not all rice, and they were all delicious!! Oh, and my dad was still super happy with the Tiger Roll!
author: Michelle I.

description: Food was alright but if you are a serious Japanese food lover I'm sure you'd prefer somewhere better. I got dry thirsty mouth after I ate there, assumed they added lots of MSG in their broth...
author: Jocelyn S.

description: Looking for a Japanese restaurant cooked and served by Chinese people? Then, this is the place. If this restaurant is not located 2 blocks from my house, then I don't think I would go back. I usually get their dinner combo that comes with appetizer, egg rolls, and ice cream. Considering the pricing, the food are not that great, really.
author: Lovetoeat A.

description:
My man has been coming here since he was in high school, so of course whenever I want Japanese food in the city this is where he suggests we go.  So far, I've been here twice.  But...it's all about the CHICKEN KARAAGE....mmm *rubs tummy!*  It's perfectly fried with this amazing sauce drizzled on top (teriyaki sauce?).  Prices for dinner are decent considering that they give you a ginormous amount of food along with soup, salad, cucumber slices drizzled with honey mustard dressing, rice & a scoop of ice cream.  Last time I got the sherbet since I don't like green tea, it was very sweet & super cold (hurted my teeth a little) so eat it cautiously.  

I've had the chicken udon, which didn't look so appealing because of how the meat looked.  I was disappointed because it lacked flavor.  Maybe I should've asked for the chili powder?  He and I shared the Super Burrito Roll, which was shrimp tempura roll with Sriracha; it doesn't compare to a similar Crunch Roll from Joy Sushi in San Mateo, but it was still tasty.  Next time I will definitely ask for more Sriracha on the side.  

Service has been great both trips and parking has never been difficult.  I look forward to other visits here to try out more of their menu.  Side note: I love their adorable Chinese knocking kitty statue! hehe
author: Cat C.

description:
Went here for dinner for many years from it's humble beginnings to a small dinner house. The food is made well. It keeps you full for a night and their service is at the top of it's class for down to earth service.

I would go here for many years to come for as long as I have money and the people continue the same great quality of food for years.

I know it had has it's ups and downs since moving into their current location. But it's better than most of the other places around this neighborhood if I had to pick one of the few.
author: Jacen W.

description: This Place is Horrible. My cousin and I had the sashimi plate here and the fish was frozen and smelled. It was not fresh whatsoever. The service is horrible, one young waitress is loud and obnoxious and always seems to have a sour attitude. The waiters/ waitresses do not attend to you unless you call upon their attention. Will not be coming back here even though it's close by.
author: Allie B.

description:
I like coming here. For one thing, it is not a fancy Japanese restaurant, which works for me since I have a 3 year old. I need a fast efficient and friendly place, and Noriega Teriyaki fits the bill. Yes they are chinese owned and staffed so this is not the most authentic place in the world. But the food has always been good. Usually with 3 or four people we grab one or two combo dinners, and one or two combo sushi platters/boats, and we all share. 

If you are looking for fresh sushi flown in from Japan, this is not the place. This is just your basic place that buys their sushi flash frozen, then does a good job preparing it so it tastes good. Usually the hamachi, maguro, and unagi are pretty good here. And don't forget most combos come with miso soup, sunomono (pickled cucumbers - my son ate all of his and everyone else's!) and ice cream. Get the green tea flavor, it's good (probably polly ann's).
author: Dom L.

description:
I really like this sushi house. I went there for several times. They always have very fresh sashimi. And their tiger roll is very delicious. 

Most of the time I went there with my family. So we ordered the sashimi & sushi tray, which includes 9 pieces of sashimi(tuna, salmon, yellowtail), tiger roll, Caterpillar Roll, rainbow roll, and 10 pieces of nigiris. The tray is good for 4 people!! 

I also like their tempura. One star off is, they have very few choices on ramen, and the udon is just so-so.

But overall, I definitely recommend this place to anyone who want to eat very fresh sashimi and sushi.
author: Zhen L.

description: Since I last was here this place has really upgraded... or maybe because I order the same sushi boat every time... either way.. it's absolutely delicious and you get such a bang for your buck.  I'm full, satisfied and loving it.... I was very happy that their customer service has also drastically improved from a few years ago.  I've been here several times in the past 4 months... maybe 7 times?  Every time has been a great experience.  The waiters/waitresses are much nicer than when I last remembered them.  Very pleasant overall experience.  I am not so sure about the appetizers because I haven't had the pleasure of trying them.. but we'll see tonight and I'll update my review from a 4 to 5... or keeping it at a 3 then =/... but we'll see =)... lol...
author: John H.

description:
My wife and I were looking at apartments in the area and decided to check out the local flavor for lunch. We came here only because we were passing by and decided to 'give it a try.'

This is maybe one of the best seafood soups I've had in this city. REAL FISH, not a bunch of fish balls and fake crab meat like most. This is the real deal.

We didn't try the sushi, but did have the tuna poki (sp?) and a roll. Both were also delicious.
author: Christopher B.

description: Stick to the cooked foods and ridiculously sauced rolls.  The sashimi is terrible.  Even the miso soup is subpar.  Recently, I had the sushi for two set at dinner and it was terrible.  The taste and texture of each piece conveyed that the fish was definitely not fresh.  I used to come here with family and order special rolls to share but have since deviated towards simpler flavor profiles and an appreciation for fresh fish.  Not sure I would be coming back any time soon.  Also not sure why it's packed most of the time...
author: Renee L.

description:
Their customer service leaves a lot to be lacking!!  have to constantly track someone down to get attentive customer service.  the waitstaff is so absorbed in their own activities when they are not serving customers.

Food is ok - nothing spectacular, but accceptable.
author: jennifer t.

description:
Noriega Teriyaki House is open everyday, and this is a big plus for me; I am notorious for always going to places on their one day closed during the week.  Why can I never learn?  NTH takes the guess work out of it by being open 7 days a week.  

Anyway, the space is big with plenty of tables and booths, as well as a sushi bar.  The service is good.  For example, I almost choked on a piece of lettuce, but a server was there immediately offering me water.  The food is okay; not great, but not bad either.  The menu offers many selections, and the prices are pretty cheap.  I'd go back for the convenience and cheap prices, but so far I haven't ordered anything I can't get better elsewhere.

Agedashi tofu $5.95
They sneak in some shaved ginger on top of the tofu, so beware if you're not a fan of raw ginger.  

Ca roll $3.95
I think this place uses real crab mixed with imitation crab?  

Sunset roll $6.95
The spicy tuna with shrimp tempura is tasty, but a but more sweet than spicy due to the sauce drizzled on top.
author: Sandy K.

description: Came in to get order to-go got the Eclipse and Rainbow roll, they are really huge rolls.  Tasty so far, slightly more fishier than used to but good rolls.  Will definatly try to dine in next time.  Friendly Staff and reasonable price.
author: Nirea S.

description:
Foods pretty good. 

Chicken Karage salad is very filling and yummy. Sweet and creamy salad dressing with black pepper. 

Udon was thinner than normal. I think they use the left over sashimi grade fish for the udon because I only got most of the salmon parts that are brown. but the fattier pieces were good. 

Rolls here are good, but a bit pricey.

Service is inconsistent. when we arrived, they kept checking on us to order.. like 3 times within a min. and then after we got our food, and we were ready for the check. no one was in sight for quite a while.. and we couldn't get their attention.
author: Erica L.

description:
Contrary to their name....I ate anything but teriyaki. 

I had the chasu ramen...yummy stuff, good flavors, and perfect for a rainy weekend.  Plenty of vegetables, fresh ramen, and clear broth.  The pork was very flavorful...and not disgustingly greasy!  Slurping required. :)

I tried bits from my friend's sushi boat...very nice fresh slices of quality sashimi and nigiri, all fish was under $25.00.  I also ordered the rainbow spider roll, which had very good fish but I was a bit surprised by the heaviness of the softshell crab.  I'm a fan of daikon, and they had very nice strips of daikon with the sushi.  

My friend's miso soup was a bit on the bland side, but that may have been the type of miso.  *shrugs*  

Service = friendly.  They're not super attentive but they're easily flagged down (we had a hot tea spill).  Tea = self-serve, they drop a huge pot onto the table.  lol  They are fast with the food though.  

Decor = dimly lit, typical japanese place.  Clean place.  And they had good ventilation too.  Plenty of space and definitely could be a good place for large gatherings.  

Not sure if it's Chinese-owned and operated but.............could very well be.   It's not the best Japanese in this city but it is fairly good for a predominantly Chinese neighborhood.
author: Fannie S.

description: This place good for teriyaki dishes. Overall dishes are good. Service is friendly.
author: Kathryn Y.

description:
We had Mother's Day dinner today.  There were 12 in our group.  Eleven of us received our food.  The twelfth waited 45 min before receiving there food.  By the time the last person received there food, most of the others were done.  Really, really bad service .

The food is average.  Nothing spectacular.
author: Randy L.

description: Not particularly bad but not great either. Average food, I had two cooked sushi rolls and a little won ton soup. I would go back out of convenience but wouldn't go out of my way to eat here.
author: Brianna C.

description:
My last review stands, but for how fresh and thickly cut their Sashimi was today I'm bumping this up to 5 stars. 

BOMB DOT COM! Will be returning a lot!
author: Chris I.

description: It's a nice casual place to take your friends or family for a pleasant dinner.   We tried the combination dinner that includes tempura,  Beef teriyaki, and chicken Kara age was great!  It also came with miso soup, salad, and ice cream for dessert!    The service was ok, it was very busy that night.  I would come back again and try their sushis or maki next time.
author: Susan H.

description:
As their name implies, teriyaki is their specialty. That hasn't changed from my last review. I wish they bottled and sold their teriyaki sauce, which they make in-house. It's way better than the sugary crap that's sold in supermarkets and used at what seems like every other restaurant.

The fish is fresh; I could eat the sashimi and nigiri all day. I've tried some of their newer rolls and they're decent, but I prefer my sushi rolls fairly simple. I've also had the oysters here since my last review. They're pretty good and I love the sauce, which I'm guessing is ponzu, sriracha, and something else. 

One note: someone complained about shanghai-type noodles in the udon, and I wanted to mention that there are many types of udon noodles which vary in size and flatness, depending on the region. I can't really comment on it any further, since I never get any hot food aside from the teriyaki here.
author: Rebecca H.

description: We eat here regularly and yet I always forget to write a review. I guess that's how this place can consistently be overlooked. Consistent quality, friendly energetic service and a kiddies menu that they actually like. The miniature garden in front of sushi bar is over the top, just another Sunset treasure.
author: Fred  D.

description:
This is my neighborhood joint.  If I have a sudden craving for some rolls, or a veggie wonton soup, I will hit this place up.
Doesn't ever really disappoint, but I wouldn't travel across town to come here.
author: Jane K.

description:
I had the seafood kushi yaki and it was AWESOME. A good amount of food for the price. Included a bunch of fish, shrimp, mussels, oysters, and squid on a plate with salad and skewers with vegetables and teriyaki sauce. For $10!!!

Also came with sunomono (if you can even call 3 pieces of cucumber sunomono), rice, miso soup (whose quantity of seaweed and tofu cancel out the scarcity of sunomono), and ice cream!!!

seafood kushi yaki.
author: Sachi T.

description: Been coming here for a long time now and I've never had any problems. Service is good, food is tasty, and the place is clean. Prices are affordable and it's conveniently located. Food may be closer to 3 stars but it's get an extra star for consistency and just being a stalwart of a restaurant in the neighborhood. We always come here when we have a craving for Japanese and don't want to go out of our way to some over priced, pretentious place. Like I said, the food is tasty, portions are good sized, and good value for your money.
author: A N.

description: We came in here for a late lunch. The workers here are friendly and very helpful. We ordered hot sake and some rolls. Everything was overall decent. The decor here is clean and simple. I enjoyed the cold cucumber with the dressing that came along with the miso soup on the house. We took our ice cream to go, but forgot to enjoy them after we left. Overall this place is decent and is a quiet place to chill and just have a nice chat over decent food.
author: Anji W.

description: Don't think we'll be back here.  We have eaten here over the years with no problems but last night was a disaster!  There were three of us, and the place was not packed, but service was soooooooo slow.  My brother ordered a large beer and they brought him a small one.  He ordered two sushi dishes and both were wrong.  My husband and I had to wait forever for our sushi.  How can that be; they don't even have to cook anything!!! Sushi chef appeared to be on his cell phone which may explain why it took so long.  Three parties that came in after us, all were served before we got our food. And then, to top it all off they really screwed up our bill.  It took us almost two hours to have dinner!  So food is good, but bad service will preclude us from returning.
author: Donna R.

description:
They used to be pretty decent...now its just not good at all.

Came here last week on a weekday. Service was horrible even though there were only 4 other tables there and like 4 servers. They all choose to hang out near the cashier and chat instead of helping customers. I literally had to go to the other room, walk up to the 4 of them behind the cashier and ask for service to ORDER my food with my fam. I also saw another table eager to order but no one paid attention. Female server acted dumb. We asked her to switch our plates bc we had oysters shell and crap on it. She only changed 2 plates out of the 5 people we had. Slow to fill tea, slow to fill water, slow to take our plates away. AND IT WASNT BUSY! However, I am thankful for the waiter who looks a little bit older and he was a lil chubby. He was very nice. Service was bad with all other waiters. PLEASE HIRE NEW PEOPLE! When I use to come here all the time, there was an older lady in pony tails..the short one with the vietnamese accent...that always smile and serve so well. I hope she still works there! Or move her to dinner shifts and teach the servers hows its done!

The sushi rolls were decent. However, the sashimi and oyster combination was bad. The oysters were the size of a dime. Literally, it was so small. Why do they even sell it? I kno the smaller oysters are suppose to be sweet. But those just look nasty and unedible.

DO NOT get the UNI + Sake (salmon) roll. There is like 2 pieces and it cost $9. Thats not the worst of it..the worst of it is they decide to cut ONE piece of UNI, split it and put on top of the Salmon. WHO DOES THAT? For the price we pay, I expect at least one FULL piece of uni on each of the 2 pieces. The UNI were size of a dime.They hella try to jipp you. Oh and on top of that, the salmon they wrap around the sushi with had some of the bad parts of the salmon on it. Like the skin. Salmon,when cutting off some parts you don' eat, should be all ORANGe. But they decide to use the nasty part which is brown and white. COME ON? And u want customers to come back? I use to come here alot and the sushi chefs that make the sushi doesn't skim as much. It seems like they had changed their sushi chefs also. What a dissapointment!

I don't know why its gotten so bad. I dont think my family or I will ever come back again. There are plenty of better japanese restaurants that won't jipp you and have better service. If you like fresh sushi, do not come here!!
author: Tammy F.

description:
Great place to go for groups.  The best way to experience the food here is to have everything.  Well, I guess just a little of everything.

The Pan Fried Prawns and Tuna Poki are good appetizers, but I prefer the Albacore Tataki.

Their teriyaki is all pretty good.  I usually avoid salmon teriyaki 'cause the fish always seems burnt, but here that's not a problem.  The beef is also much more tender than other place I've had beef teriyaki.  I'd go for the Teriyaki Special just so you get all that teriyaki goodness with some tempura.

Their sushi is also pretty good.  The fish is fresh and reasonably priced.  It's not the highest quality, but I'm also not paying a premium.  I did have uni once and it was great.  I did have it it the day after they stocked it though, so hopefully you can get lucky by going in on stocking day.

They have some more interesting rolls on their specials, but I like to stick with the double hamachi and double sake rolls 'cause that's just lots of fish.  The spider rainbow roll is good if you're feeling like having a roll that you might have to knife and fork!

Party trays are also a great way to cater.  They're all reasonably priced and they have a lot of variety, including a vegetarian platter.  So by all means, take it to go.

Service is decent, although a stack of empty plates/bowls can accumulate a bit much before being taken away, but I haven't had any other problems.
author: Jason K.

description:
One of our family staples for the last 10+ years.  Chicken, Beef or Salmon Teriyaki are always good.  Rolls are pretty tight and consistent.  Not sure why something as simple as their miso soup is so good...but IT IS!

Finish it up with some Green Tea ice cream and you're ready to go about your night in the Sunset Dist.
author: Mike R.

description: I always get the chicken kaarage. With extra kaarage sauce for dipping of course! all their sushi is on point and parking is never really an issue.
author: Eddie B.

description:
I went here for a friend's birthday dinner. The place doesn't get too full, so seating seemed to become available at an instant. 
Service is ok, nothing too great. 
The food was alright, it wasn't the best, but it was just good. 
The teriyaki was thaaat good. I didn't like the salad.
It's a little overpriced as well. 
Parking is a pain. 
I think I'll stick to Teriyaki houses near home.
author: Monina C.

description: This place has a good sized menu with all kinds of good stuff. Try the tiger roll and the eclipse roll. Both were very good. Also had the beef teriyaki with miso soup and salad. The salad was okay but everything else was great. Had the chocolate soufflé for dessert which was really rich and hit the spot. Service is quick and efficient, never needed something we didn't already have.  Also they bring a complimentary pot of great loose leaf green tea to the table right after seating. A nice touch, since we love tea. Definitely will be back to try some more of the specialty sushi rolls and the rest of the desserts.
author: Anthony R.

description:
Randomly stopped by to have dinner here today. The prices are a little off to me - some things seem overpriced, and some things seem cheap.

I had the nabeyaki udon. I'm not quite used to having cooked salmon and catfish(?) in my udon soup.. it was good, but after a while the taste got tiring. Wish there was more of a variety of seafood, like clams, shrimp, etc. Also, the udon noodles they use are thinner than I'm used to as well, causing the texture to be more on the al dente side.

I had the Garden Perfection(?) Roll, and the Pink Salmon Roll. Both were decent, nothing amazing.

Food took a little while to come out, but it was pretty packed so it's understandable. Service was nice enough. Solid 3 stars.
author: Munnie T.

description: This is a great neighborhood spot. Nice and open place, friendly staff, good menu, and good food. My salmon and beef teriyaki dinner came with ice cream to finish!
author: john h.

description:
I got a tip about this Japanese house. So I thought I would give it a try. I am glad I did. For one thing the staff there is the best. The staff works together as a team. Not just serving but removing plates away from your table and adding to you original order. 
The food is tasty and fresh. Sashimi is fresh and sliced thick. ohhhhhhh I could eat my weight is raw fish. My wife ate the Kara age. Enough for two people, and tasty. yummmmmy.  Prices are reasonable. This place is well worth the effort.
author: Jesse S.

description:
My second time here was much more memorable than my first. 

We came here to celebrate Mother's day this past Friday b/c my mom really likes the food here. Our party of 6 was seated very promptly. 

We ordered 5 dinner entrees and 3 orders of sushi to share. We were served miso soup and cool, crisp cucumbers shortly after our orders were taken. Our food arrived just as the last person was done with their soup.

The portions are huge. The amount of meat and vegetables was very balanced. I barely ate half of my order and was able to eat one piece of sushi. 
The younger brother finished his entire order in a quarter of the time it took everyone else. The men of the family were the only ones to finish their orders completely. 
Dinner entrees come with ice cream and the youngest brother was extremely excited about it but unfortunately, he didn't order a dinner set. I've worked at restaurants before, so to save our waiter the pressure, I dropped the bomb and told my brother he didn't get ice cream, but he could have mine. Our waiter was extremely generous and gave my brother ice cream anyway. Our waiter sure made that kid happy, which in turn made us very happy. 

Good food, good prices, and excellent service means I'll definitely be coming back again. This time around, the bar's been set pretty high. Hopefully my future experiences here will be just as enjoyable.
author: Florence S.

description:
This family owned sushi & teriyaki house is our favorite go to place.  I never get tired of the large menu, and friendly staff. 

When I crave Japanese this is the place.  I would rate it five stars, with the exception of parking on the street is a mess.
author: Valerie B.

description:
I am extremely disappointed. I came here with my boyfriend after we drove up to our usual Oriental restaurant  only to be greeted by a sad looking sign reading "closed for lunch". So we decide to give this place a try first.

It wasnt packed when we got there but it was rather loud. It was a little more expensive then my usual restaurant too. The water tasted like a mix between nasty tap water and lime water. It was stale to say the least - if water can be stale. Then they brought out the meso soup and these weird cucumbers covered in a yellow sauce. The pot stickers had way too many vegetables in them and the chicken teriyaki was nothing special to talk about.

Over all, I should have just waited till dinner for Teriyaki. I wouldn't suggest this place to anyone. At least the staff was nice, slow but nice all the same.
author: Dana W.

description:
Went here for dinner. I got the sukiyaki and tempura combo. It comes with soup, egg rolls and ice cream.Friend got the tonkatsu and chicken combo. Service is pretty standard. 

Pro: Eggrolls Tea.

Con: The sukiyaki was bland and noodles hard. No veggies included. Tonkatsu and chicken thin and dry.

Location is too out of the way for me to come again.
author: Adrienne C.

description:
Although the service was a little slow and had to ask twice to get water, the sushi looked great and was very good!
Great price for the quality and the restaurant itself has a nice atmosphere. It's a good place for a casual dinner with friends! 

It's nothing absolutely extraordinary, but definitely hits the spot in a pleasant surrounding!
author: Marie G.

description:
Those cucumber/pickle thingies are hella good! When I come here they bring them out before your meal comes. 

I've recently discovered ramen. We came here because we were doing laundry down the street and were arguing out of hunger frustration. I had a soup craving, so we hit up the nearest place. We ordered one of the ramen dishes, which really hit the spot. The noodles were chewy, not mushy and gross. They put hella noodles in there, and you know I love me some noodles. I was happy with all the stuff in the soup like fishacake and veggies, the broth was salty, in a good way. I have more exploring to do in the ramen department, but if I was in the hood again I would come back.
author: gabby m.

description: Their food is pretty decent for the price. I particularly like their rolls (favorite is Emporer's New Roll) It's definitely a great place for casual dining and a crave for quick Japanese food.
author: Jonathan C.

description:
Had a wonderful dinner here with friends and the food was actually good. Came on a night when the sun actually chased away the fog and everyone was there. Crowded and noisy.

The sushi dinner for two (ordered that for all of us as part of the meal) is a great sampling of a little bit of everything. That was fantastic and could have eaten it all by myself (well, almost!). The fish was delicate and fresh. You could actually taste the tuna, salmon, mackerel and so on.

The combo specials are done nicely and were pretty standard. Service is also standard for a Chinese run Japanese restaurant, which means that it is a little slow but the quality made up for the time. Besides I just flagged down the waitress to get refills on tea. 

The place could use a slight makeover but not a deal breaker. This is my first time there and will update this review when I return.
author: Stefan L.

description:
The food here is pretty good. Came here lots and lots of time since I live so close to it. So I tried A LOT of their food. Like their seafood udon, eel donburi, dragon roll, sashimi, sushi, and etc.

I really like the dragon roll here, it is pretty big and the quality of the fish is really good. There sashimi and sushi are ok, I had better quality fish but for the price here, it isn't too bad.

There udon here is really good too. The soup has a lot of flavor, but I dont understand why they put chicken in a seafood udon....

I also really like the saba teriyaki here. I think it is my favorite. The skin is really crispy but the meat is soft. And the salad that comes with the bento box is really good too.

I like to come to this place with my grandma or mother when we can't decide where to go. The price is really reasonable and the food it good. And we been going to Noriega Teriyaki when it was still at the little store on the corner of 22nd ave.
author: Alicia W.

description:
Noriega Teriyaki House is one of those places that look great from the outside, mostly due to its size, though, it's never really packed. A friend and I really wanted some sushi to go with our movie night, so we opted for delivery. It was my 2nd time experiencing their food. The first time I had their take out, I can't even remember what I ordered or if it was even any good. Sorry to say, their food is not memorable, just adequate.
The service was great, very friendly staff. With our delivery they gave us complimentary green tea ice cream, which I thought was a nice touch. The food just doesn't add up to their friendly customer service.
author: Tashina G.

description:
I went on a FABBBBBBBBBBBBBBBBULOUS DATE HERE [ok not really, it was lunchtime with my friend Miss Zombie Heart (read her reviews!)]
for a nice, sit down sushi place.

I really loved it! Pretty quiet but cute inside, really clean and nice waitstaff. It's a pretty big restaurant but feels really cozy!

We started with a chicken karaage salad which was a HUGE salad.  Basically your standard with the miso dressing but with the chicken and strawberries mixed in. My friend suggested we split it cuz its huge and then get some rolls.

First, the panda roll and then the q (? i think!) roll. Both were cooked rolls, no raw fishies today! Eel and tobiko (although they were green ones so maybe theres a diff name for those) and cooked salmon and spicy sauce! and both were hot, baked rolls and were delicious! The Panda roll i believe had avocado and teriyaki sauce with the eel too and it was my fave one. yummm. The second roll had the big pink fish eggs that (as Melanie described it) were salty balls that popped in your mouth aka best description ever.

Add all that food and 2 cups of tea and we were stuffed. SO stuffed we had to skip the trip to Polly Anns for ice cream and Quickly for tapioca drinks. =(  

I think between the huge salad and 2 rolls we spent maybe 30 bucks? not bad considering we didn't finish our food  and were SO FULL afterwards. 

I'll definitely come back!! Not a fan of traveling out so far to the Sunset but it's a nice change from pricey Japantown and the now-semi boring Kitaro! =D
author: Diana R.

description:
I live nearby and whenever I'm craving some good Japanese food, I ALWAYS turn to Noriega Teriyaki House.  All the dishes that I've tried so far have been delicious and they are constant -- which I like.  The staff is also extremely friendly.  

Probably not the best Japanese restaurant in the city -- but it's definitely up there! If you're a sunset local, I would recommend checking it out.
author: Kevin B.

description:
I really want to give this place more stars since I really liked the service but maybe I just came on an off day.
I ordered the teriyaki beef, california roll, and a special roll.
Since the teriyaki beef came with a miso soup that came out first with a cucumber salad with a mucus looking sauce. The miso soup was great, tons of tofu and seaweed. But the cucumber salad was gross and salty.

Next came the rolls, they were just alright, nothing to come all the way over here for. The california roll tasted as if it was made before hand and left sitting out for awhile. There are tons of budget sushi places closer to where I live that are ten times better.

The teriyaki beef was the worst of all. For a place that specializes in teriyaki I thought this would be perfect, WRONG.
The teriyaki was way bland and the beef was pretty much almost raw. Needless to say, I by no means finished this dish.

Overall the best part of the meal were the servers who were very attentive and nice, and the miso soup, which I guess doesn't say much about the food itself.

I usually give restaurants a second chance, but I am going to think long and hard about this one since I had such a bad experience.
author: Brenda I.

description: The new beef asparagus dishes are pretty damn good... Went during dinner time and it was busy but still able to get a table. I think I only go cause of the free dreyers ice cream.....yummmm
author: Mike Z.

description: There are abaout 3 Japanese restaurants around this area and this is my favorite. The service is good with a welcoming face. It gets pretty busy sometimes, but there is plenty of seating. They have a few vegetarian options for us animal lovers. I love that the dishes come with alot of food and some even come with dessert! I tried the green tea ice cream which was good (not great). It's an affordable spot and the atmosphere is family friendly.
author: Crys L.

description:
This is the first time I have been to the new location of the Noriega Teriyaki House. The old location was a small little restaurant at the corner of 24th ave. It was so cramp. I am big guy. Small resturant can create a problem for me. The new location is located 4 blocks further down the road on the Noriega strip. The menu is still the same, but a bigger facility. Thank God.
What was on the menu in the old location, still there til this day. Combination platter containing various tempura, and grill chicken and steak and desert for two people @ $13.00 per person. What a deal!! The Sushi as usual fresh and tasty.
author: Matt G.

description:
Located in the Sunset on the corner of Noriega and 25th Ave, NTH is a typical sushi place that has a decent variety of sashimi's and sushi dishes.

The raw oysters are too small and "sandy" but taste OK.   The sake (Salmon Sashimi) was very good as well as Yellow Tail, Tuna, and Tako (octopus).

The interior is clean, warm, gently lit with what appears to be an artificial Japanese Maple Tree.  On a Monday, it's not too crowded but the quality of the food and service is good.

The overall vibe of this establishment is friendly, social, unobtrusive, and fairly intimate.  If you want to converse, it will not be too loud, so, it's a great place for private conversation, but still social enough that you can get moderately carried away with yourself.

For two, you will pay $135 if you end up drinking too much, which, always happens to me when I go out with an old friend who I haven't seen in awhile.  This covers 4 large Asahi Beers and 2 large hot sakes and enough sushi, nigiris, and sashimi to have you comfortably full.

I docked off one star because it didn't have Toro and docked off another star because of the Oysters.  Other than that, I was very satisfied with this place.
author: Tony U.

description:
This is now one of the older Japanese restaurants in the area.  Quality has always been pretty good, even though it is not really authentic.  I've had a number of different things here such as the sushi, udon, and seabass, all good enough with good sized portions.  Servers are always friendly and there is a large room in the back that can be used for parties of about 15 to 20.  Noriega Teriyaki is good, safe choice for families, especially families with young children.

Take out is a good option also.  Their sushi platters are good and visually pleasing.  Even if you call the sushi order in ahead of time, they make you wait.  They're probably afraid that people will not show up if they make the sushi platter in advance.
author: Re-pley Z.

description:
I like Noriega Teriyaki house. Parking usually is not difficult and their open all day for lunch and dinner. They also do delivery!
My favorite dishes here are the chicken karrage and teriyaki. Their udon is also very good as well.
Prices here are pretty cheap. 
This is a great family restaurant. I have come here for many occasions with my family and they are always very accommodating!
Service is okay and food comes out fast!
author: Miss H K.

description:
Noriega Teriyaki House is a pretty big restaurant with a really nice interior. It's large enough to house a big party of people. Th sushi is pretty decent and the fish seems to be pretty fresh. They have a lot of different specialty rolls and of course the traditional sushi. There's also some noodle soup dishes like udon and ramen here also. The prices are pretty average prices for Japanese food, which means it's not cheap... but then again decent quality Japanese food is never cheap.

Fire-N-Ice roll is supposed to have calamari, but I could swear it had octopus tempera inside instead. The other ingredients were cream cheese,  shrimp, and avocado on top. For sauce there was some mayo and sriracha on top. The octopus rubber like texture totally kills this roll. It's too chewy for my liking. The sauce adds a nice spicy zing to the taste buds.

Emperor's New roll has tuna, tomago, and avocado inside. On top, there are salmon and two different kinds of fish eggs with a little mayo also. This is pretty awesome roll. It has all my favorite kind of ingredients except for the fish eggs. 

The service is pretty lacking here. They sit you down and ask for your order within 5 minutes. That's too short of a time to decide on what to order. The dishes were made really quickly like within 10 minutes of the order. 

If you're looking for a decent sushi place for a quick lunch, this is the place you want to be at.
author: Steven B.

description:
I've dined-in once or twice, and the entrance and overall decor is pretty nice. But my family usually orders for delivery and it arrives within 30 to 45 minutes. Most of the time, upon arrival, the food is at a hot/warm temperature. Also, they sometimes give various "on the house" items such as mochi covered strawberries.

I usually order Salmon Teriyaki and the size of the two salmon fillets have changed from large to small to large again. I think it may have to do with the varying size of their to-go containers. However, I love how they give you two fillets whereas other restaurants usually give you one. The Chicken Teriyaki consists of half dark meat and half white meat. Sometimes there's too many burnt edges for me to fully enjoy. The Chicken Kara-Age and Salmon Isobe-Age are pretty good as well. And I think their shrimp tempura have gotten smaller and smaller. I wouldn't recommend the udon here. You can get better tasting noodles and broth elsewhere for more or less, the same price. I like it when you order vegetable tempura, because they give you a variety of vegetables such as pumpkin, string beans, onion, broccoli, carrot, potato, and eggplant. Once I found a fly in my Spider Roll - bleck! It was delivery, so I couldn't really complain. Not to mention, I've had better, fresher Spider Rolls elsewhere. AND I prefer it with cucumber or avocado rather than lettuce. Lettuce is more for salads, not sushi... with the exception of decoration. I think ordering from here so often has gotten me pretty used to the food.

Overall, Noriega has a huge variety of special rolls, maki sushi, nigiri sushi, appetizers, and combination dinners to choose from, at really reasonable prices! Huge portions too! I always have leftovers.
author: Priscilla W.

description:
I'm surprised this place got some real harsh reviews. 
I guess I have to put in a good word.

I've been to this place more than several times over the course of 5 years. I've had a good experience each time. The prices are decent, but I feel that the sushi is great quality. Their sashimi combo with the oysters is a steal.

After dropping in around 9 last night to have an end of the work week sushi pig out. I felt I had to say some nice things on yelp. 

The service is good.
The food came out quickly.
It was delicious.
As usual

Also I was surprised they do delivery. I've always ate in or had to go. Usually a place having delivery steers me clear from the restaurant itself. 
Luckily for me I ate in first. Their emperor's roll is just mind blowing.

I usually go to Fujiyama-Ya a few blocks up the street. Last night I did not regret coming to Nori Teri house again.
author: Tip S.

description:
Close to $11.00 for a Chicken Karrage dish that comes with rice, miso soup, ice cream, and a salad.

Service is prompt. 

They don't take American Express.

I loved my Green Tea Ice cream. The Shio Salmon was grilled just the way how I liked it. No teriyaki sauce please. 

Caterpillar roll was decent ( 8 pieces for $8.95) but did not really like the "rice". 

They also only have "pink" dyed ginger. I prefer ginger in it's original color.
author: Jboogie L.

description:
Was it just me or did everyone else think that the tempura udon would be garnished with the regular fish cake, seaweed, and all the other japanese foodsies?  Well i went the other day and obviously ordered the tempura udon.  WHen i got it..there was a plentiful amount of tempura, but the udon was just plain noodles and soup!  I was pretty sad when i saw it and if i had known i woulda ordered the sukiyaki!  I was a tad disappointed to see this happen at one of my fav japanese restaurants.. =(

on a brighter note, the sushi was tasty as usual with a lovely presentation on rectangular dishes.  Big points for them because we thought we ordered something else and when it came out it was a sushi roll completely different than what we expected.  At first we thought that the waitress had it wrong, but after looking at the menu we realized we ordered the wrong thing.  After telling our server, they replaced it for us free of charge and didn't give us any attitude whatsover! =)
author: Kristen T.

description:
Sushi were AMAZING there, yummy, yumm, yumm! Me and my friend came in sometime after 2 pm, and at first were scared by the fact that there were almost no  people inside, and only one guy form the staff (the Japanese guy who served as the cook, waiter, and receptionist). But then I remembered  that many Japanese places are closed completely from around 2 to 5. It their Japanese tradition probably. The Japanese places that are not closed at this times are kind of in "hibernation" mode, and only few staff remains on the  floor (since, oh well, not that many people come in). 

he Japanese guy in Teriyaki house, even though it was just him who cooked AND served, was reasonably fast, and also very polite (like many Japanese people are anyways). So, even though at that particular time the place was empty, the sushi and rolls (especially with salmon) were awesome and very reasonably priced. And I am sure that outside this  'Japanese siesta' (1:30ish - 4:30ish pm) the place gets packed. I will be going there again, definitely!
author: Valerie K.

description: As someone who lives right down the block from this restaurant I have the pleasure of being within walking distance from this despicable excuse of Asian cuisine.  The only positive things I can say about this place is the fountain when you walk in and the staff.  Beware, never ear here alone or you will be seated near the bathrooms and have to deal with constant foot traffic.  I have given this place three chances and as the old saying goes, three strikes and you're out!  I've tried something different each time and each time the food was consistent...consistently poor!  Beef Teriyaki that was cold, bland, and raw in the middle, Sushi that makes Safeway seem like a godsend, and a combination plate where everything tasted the same.  And by the same I mean bland as hell!  This restaurant has obviously hit the mark somewhere because people are always there, but look closer and you'll see that the clientele's average age is 70.  What does that mean?  Bland food doesn't bother them because it's well located in the Noriega neighborhood.  This restaurant is more interested about atmosphere than food quality.  I'll eat in a dungeon if the food is great, isn't that why you go to a restaurant, to eat good food?  I even sake bombed myself into a drunken haze and then ordered there food and it was still below par.  As an area of San Francisco that is rich in Asian culture, the neighborhood deserves better!
author: David R.

description:
The sushi rolls were delicious but the tempura and teriyaki were just okay. The tempura was a little too bready/crunchy for my taste. I prefer a light crispy breading. The teriyaki was what I expected it to be, but led me to a moment of self realization: "Why are the samples from the mall food court joints the best tasting teriyaki you can really find?"

I was also kind of turned off by the fact that they would serve me raw egg yolk (in their salad dressing) without telling me. On a similar note, I had to ask what was in the egg rolls that came with my dinner (shrimp and pork FYI, but our waiter didn't sound so sure...).

It's close to my place and has fairly decent prices, I'm sure I'll be back (but maybe just for sushi rolls).
author: Jeffrey J.

description: I went here for dinner with some friend before go karting and ordered the Chicken Karage and was pretty satisfied with my meal. One thing I really liked was the portions. The meal was all encompassing with soup, salad, entree (chicken and rice) and dessert. Although I wouldn't pick out any aspect of the food was amazing but I though the overall experience was very good. Best part of all was that it didn't cost too much but I didn't get the Sushi so that might be why. I'll try out the sushi next  time and see how that goes.
author: Pin X.

description:
4/5 stars on the Wing Scale... 

- Quality of product: 2 of 3 stars
- Quality of service: 1 of 1 star
- General feelings of happiness: 1 of 1 star

We recently moved to the Outer Sunset and this is the first of few Japanese choices we hit up for a quick sushi fix. Last time we went, we had the double sake roll and the teriyaki/ tempura dinner special to share. 

The roll was definitely well-made with fresh ingredients. To echo some other Yelpers' comments though, their teriyaki was good but nothing to write home about. I'm a little surprised since the word TERIYAKI is in the restaurant's name! The tempura was my least favorite-- parts of it were way oily! Maybe a bad day?

Back to the good stuff-- the service was excellent. We chatted it up with one of the waiters throughout the meal, and he threw in some free cream puffs to accompany our ice cream dessert; we think that's his way of welcoming us to the neighborhood. :) 

What else? The price was reasonable (about $20-$25/person). The atmosphere was what we expected for a low-key neighborhood place.
author: Wing Y.

description: Excellent service and the special rolls are just fantastic! I got the cherry blossom roll, yin yang roll, and the golden ox roll. The cherry blossom was nothing too unique, but the other two were so delicious! I love how they have such a wide variety of food here. It was almost full on the day I went, but everything I ordered came pretty fast. We sat in a corner, but we were still having as equal service as everyone else which I thought was nice since they would ask if we needed anything or how we were doing every so often. Overall, I would most definitely come back to try more of their specialty rolls!
author: Athena W.

description:
Came here w/ my cousin, her bf, and her bf's friend after Giants' Opening Day (GO GIANTS!). It was about 7pm on a Friday and we had to wait about 15 minutes for our table.  We ordered the chicken karage (i think that's what it's called) salad. That was YUMMY! the sauce/dressing is good! haha. we also ordered a fire and ice roll, a super burrito roll, a pacific roll, and one of the baked salmon rolls.  The rolls are very pretty and when they say something is spicy, they mean it. Buuut, I'm a weakling when it comes to spicy food, so what do I know? =) We were all stuffed and couldn't finish the LAST piece of sushi. hahaha.

Something that was nice was the rolls weren't drowned in the sauces that usually plague american sushi restaurants. lol. They are also pretty wide in diameter, so be prepared to either stuff your mouth or eat your broken sushi pieces on your plate. hehe. That isn't bad though!

Service was good. They gave us a big (woo hoo!) kettle of tea with nice normal sized cups (not those tiny ones at chinese restaurants...) and filled our waters (i wish they would just refill them without having to interrupt our conversation to ask if we want one... haha).  I gave them a 3 instead of a 4 because nothing really stood out to me and I wouldn't go out of my way to come here.  If you are in the area, check them out because you won't be disappointed!
author: Roxanne K.

description:
Come by with family for my uncle's B-day.

Had a spicy tuna roll, Chicken karage, and some nigiri.

Overall, this is a solid sushi place. Not the best, but definitely not bad. The spicy tuna roll could've been spicier and the sashimi looked decently fresh.

What really stood out was the chicken karage. like a lot of other yelpers have said, the tempura battered fried chicken aka chicken karage, was awesome. 

While this place would get 3 stars for sushi, the Karage earns it a whole extra star! If you come, you have to try it.
author: Josh Y.

description:
Upon walking in I was handed not one, not two, but three menus (and there was a fourth lingering on the table that might have been for catering orders). Needless to say there is a lot to choose from. 

Since teriyaki is part of their namesake, I had to go with something with their house concoction. I was not disappointed by my chicken teriyaki roll, made even better with brown rice. It was good enough that I'm overlooking the unadvertised $0.25 surcharge on my bill. Let's just say they made up for it with a bonus side of their sauce. Call me a house condiment sucker.
author: Jason B.

description:
There is a reason this restaurant looks empty half of the time... I came in here the other week with a friend of mine, and it was devoid of customers. The staff were sitting around chit chatting and it took a moment for them to notice as after we had entered the door. It wasn't their lunch break, as it was only 1pm. 

The rest of the meal was pretty much the same thing, service was sooooo bad, and it made it worse because no one else was in the restaurant! It took them nearly 20 mins to refill a glass of water, and this is after asking more than once. 
What was the staff doing? Just chilling at the table still.

The food was subpar, as in my 10 yr old niece could probably do a better job if she watched an instructional video on youtube. 

It behooves me as to why there are so many good reviews for this place. In fact, I just found out from a friend yesterday that they asked her to put away her baby food for her 2yr old because the store policy is "no outside food allowed". 

Really? Baby food is a threat to your business? 1 baby, in a table for 10+ people? If they brought in McDonald's or leftovers from a different restaurant that an adult is eating, sure. Ok, I can understand that. But for a 2yr old? Come on now... where is the common sense? 

I'm never going back here, and I hope some of you heed this warning.
author: Brian K.

description: Very very slow service but they made up for it with the delish food and friendly staff.(ramen was delish, sushi was not) My sever apologized twice for the delays and brought me a free seaweed salad. It's good for great food an friendly staff but don't expect to get a quick lunch here. I'll try it again if its convenient.
author: Kayleen R.

description:
NOT ALLOW TO FEED BABY AT RESTAURANT

We had a family dinner at Noreiga Teriyaki House last night.  I was feeding some homemade food to my son.  A waiter came to me and asked me to "put our food away because the restaurant policy does not allow outside food".  It is ridiculous that parent cannot feed their child  homemade food.  The waiter told me they have kid's menu and I could order food for my son (which is 2 years old).  I asked him can he promise the food does not contain MSG which he ignored my question.  I requested to speak with the manager or the owner.  The waiter came back and said: "This time we'll make an exception and let you eat here but we want to tell you our policy does not allow outside food." 

Who does this?! Outside food means bringing in a competitor's food (ie: McDonald's), but homemade food?? For a 2yr old!??! Please avoid this restaurant at all costs.
author: Pekkle p.

description:
I've been here maybe 5 times and I every time I leave with the feeling like I've been hornswaggled. 

The food is good. Not great or anything but good. They microwaved a sushi roll once and I got pretty bummed. Service is always mediocre as well. Today I asked the sushi chef for 2 plates so we could share our large sushi order at the sushi bar and the guy told me to tell the waiter. I hadn't seen the waiter the whole time and the chef proceeded to not get us small plates and I had to get them myself a few minutes later. Lame

Would I go back again? Yeah probably. The food is good enough and cheap enough and when I'm near there I don't know any other good sushi spots. If you know any let me know.
author: Paul S.

description:
Noriega. After eating here, I fell in love with sushi. Their rolls are pretty good. Service is good. Overall, this place is one of those serendipitous places that leave you full and happy.

However, after dinning at several sushi places around the bay, Noriega is nothing extremely special. This place is good if you are in the area- but not worth an extravagant trip just for the food.

Try to stay away from the rolls with a ton of stuff- the basic rolls end up being more tasty. I definitely recommend the calamari roll!
author: Sasha S.

description: We've been coming here for quite a few years. Always come away very satisfied and with a take-away carton for the next day!  Love their wonton veg soup - very fresh, no MSG. Husband and granddaughter go for the sushi rolls which are consistently high quality and generous portions.  Friendly service, very tasty food, reasonably priced, and  relaxed atmosphere.
author: Carol M.

description:
i came here before with my japanese class a longgg time ago in hs, can't remember how everything was but a distinct memory of my food tasting burnt.

i went again last friday with my friend, i ordered the everything udon...and tuna poki,

I liked the tuna poki, nice flavor. the udon wasn't regular udon noodles, but it was good, a lot of fish in it and stuff. could kind of taste that the soup was mostly soy sauce.

came back again and their rolls were pretty good. i like unagi, so most of the rolls were saucy.  raw fishes were good too.

hamachi kama was good, large pieces of the fish.

service...depends...some are great some are so emotionless...ur like...uhh...

great place for large gatherings but not somewhere u would be craving to go to.
author: Christine M.

description:
If forgot about this place for a while, so this yelp is a kind of "I'm sorry I forgot about you, Noriega Teriyaki House."

A co-worker into'ed me to this place. His wife is from Japan, and he visits Japan very often, so I trust their opinions of this place as far as authenticity goes. Also, my co-worker is big guy who likes food, so he has a lot of experience in eating. 

Anyway...I always get the same thing here. The assorted sashimi... they shoud call it the assorted sashyummy. The assortment comes with three diff types of sashimi (three piece of each type = 9 pieces total, math wizards), and three fresh oysters! Plus a bowl of rice! Get ready for this... $14.99! Can you believe it? And the sashimi is fresh, firm and sweet. I've tasted bad preservative-doused-sashimi before, and this sashimi is oceans away from that. 

The sushi rolls are the big, hunky type, not delicate, so it's good if that's what you're into. I recommend the chicken karage salad as well. The salad dressing here is different from the typical miso dressing, which I also like. 

I've never had the teriyaki, because I can never resist the sushi and sashimi, of course. But I really recommend this place. Oh gosh, my tummy's grumbling... gotta go!
author: Darlene S.

description:
Good service and I like their white meat chicken teriyaki...

Good place to stop by for a quick meal.
author: Jon W.

description:
Went here on Saturday for lunch and finally have time to write a review. Normally I wouldn't eat sushi here because it is overpriced for its quality and variety. I would rate it about 3.5 stars but Saturday it lost about a star! 

They had lost a star for its food quality! I forgot the name of the roll but it had spicy tuna on the inside with avocado and eel on top of it. I ate two pieces and had a stomach ache in the evening. I brought the leftovers home for my dad to eat. He ate it all and was in the bathroom and my grandma had to make him herbal medicine! This was a rather horrible food experience.

Aside from the food, they had relatively good service. Other than that, there is nothing much to it. There is a better sushi place further down Noriega street.
author: Catherine L.

description: Have patronized this restaurant dozens and dozens of times.  Used to enjoy this neighborhood restaurant, with their friendly wait staff, easy parking and pretty decent food for the money.  Then came the price increase, and the very uneven and smaller portions.  Had the fried chicken salad, with about half the chicken on the salad as the prior visit just a week earlier.  They substituted a bunch of the greasy fried dough bits in lieu of decent pieces of chicken   Dining companion received her entree more than 5 minutes later.  Salmon pieces have shrunk in size, the steak has been 'thinned' to economize.  Sukiyaki was never quite right, weak, and off flavored.  Teacups came reeking of chlorine numerous times, though not this  last time.  I'll have to be pretty desperate to ever dine here again.
author: N C.

description: My friend had the sashimi with rice bowl & the salmon sashimi tasted pretty good. However, I had the miso ramen and it was not that great. Didn't really taste like how ramen soup should taste like. The service was good.
author: Crystal L.

description: Deal Breaker!! Sorry guys but fish tasted bland, had to ask for water,napkins,and finally the bill after waiting for 10 minutes. Won't be back..truly good sushi is worth the switch.
author: Jessica M.

description: Amazinggggg sushi! I honestly am such a sushi critic but I love this place. Amazing salmon nigiri and if you want a crazy/creative roll, go with the silver fox roll. So tasty :)
author: Molly O.

description: I've been coming here for years because it's in my neighborhood. Food has always been passable; I have to be in a mood to settle. But I recently tried to place an order for a friend who has a shellfish allergy. All I wanted was to get the beef teriyaki + tempura combo, with no shrimp. The combo comes with harumaki (imperial rolls), which also contain shrimp. I asked for some small way to offset the lack of harumaki, maybe a piece or two of gyoza, which is the same price on the menu. It seemed like a reasonable request to me. The lady on the phone flat out refused to make any sort of accommodation for me. Sure she agreed to keep the tempura veggie only, but she refused to offset the loss of harumaki and shrimp with anything else. This restaurant would be saving money by not including those things in the meal, and they think it's okay to just shrug their shoulders and say "hey, you have an allergy...sucks for you." NOT OKAY. They were convenient, but I'm not giving them anymore business.
author: Daren P.

description: Been here a few times and I feel like they've gotten worse since the last time I was there.  The tempura was disgustingly heavily battered.  And the green tea ice cream lacks significant green tea flavor and also has a creepy neon color.
author: Derrick C.

description: this is one of my favorite Japanese Restaurants. Ive been coming here for 7 years now. My dad always order the beef teriyaki and I usually get the beff teriyaki and tempura combination. You should come here for lunch because the prices are unbeatable.
author: Eva L.

description:
Noriega Teriyaki is good, but NOT that great.

decent prices and a good location. the sushi is pretty good and its only a block away from my house! if you are craving for good sushi -- go to them!
author: Carol Y.

description:
Decent Japanese food, but the service killed it for me. I went with a group of people, and I ordered last. So I gladly wait, and I get my first plate, this cheap avacado roll. I continue waiting, and then when it's been about half an hour, I ask them where my other plate was. Then they go on and on about them taking it away already, that I already had it, and I had to repeatedly explain myself. After about ten minutes, they agree and give me my friggin order.

Their sushi was pretty bland as well, though their rice plates were pretty good. UGHH to service.
author: Colleen M.

description: We went here for dinner on the spur of the moment.  Not great.  Really boring. Very loud and clangy as if we were in the kitchen.   Won't be coming back.
author: Lori B.

description: if its your first time here, may I advise you that the portion of the rolls here are a lot larger then you would expect.  I ordered soup, small salad and two types of rolls.  salad was really good, fresh and not soggy. soup was good as always but the rolls, wow!  I was pretty surprised with the size and I could not finish both of them.  simple way to describe it is they were delicious.  everything was perfect proportion, so I didn't taste too much of rice or too much sauce.  it was just right for me and Im sure you will like it too.  if you don't like raw fish and prefer it to be cooked , make sure you ask before you order.  I would give it a 5 star, however I have not tried everything and I believe that their is always room for improvements.  I will definitely come back and bring friends too.  this is a family owned restaurant and I support that over big corporations.  so, if your in the neighborhood and feel like having some Sushi, this is the place to be.
author: Serg L.

description:
Food: Above average and beyond! Oiishi des ne

Prices: fair to borderline expensive.

Decor: Great, I like their fountain in the front.

Service: friendly

Deals: When I went several years ago, spend $50 and get a cute fat ceramic cat, spend $100 and get an even bigger cat.
author: Keit K.

description:
3 1/2 stars. My friend told me about this restaurant because one of her friend's uncles owns this place. I wanted to eat ramen but everywhere seemed to be packed! Then i remembered this place so I decided to check it out. 
This place was not that crowded so I was able to be seated quickly. I like the fact the the interior is really spacious and not squished when walking around. The area that the restaurant is located in seems more calmer than other restaurants. 
The workers working there definitely deserve four stars because they are so friendly. I did not get anything special, just "Chicken Teriyaki". The reason being was because I was getting more for my money when I ordered the rice plate. It was $10 bucks for appetizer, miso soup, the main course, and then ice cream for dessert. Not bad at all. The food quality probably deserves 3 stars. There was not really anything special about it because the chicken teriyaki tasted like any other place. It was  kind of dry, but the teriyaki sauced balanced it out. They give you a good amount in terms of portions. I do want to come back here and try the sushi though. Overall this is a chill place. The prices are really reasonable compared to other sushi restaurants in SF. I probably would not come back here around dinner time, maybe lunch would be better.
author: Katrina T.

description: Heard good things and was looking forward to nice new experience. Unfortunately, things were amiss. Ordered a combo chicken teriyaki and tempura, my wife got the salmon Isobe-age. Mine came out lukewarm, nothing for my wife or an explanation for 15 minutes. By that time, mine was cold and half gone. Hers was nothing like the description. The seaweed wrapped salmon was deep fried as promised but it was covered in a combination of canned veges which made the whole dish soggy. We sent it back telling the server that we didn't like it. Ordered the eel as a replacement. We thought it was odd that she asked if we wanted to take it home and we declined. We found out why when the bill came with all of the entrees on it. We could feel the MSG about 15 minutes after we left the place. Too bad.
author: Michael H.

description: The service is pretty good here and the food comes in good sized portions.
author: Samantha L.

description:
Price: pretty darn good for the amount you get. I ordered the Chicken Katsu for $8.95 which included miso soup, salad, entree, rice, and ice cream after. 

Quality wise: so-so. The chicken katsu was not as tasty or seasoned as well as other Japanese restaurants. The meat is dry and the only reason there is a taste to it is because of the flavorful tonkatsu sauce that comes with it. They use a store bought vinaigrette type salad dressing with the salad. The ice cream is frothy and injected with air it seems. 

Parking: not so great. It may take upwards of 10-15 minutes to find parking in a pretty busy area since there are so many restaurants and stores nearby.

Large parties: good. We had a large party of about 20 people and they have a room in the back open for reservations and bigger parties. Only downside to that room? It's directly attached to the hallway for the bathroom, so it has a little bit of a smell. And on hot days it gets pretty stuffy in there.
author: Ellen C.

description:
I use to go here on for my birthdays, I love their teriyaki dinner specials. It comes with everything but the kitchen sink. Loads of food for a family of 4 and it's soo good. My favorite is the teriyaki chicken and salmon. I always ask for more teriyaki sauce :)

I never ordered anything different because I love their dinner special.
author: Stephanie J.

description:
The people are really nice in here 
I stay away from the sushi because it is just not good and doesnt seem fresh.
I do like to support my neighborhood restaurants so i have continued to go there since their teriyaki dishes are tasty. 
However... this last time i got EXTREMELY sick about an hour after eating there. 
sorry teriyaki house but i am going to have to break up with you.
author: Emily W.

description: Noriega Teriyaki is the bomb dot com. I mean what's not to love about overpriced sushi, service that is awful and food that is just tasteless? JK. This place sits where most sushi places set their price points. The service is good, too. In the many times I've been here, I don't recall ever having an empty glass of water, which is a large portion of how I rate service. The sushi rolls are delicious. They are more American fusion creations than they are authentic Japanese, but still delicious nonetheless. Definitely worth a visit if you're in the area and want to see Asian people eating Asian food!
author: Kevin D.

description:
This isn't my first time coming here, but I felt like I should finally give my opinion on this place.

Now im not saying that this is my favorite Japanese place of all time, but it is my favorite place in SUNSET district. I always come back because their staff is always friendly, food always gets me satisfied, and the prices are well worth it for the two. I really enjoy the environment inside the restaurant as well. Right when you walk in, there is a fake tree and a little pond at the bottom. I like that they try so hard haha.

We arrived at the restaurant around 3:30pm and there was barely anybody in there. Which is good because it is usually stuffed with people and it is nice to have some room to breathe. 

I ordered Katsu-don($7.45) which is chicken cutlets cooked with egg and teriyaki sauce over rice along with a roll of Unagi Maki ($3.95). Now my friend told me a bit about my Katsu-don as we were eating. He said that this is a dish that Japanese cook as a simple meal when they are feeling lazy at home. I'm not sure if thats true but I really enjoyed it. The chicken cooked with egg and their sauce had a unique texture that was interesting to me. It was quite good, indeed!

We took our time eating and chatting in the corner with my friend. She came back to check on us a few times to leave us the bill and always said take your time with a smile. Happy staff = happy customers which was ME. 

I think its best when you go when it it less packed so the staff won't be so anal to you, which is around lunch time. I hear stories from my friends saying the workers are rude when they arrive for dinner. I tell them they should have gone for lunch instead!

4 stars well deserved.
author: Benson T.

description: I love this place! My family and I come here for sushi at least once every week! We order our usual favorites like the Fighting Cheetah Roll, Crunchy Roll, and the Tiger Roll. Service can be slow, but usually when we come here for lunch, the place is quite comfortable and relaxing, giving us some quiet down time here to eat. We always leave feeling satisfied!
author: Veronica C.

description:
Come here every once in a while, maybe like once or twice a year.  The sushi is...okay.  They deliver after 5pm, very convenient for us because we live down the street.

I've had such a hankering for some amazing sushi lately, but my latest venture here didn't do the trick.  Amaebi nigiri was good - told them to hold the fried heads.  Tempura roll and Caterpillar roll left me sad.  Flavors just didn't wow me this time.  Miso soup was kind of...stale tasting...how do you mess up miso soup?

If you're having a party, they have teriyaki and sushi platters that satisfy the masses.
author: Meesh K.

description:
This is certainly my favorite sushi restaurants in San Francisco.  I mostly eat sushi and sashimi from this restaurant and I can't speak for the rest of the dishes. 

The place:
It's decent.  Clean.

The Staff:
Always friendly and very helpful.

The food:
Always had great experience eating sushi and sashimi here.  Only had one unfavorable experience and I spoke with the waiter and he was happy to comp the dish that I was not happy with.  I LOVE the tuna tartar and the amaebi sashimi with heads.  The quality is good.  The portions are big.  It is on the pricier side but I am happy to pay more for it.
author: Derek W.

description: Been going to this restaurant for years, love the service and the food is amazing! Definetely recommend it!
author: George C.

description: I Love this place =). the waiter here is really nice. the food was super good too. the price is reasonable for a sushi resturaunt, but make sure to prepare to carry some extra cash because alot of the food is delicious and it would be a shame not to try the ones that look good. they also have fried ice cream! it was very good.
author: Jenni W.

description: Pretty damn good Sushi and Sashimi and  they DELIVER!!!! Best sushi delivery I have found. Be sure to try the FUTOMAKI, and I can personally vouch for the Sashimi combo deluxe! Huge peices of fresh salmon, hamachi, tuna, and OYSTERS!!
author: Chelsey G.

description:
meh.
MEH.
it was okay.
the atmosphere sucks.
too expensive.
just came because my parents wanted it.
there are FAR better options in the area.
don't waste your hard earned plastic.
author: Dadasd d.

description:
Growing up knowing the owners of the place does not change the fact that I love coming here whenever I have the chance. Being one of the only good sushi restaurants in the sunset district, it is a small place that has a good family vibe to it. The place can be a little pricey but they make up for that fact with giving you huge portions. Even with this said I know people are thinking quality over quantity but I can easily tell you that they put a lot of effort into everything that they make.

The choices of foods here are amazing... there are so many things to choose from it's insane! From combo dinners, to many different sushi rolls the thing I always get is either the Teriyaki Combination Dinner or the Grilled Seabass with Beef Teriyaki. Add along a sushi combination and you have yourself an amazing dinner! There are 3 different types of sushi combos to choose from so you have to decide for yourself what your in the mood for. The seabass here is to die for. Not only is it a fatty, flavorful fish but the tenderness of it can be matched by nothing else. The teriyaki combo has a little bit of everything including chicken, salmon, beef, and various other things. Everything was always cooked to order, everything was always fresh and it's nice to know that you can wipe your taste buds clean with a complimentary bowl of ice cream at the end.

All in all you can't go wrong with a family owned shop that people always come back to. It's a great place to take the family or friends to go to once in a while and the atmosphere is amazing. I love coming here and suggest that you do the same.
author: Jason Y.

description:
Stumbling on to this place a while back was one of the best things I have ever done. The food is not only reasonably priced, it is delicious! The best thing on the menu by far is the Chicken Kara-age. Wow, so flavorful and the sauce that they put on it is out of this world good! It comes with a healthy portion of chicken, rice and salad and of course a starter of miso soup! YUMM!!! 

If your feeling really hungry, order the dinner plate for two, its huge! it usually comes with chicken teriyaki, beef teriyaki, salmon, chicken kara-age, and tempura!!! If you get any bento it comes with your choice of ice cream! GREEN TEA is the way to go!!

The last time i went their i had the dancing lion roll, Its a shrimp tempura roll with avacado topped with unagi! wow! it was delicious!!!

If your in the avenues you have to make the trip to Noriega!!
author: Rob G.

description:
My friends and I love Noriega Teriyaki!  My all time favorite is their crunchy roll and beef teriyaki.  Not only do they serve quality beef, but the salad that comes with it is delicious as well!  I don't really know what kind of dressing it is, but it's definitely addicting!  

The last time my friends and I went there was last Wednesday for a birthday party.  The staff was friendly as usual and extremely accommodating considering the number of people we had in our party.  All our meals came out at the same time and our server was very attentive to our needs.  We were all very pleased with the selection of rolls and nigiri the server recommended to us - fish was fresh and the presentation was excellent!  

Price is very reasonable considering people are charging more for food court meals than what Noriega Teriyaki is charging.  

I really want to rate them 4.5, but too bad we can't give half stars.  Minus half a star because it took me a while to find parking last time and I was ten minutes late for the party.
author: susie b.

description:
3.5 for their cheap unaju $9.95. almost 4 if they didn't burnt my eel, but it was still good. and i was hungry.

unagi is pretty much what i get every time i eat sushi. i wish they had more selections but i guess i'm in a wrong place? my friends got the "sushi for two" which looks really good. its a great choice if you want varieties. 

this is a convenient place for when my friends are craving sushi. parking is not that hard to find either. prices are average. i asked my friends who lives in the area why they come here and said that this is their default. Because their unaju was cheap and good, i thought Noriega deserved some recognition! (go see my pix)
author: Viola C.

description:
ok ok so 3.5 stars.

i come here because it's a short ride away on the 71. the rolls and bento boxes/chef's recommendation combos are of hearty american portions, the sukiyaki brimming with seafoodiness. the chicken teriyaki is alright, the chicken karaage moreish. the donburi is filling and comforting - great for when it's all grey and foggy outside, or when you haz a sad, seasoning it with your tears makes it extra derishuz. the tempura isn't of the delicate kind, but tasty enough and hits the spot. 

when i feel like more of a glutton than i usually am, i appreciate the bigass rolls, but there's no denying that the freshness and flavor of the seafood are lacking. quite a number of deep fried items in their rolls/deep fried rolls on the menu, as well as rolls with hella sauce in/on them, and those monster rolls with 5000 ingredients as pictured on their special rolls menu. that's basically what you're getting into when you come here, the rolls seem to overshadow the simpler makis, not in the best of ways, unless you're into the gluttonous extravagance.

the sashimi is not very choice, don't come here expecting the best of that. come here for fastfood-y type japanese food. i think the price is great for the portions given. yeah, come here to strictly nomz, not exactly to savor.
author: Eliza D.

description:
Note to self: Always always order sushi in a Japanese restaurant.
