description: Staff is ALWAYS friendly.  Prices are right.  Food is yummy.  My favorite roll is the Summer Roll which is avocado, strawberries, eel and crab.  Who puts strawberries in sushi?  Oh well, it's oh so good.  The only thing I disliked about this place was when we try to order appetizers.  They end up being oily, mayonaissy messes.  Otherwise, this is one is pretty good!
author: Jennifer N.

description:
I've been coming to this restaurant for ages. I love their tempura, and the sticky rice is excellent (a couple of years living in Japan gave me the taste for it!).
The prices are very reasonable and the atmosphere is nice. This is not a scandalously expensive place, but a great one to visit when friends come to town, especially ones who aren't familiar with Japanese food.
And delivery is quick and simple. Beyond what I expected.
author: Cherry S.

description: I used to love this place , but now that I know better .. I realized that this place isn't really as nice as it's made out to be . They have decent sushi at decent prices . I really like their spicy tuna roll .. it has just enough spice in it and its tastes so fresh ! The cherry blossom roll wasn't that good . The ny cheesecake is very good . They add whip cream , chocolate syrup & a cherry to it . It's perfect to finish off the meal . Not the best sushi but satisfactory . I would give this place 3 stars but because of how pretty the restaurant I'm give this place 4 stars . I swear .. this restaurant is very nice on the inside and they even have private rooms ! Good place to throw a party .
author: Eileen L.

description: Good service, okay food, an okay price. Not a bad place. I recommend going here with a party. It has that environment where you can go with friends and be social.
author: Sonlay V.

description:
surprise surprise! don't get the teriyaki! my chicken teriyaki was burned. but everything else is great, especially their sushi and sashimi (always fresh) and they have the best green tea ice cream i've ever had. their special rolls are awesome too, but too expensie. i'd opt for one their dinner combos just to get the miso soup and ice cream on the side. get their uni nigiri. they pile it on high.

update: don't get the amaebi heads! i've ordered it several times and it's never fried hard enough so i end up cutting my mouth. :(
author: Tin-Tin E.

description: I lve eating here, the place is small but the Seared Ahi is delicious. There is a rice vinegar sauce that is really good too.  The wait staff is prompt and friendly. I look forward to going back soon!
author: jen t.

description: Their food is just okay. Sashimi could be a lot fresher. There are always flying insects buzzing around and their teapots are dysfunctional so that tea always gets spilled on the table.  Their staff is very nice and the decor is cute, but it's nothing to rave about. It didn't always used to be this way. This restaurant used to be a lot better, cleanliness and food-wise.
author: Faye S.

description: I only visited this place once only because my girlfriend loves japanese food, so I was out for a adventure...instead ran into a nasty pit of sticky rice and blan flavors. Service was good and display was good, but where was the flavor. I tasted microwave meals that were better than what I ate.
author: David M.

description:
their menu looked promising, but their sukiyaki was horrible!

three slices of overcooked/really DRY beef, and it was all BEAN SPROUTS and three pieces of tofu. it was tasteless, i could've made better at home.

i felt like i was just eating a big cowl of bean sprouts... 

i might give it another shot one day since i live down the block.

but how can you mess up sukiyaki...??
author: Diana T.

description: went here for a bday party. the sushi was average, prices ok.
author: NY Y.

description: Service was terrific and prices were reasonable.  However, was so disappointed in the Nabeyaki Udon.  Their noodles were small and when you think Udon, you think Udon noodles.  There were also large chunks of fish and it made the broth taste funny.  Don't think I'll be back.
author: Stephanie Y.

description: The food is average......Service is okay, could use a little on customer service skills, I had to call a waiter several times before she notice. Clean atmosphere and great lighting. Great place to go for lunch though!
author: candice m.

description: Either the food has gotten worse or my palate has improved the last time i went to this place. The sukiyaki was half way decent and I never did get my ice cream. Their cooked salmon roll was awful, the salmon was over cooked and made the avocado turn a shade too dark for my taste. Not going back unless I have to. At one time i remember it being good. New chef?
author: Christopher C.

description: Great Sushi, pretty cheap, and they deliver.  What more do you want?This is where I usually go if i want sushi and i don't want to go far.
author: Raffi Y.

description: I will give them 4.5 stars~ The tropical roll (6 pcs) for $9.95 is great, but the price is kind of high~
author: Jun L.

description:
I've been to this restaurant many times already and I can say that I am satisfied each time I go. The prices are fair and the proportions are decent as well. So I would suggest this restaurant to people who are craving Japanese food, but I do suggest you watch out for one waitress. 

At first glance, I didn't feel comfortable when she came up to me to ask how many people in my party because of her appearance. All I can say is that she didn't fit into the restaurant because it seemed like she was ready for a party. Let's just say, if we put her in a closet, her hair would glow in the dark.
author: Tom L.

description: One of the few sushi places open on Sundays!!! This place is not my favorite, but it's so darn convenient!  Aside from the convenience factor, they have a lot of different rolls you can try.
author: Carrie-C N.

description:
Hmmm,don't know which is worse?this one or Noriega Okazuya?
Okay they're about the same.
author: Kathy M.

description: This used to be one of my favorite places to go in the neighborhood for a relaxed dinner. They also deliver, and that saved my ass on a couple of occasions. The restaurant is clean and cute, with nice service and typical selection of rolls and Japanese cuisine. The only thing that turned me off, was the last time I went there the tuna I ordered was frozen when they brought it out.
author: Dixon T.

description:
so this place in my eyes is always worth the drive. okay...i dont live that far :)
i actually live in san francisco.
but their tempura rolls are off the hook! they put two pieces of shrimp, which makes them a little hard to eat if u have a small mouth.
service is not consistent. the first time i went, they were really nice--which is why i chose to come back. the next two times, not so great...
the food is definitely redeeming.
author: Bee B.

description:
Noriega Teriyaki House is a good restaurant for sushi.  I was not very impressed with the sashimi, it doesn't seem as fresh than most I've tried.  I come here often for a nice variety of sushi, since the prices are fair and the portions are large.  It never gets too busy, so we can always rely on Noriega  Teriyaki house for a quick sushi sit down! 
- Lora Lea Binaley
author: Lora B.

description: I really enjoy this place- fresh good- fast, their green tea ice cream is awesome! A bit expensive, but I would def. come back multiple times!
author: Danielle L.

description: This place is great because they actually do delivery with a $15 purchase!  The udon was good, but I ordered some sushi along with that and it got really warm from it being in the same bag as the udon.  Also they gave me a free creme puff with my order!  Sushi was so-so, but udon was good.
author: Kate S.

description: No. Bad. Ordered for delivery while hung over one sunday and what was delivered I dont want to call food. The sushi was bad. You shouldnt be allowed call yourself a teriyaki house when your teriyaki is terrible. Granted its cheap and delivers but if you have any sort of tastebuds in your mouth dont eat this.
author: Bret H.

description: Great food and decent prices.  One of my favorite restaurants.   Stay away from their Udon though.  It's absolutely gross.  It's worse than those instant noodle packages at safeway.  Other than that, everything else is pretty good.  I especially like their beef teriyaki combo plate.
author: Nicholas W.

description: I only went here like twice and both times, I had a good experience.  By experience, I mean that the food and the service was up to my expectation.  Ordering the bento box usually consist of me sharing with a friend because it's something I couldn't finish on my own.  And the sushi, I forget which rolls, were usually very tasty.  Haha, this review doesn't help at all.  All I can say is that I really enjoyed my food and my stay in this restaurant.  However, this place can be a bit pricey.  All in all, I still came out with a smile!
author: MaryGrace V.

description: Being part Japanese, I'm pretty critical with Japanese restaurants.  I always get their food delivered since they have free delivery.  The prices are decent and their sushi/sashimi is not traditional, but good enough.  As being a patron that has eaten in their restaurant (three times), they have great service and are always willing to get you what you need.  I always get their Teriyaki Beef which should be named Fatty Teriyaki Beef.  I actually have to use my hands and pull and trim off the fat off the meat.  Besides that, it's well cooked and tender.  If you want decent Japanese food, come here!  If you're looking for traditional Japanese food, I would look at other places.
author: Manton R.

description:
this place might be a little better than No Name Sushi, but that isn't saying much!

i gave the chinese sushi chef a chance to serve me his freshest fish for the evening and he served me hamachi and smoked salmon. the hamachi wasn't so bad but clearly if smoked salmon is on the "fresh" list then something is rotten in denmark. 

i switched the focus to rolls and admittedly, their tempura spicy tuna roll isn't so bad except that all other special rolls bear a remarkable resemblance to one another. 

the service is terrible. my green tea was filled once - when it was first served to me. and price-wise, it wasn't much of a bargain.
author: Baochi N.

description:
good vegetarian sushi
great miso soup and seaweed salad
friendly staff

and its right next to my house :)
author: Alicia V.

description: This sushi place is ok. There are lots of better ones in the city. The sushi is fresh, but it takes them forever to make it. The prices aren't very high, but still it rreally isn't worth it. There are better places.
author: Nikita K.

description: Parking was a challenge and I had to wait 10 mins for a table at this bustling Japanese restaurant this Sunday evening.  The Caterpillar Roll was great and my friend's crispy salmon plate looked really good (I had a bit and it tasted as good as it looked!)..... Nice service!
author: Patricia M.

description: What can I say about this place. For one, the outer sunset is a ways from my place and while the sushi was decent, I would not go out of my way to return to the Noriega House. Second, it seems to be the spot for big asian family reunions. What you make of this is up to you.
author: Faye P.

description: I've only been to this restaurant a few times, but I can say that given the normalcy of the Japanese fare at this place, I would definitely opt for Tani's Kitchen just down 19th Ave. or head over to Taraval Okazu Ya. Those other two places offer better prices and better food. Not saying that the food in this place is bad, but that there are better options out there.
author: Joshua C.

description:
i call this place noriyaki.

there's not much to say about a chinese run japanese place.  it fits right in there with the characteristics you may expect:

1.) large portions
2.) reasonable prices

the rest is best to west (someone said that somewhere about something).

big rolls, plentiful udon, and lots of seating.
author: Ameer N.

description: Good sushi, kind of typical...a bit pricy, but the food is good
author: Jay L.

description: This place . .  man not sure if I've ever been ignored more.  I go in for dinner around 6p on a weekday.  it was a little crowded, but there were seats available in the main area around the bar.  It took them 15 minutes to seat me at an empty, unreserved table.  I noticed other people walking in and they got seating right away.  That's the thing that pissed me off the most.  What kind of crap is that? Then it took another 20 minutes to wave down a waitress.  When they took my order and I got my food, I wasn't impressed.  Won't be going there again!
author: D M.

description:
My family and I have been coming here since they used to be on 22nd & Noriega. Back then, the service was great! The workers there recognized us and treated us very well. Even now the same workers from before still greet us, and occasionally give us a special dessert. The bad thing is that there are more workers now which aren't very friendly and don't do a great job. The food is good. It's not authentic Japanese food though. They are chinese, and I know that because I hear them speaking it to one another. We still come here even though the service has gone down because we keep hoping that it will be like it was once before. But it still hasn't lived up to our expectations. It takes forever for a waiter to come take your order. When they bring you plates, they just plop it down at the end of the table. It would be better if they actually handed us our plates individually. But no, we have to do it ourselves.

Food: Good but not something to die for.

Service: Mostly bad.
author: Steph C.

description: Good for the money.  The quality is not bad but i wouldn't say it's one of the best sushi in town.  The ika and amaebi are very fresh though.
author: Mary L.

description: It's a nice place to eat. Good Japanese food for the money. You get a good amount of food for a good price. The sushi is good and you get a good portion. i usually order the spider rainbow roll and the Dragon Roll.
author: Larry V.

description: One of my favorite sushi places ever! Easy to get seated! Staff is always happy and bubbly! Love their sushi~! Great neighborhood! Parking can be crazy, but the food is worth it!
author: christine d.

description:
great food.. not always great service... its hard to get their attention but they are nice.. one of the last times i was there for lunch.. my sister went to drink her cup of beer and the bottom of the glass fell off and beer was everywhere.. the table, our food, HER.. so they came over and LAUGHED and put a few napkins on the table.. didn't even help clean it.

again, the food is always good but the service and help sucks. 

parking is usually pretty easy. theres always something

the price ranges arent bad at all. its worth it.

my fav is the ice cream at the end of the meal. yum!
author: patty s.

description: I was told by one of my customers to check this restaurant out. As soon as I arrived it was packed full of people. The hostess was really nice and constantly checked on me while I waited for my food to be ready for take-out. The food was amazing! I have never eaten anything to fresh! The sushi was remarkable! I highly recommend it to anyone!! They also give yummy ice cream to anyone who orders a meal! Check it out!
author: Elysha O.

description:
A bunch of us came here for my birthday dinner celebration and I must say this is one of the tastiest Japanese restaurants I've been to.  I normally go to JTown, but I've noticed that most are not authentic like I thought they were.  I've seen hispanic chefs, chinese chefs, korean chefs, you name it chef.  With that said, I decided to be adventurous and try something new.  The place was packed and unfortunately, we didn't think ahead to make reservation, so we had to wait.  Bummer!!!

Clean place, warm ambience, friendly staff, and tasty food.  Took a while to get my food because the place was packed.  Like hoarders, we ordered tons of sushi and teriyaki dishes.  The raw fishes were fresh, and the teriyaki sauce was amazing - perfect for the palette.  I could down three of those cups with my rice!  Top it all, I even got a free fried banana ice cream for my birthday dessert.  Sweet deal!
author: Gina R.

description: On average.  Young staff was friendly, and prompt!  Sushi not bad... not stunning!
author: Sarah R.

description: Pretty good around the way sushi place. They ways accommodate our large groups just fine. Great service but gets pretty crowded on weekends so plan accordingly.
author: Eddie L.

description: The portions are sizeable, but the food can be hit or miss. I tried their poke and it was too spicy for my palette. When the server why I had eaten so little, I explained it was a bit spicy and she said she thought I liked it that way (?!) Parking isn't horrible and the place can get busy during dinner time. The chirashi is a good deal.
author: chip n. c.

description: I am usually here at least once a month with my kids.  We have always gotten great service from the staff.  They are very accomodating.  Great tasting food and excellent service.  I enjoy eating here and my kids absolutely love it.
author: Brian O.

description: I don't know where all these 4 stars review come from but the food here SUCKS.  Ordering a dinner box and being served HARD ASS RICE is beyond acceptable.  One order of chicken teriyaki was dry as hell and the red bean ice cream that accompany it after was a JOKE.  Why was it half way melted before even getting to the table?   If this place was put in the Richmond District, I suspect it probably would had went belly up a while ago.    Plain nasty dinner tonight.
author: Guess G.

description: somewhat good.  i think i had to tiger roll?? i forgot. this place gives out big portions on their rice entrees! a big plus. fair prices. would come again. warning: food takes about 15-20mins to arrive upon ordering
author: Ann L.

description: 1 star for inexpensive prices + 1 star for large meals and generous portions + 1 star for food arriving fast each time i have been there (about 4 times).  however the quality is not super, and for some reason doesn't feel too fresh which is kind of important if you are eating sushi.  but i guess it is a teriyaki house, and it's tasty and satisfactory enough, if u think of it more like a japanese fast food place.
author: Kari L.

description: This is the best Japanese restaurant I have ever been to.  The 43 pieces Sushi Platter is the platter to die for.  They have lovely pictures on their menu which helps us to choose.  Sushi & Sashimi = fresh, fresh, fresh !! Prices = cheap, cheap, cheap............definitely somewhere to go back to again and again !!
author: lisa m.

description: i had a couple good meals here. the rolls were good and fresh. and the setting was quite pleasant.   i dont think i ever tried teriyaki anything here, but i assume its chill. who knows though, dogs? who knows...
author: Victor B.

description: I had the Beef Teriyaki meal from here (which includes salad, miso soup, and ice cream) around $10-12 3 times in the past 2 weeks. Why you ask, because I've been having cravings. Oddly enough I've eaten here occasionaly (a couple times a year) since I was in elementary school, over 10 year now--but recently I can't stop. Probably it's because I jsut came back from New York (where I live now) and haven't had much Japanese food there. It's just not the same! So, for the few weeks I am here visiting family its been Noriega for all my beef and chicken teriyaki needs. It's moderately priced considering Japanese food is never cheap, has a friendly staff, and clean facilities. It's a good date spot but is aslo cool to have group parties here- there is a private room. It's also one of those neighborhood spots that you run into everyone at --good because people like the food but bad because you might not like who you run into (people from high school, etc.).
author: Catherine M.

description: I've been going to Noriega Teriyaki  for years.  It's good Japanese food at reasonable prices.  Since the restaurant is located across the street from Walgreens, I always stop by for lunch or take out when I pick up a prescription.   I like the seafood udon noodles.
author: c v.

description: Not the best Japanese restaurant I've been to, but still not bad at all.  I had a chicken soba and it was delicious.  (Also made me realized i like soba a.k.a. black noodles more than udon a.k.a. white noodles.)  The atmosphere was warm and nice.  They had decors that make you not surprise you're in a Japanese restaurant.  The waiters were nice, young, and dress in traditional clothes, or maybe just the tops.  The price was reasonable.  (My soba cost about $8.95.)
author: Karen C.

description: i usually get the sashimi combo deluxe here and have to say the quality of the fish is much higher than many other japanese restaurants in the sunset. even though this place is a bit more expensive, theres a reason: quality. i sometimes get it to go and they even give me the miso soup to go even though it says its only for sit down customers.
author: Bobby J.

description: we came here for dinner last night and i was not dissapointed. the tempura udon that we ordered were quite good. the tempura were consist of: 2 prawns, string beans, onion rings, zucchinis, eggplants, broccoli, and potatoes..that was a LOT of food, plus the generous portion of udon. we also ordered a roll of tuna tempura and we were delighted that  it was also delicious. moreover, they give you a side of pickled cucumber with a drizzle of miso dressing and a fruit flavored gelatin at the end of your meal.
author: Nelle A.

description: We went here one night out of pure desperation. I wanted something in the neighborhood and my husband just wanted to eat.  Settled.  We've eaten here before and even walked away with one of those cute little ceramic cats they were giving away when you spent over fifty dollars.  I think we just went on a bad night and the vomit about three steps outside their door should have been a big ass red flag. We eventually got seated however, the waitress took about twenty minutes to actually get around to us. It was a Monday and there were only two waitresses working. Not their normal staff.  We ordered some sushi rolls, two dinners, and fried calamari.  It was the strangest meal I have ever had. Okay, not the strangest, but it does get an honorable mention. We got our cucumber salad but it didn't have the lemony dressing on it( i like the dressing) and soup, so it started out normal enough.  But then our dinner came.  Um, did they forget our sushi rolls and our calamari?  Nope.  The calamari came when we were halfway done with dinner and the rolls came when we were finished with our meal.  First of all, the calamari was awful. The batter thick and cakey and not what we expected.  We ordered wrong.  But by the time the rolls came, we were both full.  I hate leftover sushi. The rice gets hard and who wants day old seafood or avocado?  I couldn't eat more then two pieces and the rest the rolls i ordered went to waste.  My husband finished everything he ordered, except the calamari.  I guess it's safe to say that this will not be a regular haunt for us.  The food is just ok, but only if you're in the neighborhood, you don't want to drive anywhere else, or every other sushi joint is closed.  I gave it two stars because in the past, we had a good experience, and also, the food is ok. Cheers~
author: kim s.

description: fat rolls - good & tasty decent variety
author: Len A.

description: The fish is not fresh here. I had a sushi combo and the San Francisco roll and did not enjoy the hamachi or the unagi. Pretty disappointed. The prices are fair, there is a lot of choices, and food seems to look very nice coming out but not the best going down. The customers do come though!
author: Q C.

description:
i actually really like this place!

sake lovers? order the double sake roll and eat until your heart is filled with sake-goodness! it's kinda pricey for a roll ($10 something), but i dig it because it's hella fat. 

free jelly dessert sometimes. i'm still trying to figure out what warrants a free jelly dessert and what doesn't. 

free ice cream dessert to those who order a meal. chicken katsu's pretty good, and it's huge..enough for 2 ppl. 

the staff is generally really friendly, and often will greet you upon arrival and departure. 

minus one star because it is damn near impossible to get a glass of water in this place. and if by some miracle of god you do receive a (small) glass of water, ration that sucker because you'll likely not get a refill.
author: elaine v.
